Reviews.Title: “We couldn't have liked it more”
Reviews.Author: RossiterSpain
Reviews.Content: Having chosen the hotel from TripAdvisor's reviews we can only reiterate all the compliments other guests have paid. We left the hotel hoping we shall return to Rome and undoubtedly will stay there and strongly recommend anyone to do the same. Barbara, Donato, Robert, Marjorie, May, Adriano and Nestor all went out of their way to welcome us and help us with any questions we had. We have travelled widely and have never encountered such charming and helpful staff. I won't repeat all previous reviews by other guests but will mention that the rooms have a kettle and coffee/tea making facilities, a mini-bar and a safe. SKY TV in English (when we were shown how) gave us Midsummer Murders, NCIS etc. to help us relax after long sightseeing days. Comfortable bed, scrupulously clean room and bathroom. What more could you need?

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and in a good central location”
Reviews.Author: Jane187061
Reviews.Content: Having read previous trip advisor reviews we decided to stay in this hotel - a very good decision. It is very well located for exploring Rome, with a lot within walking distance. The rooms were clean and a good size. The friendly and helpful staff were always available to advise on how best to get around, where to go and to help with travel arrangements.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marcay
Reviews.Content: I have been to Rome several times and this is the only hotel I will stay in. The family owned inn is lovely with fresh flowers in each room. Each morning is started with a nice breakfast and a very helpful staff to guide you on any part of Rome you need to see for pleasure or business. If you are not familiar with where you should have lunch or dinner, Robert is very helpful in giving some fresh ideas. Location, location, location...is perfect you can walk to any destination in a short amount of time. Buy a bottle of wine and enjoy a drink on the lovely terrace. Barbara and Donato make every effort to make your visit a lovely one.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel good quiet location”
Reviews.Author: JJSYD
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and found it charming. All staff especially Robert did everything to make us welcome. The lift is a little awkward with a lot of luggage but that us part of the charm. Breakfast goo d and above all we found the hotel a haven from the frenetic pace if Rome !

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: TravelinCouple_9
Reviews.Content: We read the good reviews for Residenza Cellini on tripadvisor. So our expectations were rather high. But the experience was even better. This is a small hotel on the third floor near the Piazza della Republica, convenient to Metro and bus stops. Guests have to navigate the quaint but small elevator. But once you pass the entrance into the hotel, the quality of the staff immediately impresses. They are extraordinarily attentive, hospitable and helpful. We stayed at first for one night in a spacious room with balcony. Then left for Florence for 5 days. We asked if we could leave luggage with them, store some valuables at the front desk's safe and have the same room. No problem. On our return, we relaxed with complimentary prosecco on their fifth floor terrace. At the end of every day, it was a delight to come back here. We were greeted like old friends. If you want a totaly wonderful Roman holiday, stay here! P.S, great morning coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but some reservations”
Reviews.Author: Harry1Melbourne
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights after reading Trip Advisor reviews. It certainly is very clean and staff helpful. However the shower was tiny, I couldn't even wash my hair (and I am not large!). the location is a little way from the centre but close to public transport. Also the front stairs and TINY lift might be charming, but very difficult to negotiate with suitcases, particularly when you have a back injury. Breakfast was average.

Reviews.Title: “Well located”
Reviews.Author: cftjw
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel, once again using TA reviews and wasn't disappointed. It is centrally located, very clean, the staff are friendly and helpful. Our suite No2 on the 3rd floor (this hotel is located on the 3rd and 5th floor of a building) was quite large with a good sized bathroom and the usual toiletries. The hairdryer was only usable whilst standing in the bath, which wasn't ideal! We like to sllep with a window open, but whilst the noise level was absolutley fine, the sewage smell was not. There is a delightful terrace on the 5th floor that you can use, especially nice when drinking the bottle given to you by the owner. Residenza Cellini is near to a metro station and railway station, also a stop for the open top tour bus, but also for walking to various attractions - ie spainish steps, trevi fountain and all. We stayed herer with friends and had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “On a scale of 1 to 10 this hotel is a 15”
Reviews.Author: Linda P
Reviews.Content: Residenza Cellini was one of the best parts of our ten night stay in Rome.This small hotel is beautifully appointed and immaculately clean. It is very well located. We were concerned about being in a safe neighborhood and a quiet location. The hotel met both of these needs beautifully. We were provided all the little extras like wi-fi, a laptop for the guest's use, minibar, a wonderful breakfast, safe in the room, heated towel rack, and other amenities. The beds are of the highest quality and provided a really good night's sleep - and they were heated! Just the thing for a tired traveler's body. But the best part of Residenza Cellini is the way we were treated. We were immediately made to feel right at home. Any of our needs were met immediately. They made reservations for us even before we arrived and continued to provide every assistance including recommendations and even bus routes. My friend and I were always greeted warmly by Robert in the evening and he always listened to our adventures of the day and saved us with a smile when I blew the circuit breaker (twice) trying to charge my phone. He, along with Marjorie in the morning, were delightful. To add to that the owner and her brother, Barbara and Donato De Paolis, were so friendly and welcoming (not to mention beautiful and handsome) . We enjoyed their company and conversations so much. I'll never forget Barbara serving us Asti on a beautiful service tray in our room. And Donato knew the best restaurants and even stores to recommend. You cannot help but enjoy your stay at lovely and tasteful Residenza Cellini

Reviews.Title: “They made us feel so at home!”
Reviews.Author: SRR52
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Residenza Cellini made the trip feel like home. We would not have had such a relaxing time had it not been for the ability to escape from Rome's bustling activity into the comfort and tranquility of Residenza Cellini. The staff went above and beyond to make us feel comfortable and welcome; and the rooms were so very clean and comfortable. It is an amazing place that is a welcome change from the "executive feel" of a large hotel. We would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Worth it in every sense”
Reviews.Author: VeronicaJarrin
Reviews.Content: Before booking, I checked at least 50 other hotels but did not find anything worth it in price and location. After staying in Residenza Cellini, I would do it again. Beautiful, silent rooms, very practical location, very good breakfast and great service! I cannot think of a better location because it is accessible by bus (so many lines that is amazing), metro, train and taxis. In addition, the rooms are cute, beautiful and the service is wonderful. During two occassions they provided me with very early breakfast. Thanks Residenza Cellini! I had a wonderful time! Very relaxing!!

Reviews.Title: “anonymously but nice”
Reviews.Author: Ebbot
Reviews.Content: I don't know the standard of the hotels i Rome, if you compare to London or Paris it should be at least 5 stars. So this is estimated on a general standard, not compared to the cities above. Clean, good location, nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Anonymous small clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Meta888
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very anonymous from the outside. A small street , a large doorway and just a small golden sign at the wall, that said Residenza Cellini 3:rd floor. When you entered the door we found a staricase and an old elevator, but no signs for the hotel, not even in the elevator. But the hotel was located on the third floor behind a glass door. The hotel also had rooms on the fifth floor and also a small terrace up there. Our room and bathroom was small but clean with enough space for suitcases and a big cupboard. It also had a safetybox and a minibar. The first day the wireness internet didn't work in our room, but this was fixed on the second day of our stay. The hotel also had a laptop for guests to use for free. Breakfast was included but it mostly consisted of sweets. No dark bread or toast. I didn´t understand if I should put the cheese, ham, salami etc on top of sweet buns? I missed bread! I saw that most guests had coffee, youghurt and fruits for breakfast. I don´t know who eats cookies in the morning. No one I saw. I experienced the hotel as very safe as you had to ring two bells to get in and the reception was staffed for 24 hours. According to the the decent hotel price this hotel was good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Taner3
Reviews.Content: I jsu returned from a 4 night stay at RC with my wife and daughter. The location is very good, only 5 minutes walk from the metro station Republicca. We got an upgrade from triple to a junior suite. The staff (especially Robert who was there in the evening shift) were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is located in an old building with high ceilings, a very cute elevator probably a centrury old. The decoration and furnishing is tasteful. The main reason we chose to stay here was the ranking/reviews on tripadvisorand we are glad we stayed there. By the way, there are other facilities in the same building such as Suitedreams, Hotel Adler, etc. However, RC has received the best reviews. The room rates were discounted due to the low season. I chose to pay cash and received another discount for that. We also received a nice bottle of Chianti. Will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Trek4life
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights and it was fantastic. They've taken one floor of a historic building with a lot of character and turned it into a beautiful sanctuary. If you've stayed at one of the upscale-boutique Kimpton brand hotels in the U.S. you'll find Residenza Cellini pleasantly familiar. Our large, king-bed room was spotlessly clean, elegantly decorated, and extremely comfortable. The location was central to everything we wanted to see and in the heart of Rome, but our room was very peaceful and quiet. Barbra and her staff provided impeccable service to include bringing cappuccino to our room every morning, providing fresh flowers, and even a complimentary bottle of Spumanti. Robert and Margi gave great restaurant recommendations and went out of their way to make sure we were comfortable. We got an off-season rate of 110 euro (paying cash) that included breakfast and internet. This hotel was by far the "best of the best" for value, quality, service, and location. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, large & quiet room, free wifi, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Junbug4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Residenza Cellini based on a friend's recommendation. We were not disappointed! We stayed for 3 nights over New Years 2011. Our room was wonderful with a very comfortable bed. The linens on the bed were the best. The location is great for walking everywhere and getting to and from Termini. The breakfasts are perfect to start the day. But the best part is the staff. They were the most pleasant and helpful hotel staff that I have encountered. They arranged for airport transportation early on New Year's Day which was great. I highly recommend staying here, an excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, nice room, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: AForner
Reviews.Content: Hi! Once we worked out that 'hotels' in Rome share buildings and that Cellini was inside and upstairs at Hotel Adler we found it to be a great spot for our long walks around Rome. Our room, which had a jacuzzi was always clean, well-serviced, quiet and comfortable and we enjoyed meeting others from around the world in the breakfast room. It kind of felt more like a B&B than a Hotel and the only issue I had was I couldn't get the wireless router to talk to my laptop...so I had to use the hotel laptop. The staff were great and had to send my camera charger on, which I left under the bedside table. We stayed for seven nights.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel on 3rd floor close to Termini”
Reviews.Author: poultrip
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. People are very friendly and are helpfull. I was missing the possibility to make coffee in the room. The shower didn't worked ok and it wasn't fixed. When leaving the machine for creditcard didn't worked. Several times I asked for them to draw the money from the creditcard which I had made the reservation with because I had to leave to reach my airplane. Except for these things the hotel is ok.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding place to call home.”
Reviews.Author: ChrisandJess2006
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Cellini for four nights during the snow storm of 2012. It had not snowed in Rome during the prior 26 years. The Cellini was a great place to call home during those bitter cold days. The place was always attended, always warm, and they had an assortment of umbrellas to choose from. We loved their old-fashioned lift with the wrought iron gate and glass double doors - it was very nostalgic. This place is within walking distance of the train station and is very near Line A of the Meteo. The staff at the front desk spoke English which was a bonus. The breakfast was of coffee to order, pasteries, fresh fruit, yoghurt, cold cerial , and a meat and cheese platter in a nice sunny room with classical music in the background. The rooms are spotless and the bathrooms have a towel warmer and bedet. It is secure since the front door has a buzzer security system. Also, the wi fi was flawless. We very much liked this place especially for 110 euro per night (off-season rate).

Reviews.Title: “Loverly Place - excellent service”
Reviews.Author: marcam03
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend in November 2011 and it was a fantastic stay. we were in a junior suite with a jaccuzzi in the bathrrom. The room was huge and very quiet at night. the location was perfect and very near to the starting point for the red bus tour which was very handy - we bought a 3 day ticket and used the bus as our transport for the whole weekend. It's an ok location for restaurants - not a huge amount happening nearby. The breakfast was excellent and it was frequently replenished which was important. All in all a very good stay with great deals for the off season

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff - extra thoughful”
Reviews.Author: NewOrleansTravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Residenza Cellini over the Christmas holidays. It's located within walking distance to all the Roman attractions but still in a quiet street. The staff was very attentive. We had checked out for a night to take a quick trip to Venice and asked to see if we could leave our bigger suitcase there, since we were returning back to Residenza Cellini for our last night in Rome. When we got back, they had taken our suitcase already to the new room and had a bottle of sparkling wine ready for us. The room was very clean and the staff made cappuchino for us every morning! Loved the place and would certainly recommend it. BTW, if you are looking for a good place to eat, do try Target, the restaurant in the corner. The staff at Residenza had recommended and it truly was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic accommodation in Rome”
Reviews.Author: fionah_10_12
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Residenza Cellini Hotel in November - great service and location, even enjoyed a complimentatry bottle of wine on the terrace from the lovely owner.

Reviews.Title: “Residenza Cellini gets our highest recommendation!”
Reviews.Author: palace187
Reviews.Content: If you're visiting Rome, this is the place to stay at. It will exceed your expectations in terms of beauty, cleanliness, location, comfort, and customer service. It is located in the center of Rome, near Piazza Barberini, within walking distance to shops, cafes, restaurants, and bus stops. We have stayed in many similar hotels and can confidently say that you will be very pleased with your experience at Residenza Cellini. Their breakfast service in the morning is like having access to a full service bar... and it's available even if you sleep in. We also liked that our room was so quiet--something to consider when staying in a city like Rome. Every detail is considered. Thank you, Barbara, Donato, and Gaetano for making our stay in Rome so comfortable and unforgettable!

Reviews.Title: “Gracious Living!”
Reviews.Author: chinghiss6
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Christmas 2011 and were absolutely pleased and delighted with the clean, charming room, the very gracious and helpful staff and all the small appointments--including the candies, orchids and wine-- that helped make our time in Rome so special. A superb establishment!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location but noisy glass collection every night”
Reviews.Author: kiwiklan
Reviews.Content: Excellent 2 bedroom apartment in a great location. Nice and secure, plenty of room, easy access to the whole of Rome (really close to the Vatican), very clean and great hosts. This is a self service apartment with no room service but has a full kitchen and is close to many restaurants (hence the recycling collection every night we were there - and I think they aim to break every bottle : ( We are a family of 5 and is was very spacious. Good corner stores all around.

Reviews.Title: “Just fabulous - the friendliest hotel ever.”
Reviews.Author: Mai278
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this family owned hotel during December 2011. We cannot praise this hotel enough. The decor and ambiance is classic and sophisticated yet so comfortable and welcoming. It is situated very close to the metro station and the bus termini so is very convenient for all the sites, but you can walk to most of the sites from here too. There are many restaurants in the immediate vicinity and the staff can make recommendations but also explore the back streets for the best. We found several just off the Via Nazionale which were excellent and just a 10 minute walk from this hotel. As reviewed previously the rooms are spread over 2 floors with the upper floor having a lovely terrace. We had a family suite which slept 4 most comfortably, was spacious, very clean, and with a beautiful and spacious marble bathroom with a whirlpool bath and shower. The staff are the best and friendliest we have ever encountered during our extensive travels. Robert is the font of all knowledge and so helpful and accomodating, and Gerry and the girls were just delightful. Barbara is the owner of the hotel and both she and her brother are very charming. Nothing is too much trouble. We were very sad to leave and look forward immensely to our next visit. Treat yourselves and stay here - you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to our next stay!”
Reviews.Author: MapleLeafExpat
Reviews.Content: Rest assured that you will make an excellent choice with the Residenza Cellini. A dream holiday in Rome can quickly turn into a nightmare if you have booked a sub-standard hotel. When I travel I want accommodation that is spotlessly clean, a large and comfortable bed with quality bedding, quiet and bright surroundings, unobtrusive yet knowledgeable professional staff, a location where you can feel the pulse of the real city, convenient to transit...and all that and more at a fair price.The staff and owners of the Residenza Cellini work very hard to exceed their guests' expectations, and they definitely exceeded mine. Our family of three adults stayed in a triple room for nine nights in November and December, 2011, and we thoroughly enjoyed our home-away-from-home. We appreciated Rome all the more knowing that a great rest awaited us at the end of a long day of walking and exploring, and knowing that the next day would begin with a lovely, homey breakfast buffet. Many thanks to the Residenza Cellini for all their care and attention to detail. We look forward to our next visit to Rome, and our next stay at Residenza Cellini.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and location”
Reviews.Author: Gochito
Reviews.Content: Service was the best, everybody was friendly and helpful. The room was perfectly clean, including the bathroom. I had a king bed. I was there in November 2011, and the hot water from the shower was perfect and had good pressure. The hotel is located on the 3rd floor of a building, and my room was located on the 5th floor,, no noise at all from the street. The breakfast was very good, there was bread, ham, cheese, peach and orange juice, cookies, etc. The cappuccinos were delicious. The location is clean and safe. The hotel is located in a narrow street, only 1.5 blocks from the metro station Repubblica, a 5-10-min walk from Termini Station and 1 block from via Nazionale, where plenty of buses stop. When I come back to Rome, I will definitively stay at Residenza Cellini again.

Reviews.Title: “hotel review”
Reviews.Author: kittyglo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Residenza Cellini in November for 4 nights. Not only was this hotel close to the major sites but great location for the railway too. Although it was quite centrally and pretty close to the hub, there was hardly any noise. The staff were extremely helpful and knowledgeable coming up with ideas/suggestions and recommendation - very useful for a first time visitor to Rome. Will highly recommend Room 6 which had a view of the courtyard and very quite. Would definitely recommend this hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: crazyplanner44
Reviews.Content: We were looking for the perfect Roman getaway prior to leaving for a 12 day cruise. Well, we got it. It was easy to find and the hotel staff was very helpful with transfer arrangements from the airport and to the port. Rooms were beautiful and clean. Breakfast was more than we could ask for. Well worth the research.

Reviews.Title: “hotel review”
Reviews.Author: Gina A
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Residenza Cellini in late October for 4 nights. We had a wonderful experience with this hotel. It is a beautiful property, clean, safe and good location with convenient transportation nearby. The breakfast was good and a very friendly, informative, accomodating and professional staff. When I return to Rome, I would certainly stay at the Residenza Cellini.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: holidaytragic
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay, we had the juniour suite which was spacious and very Roman. Staff were very helpful. Location was good.Breakfast was plentiful, but breakfast room very small. Perfect if you are looking for B and B type accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “excellent accomodations and advice”
Reviews.Author: happyFreisen
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Residenza Cellini in late November. They were most helpful with providing an extra pillow when needed and providing advice on restaurants and best routes to take in Rome. Our flight home was very early and a breakfast was brought to our room! The room was warm, but opening the window solved this problem. The owner of the Residenza Cellini welcomed us with a bottle of sparkling wine and snack. We enjoyed it on the private terrasse. We would definitely return to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: rovyyug
Reviews.Content: i chose this hotel because of the rave reviews it's had. Don't get me wrong, the whole place was absolutely spotless and the staff were very nice but I think it's overpriced for what you get. The breakfast was adequate and the room it's served in is very small and hot. As mentioned in another review, the bath tub was very slippery and I hurt myself when I slipped trying to get out.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room and Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Karen C
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in this hotel at the end of our 16 day trip to Italy. Our room was beautiful and the staff could not have been more accomodating. They just couldn't do enough to help us with directions, taxis, restaurant recommendations. On our last morning, we had to leave before the scheduled breakfast time to get to the airport and they set up breakfast just for us. It's a little tricky to find so we would recommend taking a taxi from the train station upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: “A small gem in the center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Ahuva
Reviews.Content: I have to say that the Cellini is one of the few places that looks in real life like its photos, and I cannot agree with those who have said otherwise in their reviews. As you enter the building, there ARE 5 steps to go up until you reach the small elevator to the 3rd floor. As you enter the Residenza door, you are greeted by lovely classical music, a brightly lit hallway with a wide corridor, flowers and a spacious feeling, very untypical of such establishments.The double room I got (6), was at the end of the hall, and very quiet.It had an EXCELLENT bed, good lighting, a minibar, in which I could keep food I needed,WONDERFUL, FLUFFY TOWELS, AND EVEN A RADIO (which unfortunately didn't give me classical music). There were two little welcome dishes with chocolates and amaretti, yet one more nice touch to make you feel welcome. The staff- particularly Margie and Robert- were all very helpful and kind, and were able to assist even with the computer I couldn't manage.The breakfast was pretty standard, but nicely presented.I requested to have whole wheat rolls and a milk alternative , and the next morning everything was available for me. Perhaps the most remarkable thing was a gesture by the owner, Barbara de Paolis, who did something of such integrity, that it is hard to match: I had been given a special price that had been advertised on the internet. On the evening before I left I went out for dinner with friends, and upon my return I found an envelope addressed to me in my room. It was from Barbara who wrote me a wonderful note (I am fluent in Italian, so no problem there) and she said that she had left a note at the desk saying that since I was using a double room as a single, I was to have gotten another 10 euro off the price, but the note had been overlooked. I had never known about this arrangement, and she could just as well never have told me. But she did, and returned the difference in price , in cash, in the envelope. I think that such behavior is truly remarkable, and is to be commended.That alone is a reason to go back and send others. But also the fact that they made me breakfast at 5.40 in the morning when I had to leave for an early flight says a lot about a place. I did have some small criticisms, which I hope will be taken care of by the owners: 1) there are no hooks in the bathroom on which to hang anything, like a robe, etc.That needs to be done.2)There should be a pad and pen in every room, and that is even more important than the sweets! 3) The shower is VERY SLIPPERY and as a result very dangerous. There should be a mat in it. These are small things which can easily be fixed, and I hope they will be. But the location, the spotless cleanliness, the atmosphere and the welcome- all make it a wonderful place to be in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Everything they say is true”
Reviews.Author: Higgins_11
Reviews.Content: Everything they say about the Cellini is true. It is a great b and b. Clean as a new pin, friendly as your best buddy, courteous as m'lord, and as obliging as as personal butler. Centally situated, near the Republica, with an elevated open air terrace to enjoy a bottle of wine or a cigar, they do not come better than this. An oasis of peace in a mad, crazy, divine, but spectacular, city. Alan Jones, life member, National Union of Journalists

Reviews.Title: “#3!?? Really!!???”
Reviews.Author: AFBT
Reviews.Content: Nobody likes to read reviews where people complain and nobody likes to find them helpful. So, I will try to avoid griping but I just can't figure out WHY Cellini is #THREE out of over 1000 hotels! Sheesh! That seems a sad state of affairs for Rome! First, the people here are FABULOUS!!! They are more than helpful, I can't say enough things about how nice they are. Also, I never made it up to the top deck! Maybe that would have totally changed my experience!?? Here's what I saw complete with photos... Actually, it looks better in photographs! VERY dated room! It was pretty clean for as old as it is. I think Caesar must have slept in the saggy bed it is so old. My back KILLED me while here! We had a "Junior suite". I don't know why they called it a suite unless it's because it had a twin bed next to the big bed. ?? Needs paint in a bad way! The bathtub is deadly to get in and out of! If you're older, BE CAREFUL! No non-slip mat in slippery tub and it's much higher than the floor so navigating entrance and exit is dicey. They do not provide wash cloths in the room. Maybe if you ask at the desk!?? I don't know, I always remembered at inopportune times! They DO provide a blow dryer!! Their location is interesting. Third floor of an old building on a dirty street. It WAS quiet!! Fairly close to the train station too. It just seems to me that for the #3 hotel in Rome would be a little up to date. Maybe 200 Euro/night is a GREAT price for that area?? The breakfast was typical. Nothing special but the very helpful people. Maybe that's why they rate place 3? Good for them! 1.) Nice People! 2.) Photographs well! 3.) Includes blow dryer! 4.) Quiet street! 5.) Close to train station Is that all you want in a hotel?? If yes, then stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all around!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BERNARD-VALERIE
Reviews.Content: What a memorable experience!!!....From the gated elevator.....to the charming roof garden....Roberto and his staff were attentive, helpful, warm and professional . The attention to detail; needs of the guests and the cozy breakfast room will always be remembered!!!! We highly recommend the Hotel!!!!(

Reviews.Title: “The apartments and service is excellent”
Reviews.Author: Steve P
Reviews.Content: We stayed (2 adults and 3 children) stayed in one of their apartments which are situated in an excellent location. The owners took a great amount of time to ensure that we knew where everything is, giving some local knowledge that ensured out stay was perfect. When I mentioned that my wife was on a gluten free diet, he then recommended some restaurants and ensured there was gf food for breakfast as well. Can't recommended enough and would stay again without a thought.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend staying here!”
Reviews.Author: Pumpkin1920
Reviews.Content: A lovely little hotel! The position is great, lovely and quiet in a very noisy city. Our room (a triple) was lovely and spacious and our daughter fell in love with the jacuzzi bath. Sweet little breakfast room with a good selection to eat, great cappuccinos and hot chocolates. There is also a quiet terrace on the 5th floor, nice in the evening. All the staff were lovely and could not do enough for us, from organising taxis to recommending good local restaurants. A great introduction to Rome and Italy, would definitely stay there again! It deserves the rating it has on here.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, Quiet, Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: AllysonJS
Reviews.Content: We chose Residenza Cellini based on reviews on TA as well as its proximity to Termini Station. Since Rome was our first stop after a long flight from the West coast, this seemed to make sense. The hotel was fairly easy to find on foot from the train station. We found the room to be very nicely appointed and the staff accommodating. It was a great retreat after a long day of walking Rome and seeing the sites. Very, very quiet. As far as location goes, while convenient to the train station it was a bit of a hike to get to places like Piazza Navona or Campo d' Fiori where you really get a wonderful sense of what Rome is all about. The breakfast provided in the morning was great and the staff was helpful if we had questions about where to go, although no one could give us a good restaurant recommendation close to the hotel. (Try Target restaurant right around the corner - we had an excellent meal, bottle of wine and great tiramisu) If it's warm when you go - make sure you go to the rooftop deck. None of the staff told us about it and we discovered it on our last day after another guest mentioned it. It's a nice space to have a drink or coffee. Overall I would recommend the hotel although I think it's a bit overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: avidtraveler0055
Reviews.Content: Definitely stay here. Best hotel I've stayed in for years. I wish all hotels were as nice, friendly, comfortable, etc as this one.

Reviews.Title: “Only Place to Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly G
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here last summer ending our Italian tour including Como, Venice, and Florence. Residenza Cellini was without a doubt the friendliest, most accomadating hotel. It is beautifully decorated with magnificent rooms. The breakfast was delicious every morning and the staff always willing and eager to help. Matches the "ancient mixed with modern" feel of Rome perfectly. Great location - we walked everywhere but the Vatican and on the hotel's recommendation got the Roma Pass for the times we didn't want to walk. Definitely ask the owners for recommendations. They restaurants they sent us to were the best all trip. I found none of the negative reviews on here as true. To be sure the rooms/showers are smaller than they typically are in the US but that is merely a difference in culture. It was the same in every city we visited. You also have to remember it is a pensione and not a large hotel chain. Residenza Cellini is a wonderful family run pensione and anyone who stays there is in for a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: xgman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed in many hotels in Rome and Residenza Cellini is by far the best. The rooms are spacious and clean with comfortable beds, and have all the amenities one would normally expect to find in a five star hotel, to include a jacuzzi. Barbara and her staff are friendly and helpful. Cellini is located close to good restaurants, shops and the train station, and is within reasonable walking distance to many of Rome's major attractions. It is off the main street and the rooms are quiet. Our stay in Rome was made even more memorable as a result of this fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, centrally located, great staff”
Reviews.Author: thehaggs
Reviews.Content: Traveling with our two adult children, we rented the quadruple room and it was a bit tight but we made do. The bathroom was beautiful and clean. The staff couldn't have been more helpful. It's within walking distance to the train station and the T as well. Great location! Plenty of good restaurants nearby. Wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: marika g
Reviews.Content: Belle Arti Resort is well situated close to downtown sites and public transportation. The staff are accommodating, friendly and helpful. The breakfast offers many choices and great coffee! WI-FI works well from the hall. The air conditioning was more than adequate considering we were there during a very hot September! Great was the daily art tour to Pompeii and Vesuvius! I hope see Marco again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeff222
Reviews.Content: Residenza Cellini is a wonderful hotel to stay at in Rome. It is close to the Metro station in Republica center, is within a few blocks of the main train station, shops and restaurants. The room was clean and of decent size. The staff was friendly, courteous and helpful. The morning breakfast was delightful with hot coffee brought in by the staff and a good selection of cereals, fruit, meats and breads. The hotel has an elevator; this is important when your room is on the 5th floor (some of our other hotels did not have an elevator). Our floor also had a large shared patio area where my wife and I were able to share some wine, cheese and crackers one night (very romantic) and staff volunteered glasses and a wine bottle opener.....a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fernm61
Reviews.Content: Everything about Residenza Cellini was terrific. The rooms were clean with enough closet space and a nice bathroom. Breakfast was good with many choices and the staff was willing to provide early breakfast if we planned a very early AM excursion. Most of all I cannot say enough good things about the willingness of staff to help us in all ways. When I accidentally left my camera in the Naples train station, they went above and beyond to successfully help me recover my camera intact-no small feat!! This is a great place to stay in Rome and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Apartment from Residenza Cellini”
Reviews.Author: maribel131960
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay! we stayed at their apartment and had a very nice vacation, Gaetano and Barbara are very nice and helpful. They run to help me every time I called them. I will definitely recommend their places. Thank you for a nice visit to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel choice”
Reviews.Author: emptynestersnc
Reviews.Content: After much research I chose this hotel for our stay in Rome. I was concerned about the location but it was great. the room was very clean and quiet, the king size bed was a huge plus, the service was excellent and the breakfast was great.The shower is a bit small in the regular rooms and feels like a space capsule so if you are large it will be difficult. Our friends had a nicer room with a terrace but we took advantage of the large terrace available to everyone. It was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room in a quirky, charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mimia2
Reviews.Content: We've loved our too-brief stay at the Residenza Cellini. The room was wonderful. Very clean with plenty of room to unpack. We had a desk and a small table and chairs. The bathroom was very nice and spotlessly clean. Bed linens and towels were very nice. The front desk staff were exceedingly helpful. We arrived just before noon after a long bus ride from Sorrento. Even though the breakfast service had been over for some time, they still made us cappuchino and offered us fruit and rolls. We had wi-fi access for our laptop, they also have a computer available for guests, and let us use the front desk computer and printer to print our boarding passes for our flight the next day. The hallways are generous with lovely decorations, and with only 6 guest rooms on the third floor you really do feel as if you are at a summer home rather than a hotel. The elevator is a very old-fashioned one in a fancy wrought iron cage. You have to be careful about the load in it, and I found it somewhat worrisome so used the stairs except when we had luggage to move. Others found it charming.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: kevincognito
Reviews.Content: Four couples stayed there for four nights while touring rome. The hotel staff could not have been friendlier and the hotel itself was perfect. The 12 rooms of this hotel are split on the 3rd and 5th floor of an old building one block away from a metro station. There is a terrace on the 5th floor that the eight of us would gather later in the evening to share our stories and a cocktail. The rooms were a good size with the exception of the shower (which was an Italian theme we found out) and was air conditioned which was a must in August. The breakfast was enough to get you going in the morning. The location was close enough to the metro or the main bus line running down Via Nazionale to get you to all the main attractions. If you prefer to walk then it was about a 15 minute walk to Trevi or the Spanish Steps which were the preferred area to walk after dark. Outside the hotel is a little pizza joint which was as good as anywhere we tried and on the adjacent corner is a english style pub called George Byron which gives you something other than pasta and pizza for a change. All in all a great hotel with great staff in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and would definately return”
Reviews.Author: alwysluv2travel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is easy to walk to from the train station. The lift is small but allows you to send your suitcases up without climbing the stairs. Once you enter the small hotel the staff are only to willing to assist you with anything you need. Breakfast choice was small but enough to start your day. Robert was especially helpful and has great knowledge of the local area as well as tourist attractions. The room was large for a family of four and kept very clean. There is a laundromat within 10 minutes walk with a really great restaurant diagonally opposite which was cheap with fantastic food. Book your tickets online for the Vatican to avoid the queues and buy your colosseum tickets at Palatine Hill (just down the road a little bit from the Colosseum) to avoid massive queues. We would definately return without hestitation to this small boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good simple hotel near Termini station”
Reviews.Author: miffe
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just got back after staying at this hotel for 3 nights. We stayed in room 5 which was a junior suite. There is no pool, bar or anything flashy about the hotel (it's on the 3rd floor of an old building with a 3-person elevator) but if you're looking for a good, simple hotel near Termini station, this is it. PROS: - Close to Termini station, where we caught the Leonardo Express train to and from the airport. - Very clean. - Free wifi. - Quiet, so we slept well. - Polite and helpful staff. They happily made restaurant recommendations and reservations for us. - There is air-conditioning in the room which was a big relief considering it is summertime (humid, 30+ degC). - Spacious room with high ceilings. - Fairly firm beds (two single beds pushed together). - There was 1 channel on TV which was in English :-D - Jacuzzi in the bathroom. - Breakfast was included. While not a fantastic selection, at least there was something to start off our day and we could have tea and coffee. CONS: - No nice views from the room but that was fine because we only used the hotel as a base to sleep and shower. - The pillows were too soft but that didn't really bother us as we only stayed a few nights. On a separate note, the metro in Rome is grotty and full of graffiti but it's cheap (EUR 1 per trip anywhere in Rome), efficient and it has air-conditioning (which beats the London Tube!). Taxis will rip you off if you're not careful.

Reviews.Title: “Accurate reviews”
Reviews.Author: trafalgarman
Reviews.Content: Central location, very clean, all required amenities, helpful staff, reasonable prices, quirky lift, nothing else to say.................................!

Reviews.Title: “Rented both apartments for family of 10”
Reviews.Author: Amy C
Reviews.Content: After learning that the main hotel was booked for our trip to Rome in June, we were offered two adjacent apartments that we decided to book. They were perfect in every way. We also had set up many transfers with Robert at the reservations desk by email before ever getting to Italy. Every one of them that he set up was flawless! My son even left his camera on our private shuttle to our cruise ship. They tracked it down and sent it back to the cruise port and we received it in our room. Wow! We were very happy and impressed with the communication and thoroughness of everyone we dealt with through this reservation!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this service friendly elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gary L
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our 25th anniversary trip. We spent 4 nights at the Residenza Cellini. The staff was customer oriented, friendly and doing all they can to please. The room was wonderful, old feel to room with 10 foot ceiling, with modern amenities. Breakfast in morning was sufficient. Would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just like home!”
Reviews.Author: Vitenchi405
Reviews.Content: My friends and I at first were uncomfortable about traveling to a new country, and after a long day of flights, we finally made it to this AMAZING hotel. I couldnt have asked for better! the best value for your money! very comfortable and relaxing. If your planning on going to Rome, this is the hotel to go to. You wont be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Touring Rome? This place was lovely!”
Reviews.Author: 30thanniversary
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week while touring Rome. Construction was just completed, so our room was immaculate and large with a courtyard balcony. The location is great, once your driver finds it. I recommended this hotel to my adult children. The first night when they flew into Rome the room was fine, but on departure from Rome they were told no rooms were available and were stuffed into a nasty room at a "sister" hotel in the same bldg. The reservations had been made 2 mths in advance and confirmed the week of travel. Just make sure your room is in the Cellini and you will love it!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LBTravelDesign
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed at this hotel in March 2010 with my husband and young daughter. I am very tardy in submitting my review though our stay at Residenza Cellini was very memorable. This is a quality, extremely well-managed hotel full of charm and luxury. We stayed three nights and were delighted with our lovely room, the spacious bathroom, the delicious and abundant breakfast and the hotel's close location to the main train station in Rome. We were also within walking distance to many sight-seeing locations. The staff at the hotel is top-notch and since our stay I have told many friends this is a great hotel choice in Rome and I think at least one person used my glowing recommendation!

Reviews.Title: “Almost like home !”
Reviews.Author: pt-laval
Reviews.Content: We (3 adults and 2 teens) stayed 5 nights at the Residenza Cellini, in July. As the name implies, it is not a hotel in the sense that they do not occupy a building onto themselves, but rather 2 floors of a multi-purpose building (other companies on the other floors). That being said, we felt completely at home at the Residenza !! We were very impressed with all of the personnel as they welcomed us warmly and always responded positively to any of our requests. It is a 5 minute walk from Termini main train station to the Residenza, which is very convenient for getting to and from the airport, and there is close access to the subway lines. We had reserved 2 Junior Suites (located on the 3rd floor which is also the Reception area); the rooms were nicely decorated, very clean, and had individually controlled air conditioning which was greatly appreciated as the days averaged 33 degrees! We were quite surprised that although the Residenza is located 1 street away from a major thoroughfare (Via Nazionale) the rooms were quiet. Breakfast, included in the price of the rooms, was served in a small breakfast room on the 3rd floor. On the 5th floor there is a little covered balcony with chairs (no real view) which gives guests the opportunity to get a bit of fresh air, read, etc. as there is no real lounge area inside. Near the Reception guests have access to an internet terminal (free) which came in very handy. There are several restaurants in the area; we dined 4 times at La Taverna dei Monti which was a 5 minute walk away. In conclusion, we highly recommend Residenza Cellini to anyone visiting Rome and looking for a small, friendly and conveniently located hotel offering the personal touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment in a more quiet, less touristy area”
Reviews.Author: Aussie11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the main hotel 5 years ago for a week and were very impressed by the level of service, so we wanted to stay again, this time with our two children. The hotel was booked so we were offered the apartment, which was lovely and in the area of Prati, just north of the Vatican. The bedrooms were huge and comfortable and air-conditioned, and very peaceful to come back to after the hot long days of sightseeing with the hordes of other tourists. We walked almost everywhere with the kids, except to the colosseum to which we took a bus that was easy to find. The apartment is very well-equipped and very clean. Only one small issue- the wifi is located in the next door apartment so only works in the foyer area, and also for the first two days the tenant of that apartment had accidentally switched it off so we couldn't use it. I would definitely stay again, it was fabulous being close to the sights but not having to cope with all the issues of being too close.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant & friendly”
Reviews.Author: Family1192
Reviews.Content: My family & I stayed here for 2 nights during our trip to Rome. I was desperate to find a hotel after my accommodation fell through with VRBO. After searching the internet, I once again turned to Tripadvisor for help. Cellini was no. 5 on the list of best hotels, so rang them to see if they had anything available. They had a triple room free for the nights I wanted so I went there to check it out before I booked. They are on the 3rd floor of an old building, but once you enter their doors its like stepping into a happy place. A lovely smell greets you along with Classical musical. Our room was clean, bright & tastefully decorated. The staff are very friendly & helpful. They are not far from the Metro so it is easy to get around. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Apartment”
Reviews.Author: neefly
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5, and when I first contacted the Hotel, they suggested their apartments, (at a different location), as a cost saving alternative. The apartment was in a great, convenient location. Safe, quiet, the apartment itself was first rate. Clean, well appointed. The kitchen was stocked with juice, water, pastry, bread, jams, upon arrival. The air conditioning in each of the bedrooms worked very well ( and it was hot in the city). There were a number of nice ( good-very good) restaurants within walking distance. The staff (Robert) was extremely helpful in answering any questions I had. One of the owners (Gaetano) met us upon arrival, and was extremely, professional, and friendly. It was a pleasure staying there, and would recommend to anyone with a family, to not hesitate, this is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great place. Very quiet and good location”
Reviews.Author: Katmandu21
Reviews.Content: Staff was very nice. We arrived early morning from the states and room was ready within one hour. Owner gave us a bottle of wine and set it up on terrace with snacks. Very happy with accomadations.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the apartment and will use again the next time we're in Roma!”
Reviews.Author: Ken57Pleasanton
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four who visited Italy in June, and while searching for a good hotel, found the Residenza Cellini - and learned that they have an apartment affiliated with the hotel The location was simply outstanding, about 10 minutes from the Vatican and was in a clean, safe location. We met with Gaetano when we arrived in Rome, at the apartment and he was simply delightful. Very helpful, informative and excellent language skills. During the visit, we received help as needed from the Residenza staff, and it was a very smooth, seamless experience. The apartment can handle a good-sized family and the amenities were first rate. Location wise, it was about perfect, at the end of the block is the Tiber river, and with only a ten minute walk you can be at the Vatican, Piazza Navona, or a number of other destinations. Restaurants around the apartment were plentiful, and very good. We had no concerns about safety, and the location was actually very quiet as well. The elevator to the fourth floor was really quaint, and very much in character with the building and make the experience that much more fun for our kids. We highly recommend the Residenza Cellini for families traveling to Roma!

Reviews.Title: “Residenza Cellini - perfect location, great service!”
Reviews.Author: curlync
Reviews.Content: May 2011 we visited Italy, we went to Venice, Florence, Tuscany, Umbria, with our last stop in Rome. We chose to stay Residenza Cellini mainly for it's wonderful location, close to the Metro and in walking distance to the train station. We actually got so much more than we had imagined. The building is off on a side street so a bit quieter in the evening and not as hectic as hotels on the main drags. The room was elegant, nice furnishings and large windows in bathroom and bedroom that you can open to let in the sounds and smells of Italy. Good heavy drapes to shut it all out when you are ready to sleep! The bed was large and comfortable and there were fresh flowers throughout the hotel. Our very spacious room came with a daybed giving you room to spread out, nice when you’re traveling a long time. We had a Jacuzzi tub with a shower, a relaxing break to soak the sore muscles and feet after site seeing all day. There was plenty of closet space for my husband and I to unpack everything since we were staying in Rome for 7 days. There were two sitting chairs, a table and a mini fridge, convenient for when you pickup things at the deli for a light meal. The building is occupied by a couple of nice hotels on the various floors it also has a cool old wood elevator that is one of those unique items that will make the trip memorable. Like the elevators you've seen in the old movies, there is a stairway too. Every day breakfast was served in a room near the front desk area. They put out a generous spread of Italian cheeses, meats, pastries along with cereals fruits and yogurts...you won't be hungry. The staff is super attentive to your needs and can help you with questions about Rome, getting around, site seeing and are a real pleasure to talk to. You control your own AC, which was very comfortable when we needed it. WiFi worked well in our room, which was nice for the iPad we brought along. We were pleasantly surprised upon returning to the hotel one afternoon by the desk clerk who said the owner wanted us to enjoy a bottle of wine up on the roof terrace at our convenience in appreciation for our long stay with Residenza Cellini. Of course we couldn't pass up that opportunity! We thought that was a very lovely gesture by the owner Barbara and want to thank her. It was very special to us, as we were celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary with this fantastic trip to Italy! Upon check out Residenza Cellini staff also handed us a gift for staying with them and a nice discount for our long stay, couldn't ask for more!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: borbalas
Reviews.Content: We stayed with my husband 2 nights in Residenza Cellini and we couldn't have chosen better. Perfectly clean, beautifully styled room and common areas and great service. The bed was big and comfortable, the breakfast was just what you need before starting your sightseeing. The location is very convenient: you can visit most of the main sights walking, or if you get tired you have access to both metro lines and bus lines around the corner. We threw a coin into Fontana di Trevi, so we will soon return to Rome and Residenza Cellini..

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at Residenza Cellini”
Reviews.Author: TDHLibertyMO
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a family trip from Rome and stayed part of our trip at Residenza Cellini. We enjoyed our stay and received excellent service and accommodations. Our triple room was good sized by the standards in European cities and the bathroom was large and well appointed. The room and common areas were very clean and welcoming. There was a wonderful, covered terrace on the 5th floor on which to unwind -high enough to catch cool breezes on hot days. Barbara, the owner, and Robert were very gracious and helpful in meeting our requests. The hotel is actually located in portions of two floors of this building, which is shared with other hotels and residence suites. We also stayed at a separate, very average hotel in the same building and we much preferred Cellini. We would definitely stay at Residenza Cellini again. Positives: Well appointed room, large by the standards of European central cities, very clean and well organized, very secure interior, wonderful terrace, excellent bathroom by European standards, superior service. The hotel is only a mile walk, bus or Metro ride from the central sites such as the Forum, Colloseum, etc. Nearby Via Nazionale and Piazza della Republica are very busy and full of shops and some restaurants. The Metro station is a short, safe two block walk and will lead you to the Spanish Steps and Vatican City without transfer and the Colosseum and Forum with only once transfer. The large Termini train station is only five blocks away and many bus lines connect within a block or two. There's a small, quirky elevator that may not accommodate your full party and luggage, but it's worth making the two trips - this is a common experience at small and mid-sized hotels in Europe where any elevator is often a plus. Negatives: Very few. One thing you should know going in is that the quiet street is one step above an alley by American standards, and nearby businesses sometimes leave their trash on the sidewalk down the street (common in Rome from our observations). This street location is actually a plus because you avoid most of the noise and traffic of the nearby Via Nazionale, but at first glance you may wonder. I walked the neighorhood late into the night with my wife and young son without any worries. If you can get past any expectations of a grand entrance - it's a nearly unmarked door , you will enjoy your experience. Most travel guides will tell you that you need to be flexible when traveling abroad and quite honestly, any negatives listed here will probably not detract from your experience and may add to it. We highly recommend Cellini.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: Clouds75
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Residenza Cellini, and I would be happy to stay there again. The rooms are elegantly furnished and include sparkling bathrooms. Rooms are quiet. I stayed at the hotel for several nights in a row, then departed, and then returned for a couple more nights. Both times, I stayed in the larger rooms, which I think were worth the extra expense. There isn't a large lobby, if that's important to you, and the breakfast room is fairly small. But there's a pretty terrace, if you want to relax someplace other than in your room. The staff was extremely helpful, and the location near the Metro and major bus lines was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: climbingup
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights at the Residenza Cellini and couldn't have asked for a better or more central hotel. It was very clean and comfortable..and the staff were a great help. I also want to mention the included buffet breakfast, it wasn't a huge spread, but there was definately enough variety each morning to get us going before a full day in the city. We arrived into Rome via train and were very happy to arrive at the hotel after just a quick 10 minute walk. The area around the train station is a little seedy, but it doesn't take more than a minute to just walk right past it and into the beauty of Rome. This was our second visit to Rome and I want to make a point of saying, don't miss going into the Colosseum or Vatican City. On our first visit we decided to skip the interiors of both in leiu of going to see something else. On this visit we made a point of going to both and I can't believe what we almost missed. The Sistine Chapel was breathtaking and we wandered for an hour just taking in the amazing architecture of the Colosseum. I would like to warn about the "gladiators" around the colosseum set up for photos. They will grab you in for a photo on your own camera without telling you how much they're charging, then demand 10Euro for 1 picture after it's taken..and they are very pushy. This would be one of my top 3 favorite places in the world. Rome is absolutely amazing and I would stay at the Residenza Cellini anyday.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: CVJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April for two nights prior to a cruise and then returned for 9 nights at the conclusion of our cruise. We were warmly welcomed and when we returned it was like we were "family". Our room was large and comfortable. We had no problem with noise, etc. The staff were all warm, attentive and very helpful,

Reviews.Title: “For a Rome stay: This is the place”
Reviews.Author: havilatr
Reviews.Content: OK, so Rick Steves recommends it; but I'm still a skeptic. I was hesitant to fork out $300 a night, however, let me tell you Residenza Cellini and its super staff did it up right! In detail, the location is excellent (just right off Via Nazionale and the Piazza dell Repubblica) and the room afforded all of the proper comforts: spacious, tile, jacuzzi, cordials, WiFi and an enjoyable breakfast. Go for it; you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: valsma
Reviews.Content: We rented the apartment owned by Residenza Cellina. Close to public transportation and within walking distance of many things. A very good location. The apartment was lovely and well equipped--better than we even expected. My husband and I were traveling with another couple and enjoyed having the apartment. We had breakfast daily at the apartment (complimentary). There were 2 good sized bedrooms and a nice kitchen. There was a large combo dining room/living area with a flat screen TV. One bedroom also had a TV. There is only 1 bathroom. We loved living among Romans in an apartment buildling. Barbara was a font of information! We made the most of our Roma passes-- a great deal and convenience!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Stephen_999
Reviews.Content: Location is very convenient to central train station and via Nazionale. It is however on a very quiet street and we were not disturbed by traffic sounds even with the balcony doors open. We occupied a “suite” but this was no more than a larger room with quite adequate bathroom and small balcony. The bed was large but firm (as we found all Italian hotel mattresses to be) and the linen was crisp and clean. The bath is a Jacuzzi although takes a while to fill. The shower was fine but tucked into a corner of the bath and getting in and out was awkward if not quite risky without a handrail – be careful or you could ruin your holiday with a slip! Staff were gracious, attentive and very helpful. Breakfast was generous and coffee was both delicious and generously served. We really enjoyed our stay here – not sure if this is the most competitively priced hotel for this level of service but we had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location, spacious for European standards”
Reviews.Author: thwhite2000
Reviews.Content: Very clean, comfortable rooms. Bedroom was fairly large for European standards, although the shower may be a little tight if you're on the larger side. Location was fairly busy, but our room was very quiet, we slept great. The owner and staff were all extremely friendly and helpful and pointed us in the right direction every time for restaurants and sight-seeing. It's a short walk from the train station and every other site you want to see. We're walkers, so we barely used the bus passes that we got - although they did come in handy at the end of the day. The 40 and 64 bus lines stop right behing the hotel and get you everywhere you need to go if you don't mind walking a few blocks from each stop. We never spent much time at the hotel other than sleeping, but there was a great little common balcony outside the rooms that offers a nice place to relax in the shade if you need it in between outings.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Place, the most helpful and friendly staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: mrbill_1952
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience with this hotel and fine staff. Daily we asked for help and comments on booking dinner reservations (in Italian) they cheerfully took care of it for us. As we were a refferal they gave us a bottle of wine on silver, with fresh flowers. The location was 1 block from the subway which we used a lot to get around, and easy access for taxis they called for us as needed. We arrived via train from florence and took the subway and train to Tivoli with ease on our own. The room was nice and gave a sense of history, the bath was large. We thought the rate was reasonable, the hotel was very nice and the help was as good as we ever have had. We travel quite a bit and this was exceptional. Unless you are looking for a top dollar place we highly recommend RESIDENZA CELLNI for your base of siteseeing Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Que2you
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice during the last week of April first week of May. This is a nicely decorated, clean hotel on the 3rd-5th floor of an 1800s building that is within walking distance to Trevi Fountain & the Spanish Steps. The walk to the Colosseum and Forum are a little farther. If you want a clean secure place to stay with friendly staff, this is the place for you. I would have given it a higher rating if the sheets weren't so rough and the mattress so firm. They could do something more with the coffee service at breakfast, They run back and forth with a container that holds coffee for one (really good though). Would I stay here again? Absolutely! Thanks for memories. "The elevator is pretty TINY"

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: BusinesTraveller89
Reviews.Content: a small hotel - really just part of one floor of a building near the Piazaa della Republica. Many such hotels in Rome are cramped and rather scruffy. But this is very different. After coping with an antiquated but charming lift, one finds a series of light, airy rooms, furnished comfortably and more than large enough. Everything is very clean. The staff are friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. The breakfast is more than adequate (though in the European style rather than the American i.e. no hot food). We are fairly critical of accommodation in Rome, having suffered rip-off prices and poor provision in the past. We would certainly be keen to return to residenza Cellini, which seemed to us very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect escape from the madness of rome - wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: renolrufc
Reviews.Content: Fantastic room, Fantastic Service, Fantastic Breakfast. What more can you say !!! The rooms were stunning and the location perfect for all of the sites in Rome. Due to its small size (maybe 7 rooms), the service received was fantastic from all the staff and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone you will not be disappointed at all.

Reviews.Title: “All of the favorable reviews are accurate”
Reviews.Author: IGETAROUND007
Reviews.Content: I booked one standard double room for my wife and I and another for my wife's daughter-in- law, Tania and grandchild, Janina who is 7 years old. The elevator is a bit small and the hotel is actually on floors 3 and 5 of what appears to be an office building. However, I found the entire two night precruise stay to be exactly as described in all of the favorable reviews. The location is very good for sightseeing. Our rooms were spotless and the beds were comfortable. The wifi worked well there is no additional charge for its use or the use of a laptop computer that is available for guests. The staff is remarkably gracious and helpful. Again, since there are so few rooms it is like having your own personal concierege. Everyone was kind but I especially appreciated the assistance of a young lady whom I believe is named Margie, if I recall correctly. The buffet breakfast had everything we needed to start the day. There are restaurants within a short distance from the hotel. Everything about this hotel is low key but it is so well run that you regret having to leave. After the cruise my wife's daughter-in-law and grandchild returned for one additional night in April. The staff found an item that Tania left behind after the first visit and then returned it to her when she returned. We booked a suite for Tania for her second visit ( at the time of booking it was the least expensive room available) but asked for a double room if one became available. The hotel honored our wishes and I thought that was very nice of the staff to do this. Rome is a lovely city with plenty to see. While not addressed to Residenza Cellini, I want to warn all visitors to Rome to avoid the money exhange shops particularly forxchange at Via Nazionale 22 where a 19% commission is charged. The favorable exchange rate you will see on the board outside is just a lure to get you to do business. By the way, at the airport (FCO) a 9% commission for dollar to Euro exchange seems to be the going rate and I find this to be high as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: Thomson987
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Rome and we couldn't have chosen a better hotel. When we arrived the staff were so friendly and helpful. We were provided with a map of Rome and the staff talked us through the best places to visit so we could make the most of our four days in the city. They marked routes on the map and told us what buses/metro we would have to take. However, most of the main sights e.g the Trevi fountain, Spanish steps etc are at most a 20min walk away. There is a fabulous pizzeria called Est Est Est just around the corner. Breakfasts are great, usually a fair selection of pastries which are restocked regularly. Our room had a mini bar with reasonably priced drinks etc which was restocked daily. The staff are so accommodating and I would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment”
Reviews.Author: ShortStreet
Reviews.Content: We just got home from a stay at the apartment owned by the hotel at N.10 located in Via Marianna Dionigi n. 17 ( near Piazza Cavour), We had four in our party and had tried to get a room at the hotel. As you will find in Rome, trying to get a nice place for 4 people is difficult. The hotel offered the apartment listed above and it was great. It is very clean, very safe and in a great neighborhood that is only a 10 minute walk from the Spanish Steps and its Metro stop, Vatican, Pantheon, and so on. On the nearby Piazza, there are numerous bus connections that made our stay even easier. The hotel arranged for a driver (65 Euros and worth every penny) who delivered 4 weary travellers straight from baggage claim to the front door of the apartment. We are "picky" travelers that normally go high end, but this place is a real find! It has two baths, 3 bedrooms, living space and a fully equipped kitchen. The hotel stocked it with great breakfast foods, plenty of towels and cleaned the apartment half way through our stay. Great, great choice. We loved being in the apartment and felling like a "local" for a week. The neighborhood has everything you need including several good restaurants such as Vito's and Roma. There are numerous cafe's around that all have great breakfasts and lucnhes as well. Take it from someone who travels a great deal, this is a great place! We did all of this via e-mail and paid in cash to get a discount at the end of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, large apartment for families”
Reviews.Author: LibertyStav
Reviews.Content: We traveled with our 3 young kids and were looking for a large accommodation so that we did not have to book two rooms. Was hesitant of booking an apartment in Rome that was not affiliated with a hotel, so we this was perfect! We were able to book the apartment through the hotel, and took advantage of the helpful, quickly responsive and efficient staff. They were waiting for us at the apartment with keys, local information and a very clean apartment as soon as we arrived from the US. The location of the apartment is great, and you feel as though you are living in Rome. Since we only saw the hotel's apartment, I cannot comment on the actual hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Stay at Residenza Cellini!”
Reviews.Author: stropertre
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Residenza Cellini for a total of 5 nights in early March, 2011. We were given a "late winter" rate of 180 euros per night for a junior suite with breadfast , service and taxes included. After hearing all the stories about "european sized rooms", I was worried about the size of the room. It was quite spacious, and my wife, college-aged son and I had plenty of elbow room. I had also heard about standards of cleanliness in Europe being different from those in the U.S. Not so here. The room was as as clean as any I have ever stayed in at home or abroad. We very much liked the fact that the hotel combines great rooms with excellent service. Barbara de Paolis and her staff were happy to make reservations for us both before our arrival and after our stay. The staff was also considerate about numerous small gestures that made our stay so memorable. Ice for drinks before dinner was swiftly delivered. When my wife wanted to take breakfast in her room, the staff saw me carrying a plate and graciously got me a tray and took it to the room. The staff was happy to store our luggage while we were in Florence, and thoughtfully placed the bag back in our room when we arrived. We were given a bottle of prosecco with peanuts and salty snacks on our last night due to the length of our stay. There are no public rooms; you basically have your room, a terrace on the fifth floor we didn't visit due to the weather; and a computer in the breakfast room. We didn't find this to be a problem at all. We also read a review that cautioned against the third floor due to noise. Our room was quiet (except for sirens, we heard no street noise). The location is a little distant from places like Trastevere and Piazza Navona. On the other hand, the Metro was close, and Termini an easy walk. The neighborhood is great. There is a wonderful bakery, restaurant, sandwich shop (Dagnino) a couple of blocks away that we frequented when we did not want to go out to a big dinner. There is a grocery store and pharmacy within a block or two. You are near some interesting sites, including the church housing the "Ecstasy of St. Terese", the National Museum of Rome, and an historic church built on the Baths of Diocletian. The Vatican, Colloseum, Piazza Bernini, and Spanish Steps are easily assessible by Metro. We bought the Rome pass (25 euros), and used it quite a bit. If you have more than three people in your party, take advantage of the car service (55 euros). Somewhat more expensive than the trains, but worth it if you arrive tired in a new city. Finally, Residenza Cellini went out of its way to let us check in early, a godsend if you have an overnight flight. I consider myself a tough critic, but Residenza Cellini earned its five stars.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel & service! We will definately stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: NinaMJ
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome. We chose Residenza Cellini because of all of its good reviews on Tripadvisor and the reviews were right! Upon arrival at the airport, the hotel arranged a shuttle to pick us up. They took us to the hotel. The hotel is on the third floor in the building. We took an old fashioned lift up to the third floor. The lobby is small but beautiful. All of the staff members were awesome. We arrived at 11am and our room was not quite ready because check in was not until 1pm and our room was still being prepared. Even though we were early, they let us enjoy their buffet breakfast and let us store all of our luggage so we could go sightseeing. By reading the reviews and info on the website, I didn't realize how conveniently located Residenza Cellini is. The staff gave us very helpful, clear instructions and gave us a map that made it very easy for us to see how to get around on the bus system. For only $4 euro per person you can ride the buses all day long and the buses stop right near all the main attractions. You could actually walk everything as well-the hotel was close to everything. After about 10 hours sightseeing, we went back to our hotel and found that the junior suite room we reserved was very nice, large and clean. Real hardwood floors & tall ceilings. The bathroom had an awesome 5 jet jacuzzi tub that was absolutely perfect after the long work out my legs had sightseeing. The front desk directed us to a local pizzeria/restaurant for dinner and the food was very good. In the morning, the breakfast buffet was great. Lots of options, good food and although the breakfast room was a little on the smaller side, it was never a problem as there were never more than 3-4 couples in the room eating at once. At check out they quickly arranged a taxi to take us to the train station. We loved this hotel and how easy and luxuriously comfortable they made our stay- very attentive to our needs and very helpful with all of our questions. We will recommend this hotel and definitely stay here again our next time in Roma!

Reviews.Title: “The rating's too high”
Reviews.Author: Hlunya
Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel for 5 nights, here's the thing, it's way overrated! i'll start with the cons: when we arrived it was freezing cold in the room and the girl at the reception couldn't help (the AC was off and she didn't know how to switch it on), room itself was not spectacular but livable, shower absolutely tiny (all appliances worked well though, nothing to complain about there), small breakfast room (i felt like an elephant) the hotel is not a normal type, but the appartment if not to say hostel type (there're many hotels in the same building) not so many good restauratns nearby (but there's a good one on the same street) there's a top-floor terrace which sadly was a mess (it's likely that they fix it by summer) pros: location was not bad (i would choose another next time though, Trastevere maybe), there're some shops on Via Nationale (especially liked Max Mara, good service, good price) free Wi-Fi everything worked well i the room and the staff were quite efficient It's an average hotel, nothing more to say. sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable, can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: SuzieQ37
