Reviews.Content: Had an amazing holiday in Rome, and that was mainly thanks to the warm reception and beautiful accommodation of the Residenza Cellini. We booked the 2 bed apartment and everything was very stress free. They had booked us a limousine service which was only €55 from Ciampino airport and was well worth it as he took us straight to the apartment. We were met by Gaetano who spent an hour with us showing us the apartment, where to eat, visit etc. We had maid service at the time and day of our choosing. The apartment was beautiful, very well appointed and perfect for our needs and absolutely spotless. There were plenty of supplies left for us too for the time of our stay (5 nights) and the Despar shop was nearby if we needed anything else. There are plenty of local restaurants nearby which would suit every budget. The apartment has the best location in Rome I think, being only minutes walk away from the Vatican, The Castello de Angelo, Spanish steps, Trevi fountain, Pantheon and Piazza navona. The Colosseum is a short and handy bus ride away. Its also only across the bridge from the main shopping areas too. I loved the freedom of staying in the apartment and would definitely choose to stay here again when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: LukeChristian
Reviews.Content: Maria and i have just spent yet another wonderful break in our home away from home at the De Paolis family's Residenza Cellini.Barbara, Donato and Gaetano are so well served by Francesca,Robert and all the excellent staff. We are made to feel so welcome in a warm, friendly and relaxing environment. The quality of the rooms, the decor the beautifuk flower displays and the soft pastoral background music especially appreciated in the small breakfast room all contribute to the charm of this gem of a hotel. Hotel is excellently located and so quiet it's hard to believe it's in the heart of a busy and noisy city.We wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else in Rome, we love it in the Cellini. Damien Halpin

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, location”
Reviews.Author: buckiz1980
Reviews.Content: Barbara and Co. have a fantastic hotel. The location was the best, because it is located really close to the Metro and there are several places nearby where you can grab an afternoon gelato or glass of wine. Plus, there are a number of great restaurants the staff will recommend for you. In our experience you should always have hotels like this call and make your dinner reservations for you, because you will get better service at the restaurant. At several of our dinners we were treated to prosecco and free desserts. The staff and location (in that order) are what make this place a 5-star recommendation (the room was great too). Some advice if arriving by train: you can walk to the hotel from Termini Station, but it is so easy to get here from the Repubblica Metro Stop. Just get your Roma Pass and start using the metro as soon as you get here to avoid the walk and getting lost ;-)

Reviews.Title: “They bought me special foods to accommodate my dietary needs”
Reviews.Author: tennisbird
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Residenza Cellini back in 2002, and remembered the fine service provided by Donato and Barbara. We are happy to return in 2011 and we all sort-of remembered each other. When we checked in, I showed them a note I had had translated into Italian explaining my severe allergy to dairy and dairy-containing foods. I told them I needed their help, and they discussed what I could possibly eat off the sumptuous breakfast buffet. They let us check in early (our plane landed at 8:30 AM). We had booked a driver to drive us from the airport to the hotel, so they knew our arrival time and had our hotel room ready for us so we could grab a quick nap. After the nap we woke up and were incredibly pleased to discover that they had gone food shopping for me! They had purchased 3 large packages containing dairy-free products that I could use at breatkfast (from rice cakes to dairy- and gluten-free cookies). I was so very touched and so surprised by this kindness (they did not charge us for the food) that it really got me trip in Rome off to a very good start. I had been very worried about being able to eat carefully in Rome, and they got me off to a very good start. I was never handy because I took their dairy-free products with me not just to breakfast, but during the day as well. Thank you to Donato, Barbara, and all the rest. We miss you already!

Reviews.Title: “quiet, clean, comfortable, convenient and excellent coffee”
Reviews.Author: entasis000
Reviews.Content: I really nice place to come back to after tromping around all day in this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “LUXURY & LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: washoeReno_Nevada
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable and well-located hotel (near Plaza Republica) which provides large rooms (we had a "Junior Suite"), excellent service, good breakfasts. You pay a little more than for a 3 star hotel in this area, but it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “MORE THAN WE EXPECTED”
Reviews.Author: shugartfam
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the apartment and it was BEAUTIFUL. Great location within walking distance to so many sites. We were met by a staff memeber the day of and she was so full of GREAT information from sites, restaurants, to near by grocery stores...It was our first visit to Rome, hopefully not our last, and we thank the hotel and staff for such a GREAT experience!! I HIGHLY recommend this hotel/apartment, thank you RESIDENZA CELLINI for helping to ensure our visit went so smoothly.

Reviews.Title: “Small and very freindly hotel”
Reviews.Author: MingWai
Reviews.Content: Very nice location, within walking distance (15 minutes ) a lot of major tourist spots. 5 minutes walk to the underground and 10 minutes walk to train station. The staffs are very friendly and gives us a very warm welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Comforts of Home”
Reviews.Author: monticello00
Reviews.Content: We rented the apartment for our family of 5 while in Rome for 4 days. The hotel's apartment near Saint Angelo's castle was comfortable, relaxing, convenient and Gaetano made a huge effort to ensure everything went well. Our trip was a delight for both us and our children and a lot of that was owed to the ability to stay in a place that felt like home. The hotel arranged our transfers to and from the airport, were very timely with both and went out of their way to confirm our outbound flights when we had trouble reaching the airlines. The apartment itself was a 2 bedroom, with a large living area, a comfortable modern bathroom, a fully stocked and working kitchen stocked with breakfast amenities and a fanciful wrought iron elevator that the kids loved riding up and down in. If we visit again, we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ckcockcroft
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here! Incredible service, very clean and very intimate atmosphere. Very quiet at night, so sleeping was great. Our room had french doors that we enjoyed opening to enjoy the nice breeze. The front desk staff is second to none and were so very helpful!! We would not hesitate to book here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roluke
Reviews.Content: We stayed there two times during our trip to Italy, in the beginning and at the end. I would suggest asking for a room on the 5th. floor. We stayed on the third floor the first time and the fifth floor the second time. I felt the fifth floor was much nicer and quieter. The terrace on the fifth floor was very nice. The rooms were clean and as stated before, I really liked the room on the fifth floor. The restaurant, Target, on the corner was actually pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: AFCDerby
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights over a long weekend in a junior suite. From initial enquiry through to being dropped back at the airport could not fault hotel, staff or services. Hotel was a very pleasant change to chains. The hotel and rooms had character and quality. All staff were extremely helpful and gave clear and useful advice. Asked for a reccomendation for a traditional Trattoria and had the best meal of our trip there. Nothing was too much trouble and everything we asked was done without issue. There maybe better located hotels in Rome but everything was either within walking distance or accesable via Tube or bus both 2 mins walk. All in all an excellent stay and would return and reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: lolaborro
Reviews.Content: If I had to assess this hotel in terms of value for money I'd give it 5* but I haven't because I'm assessing the standard to the hotel and for that reaso I'm giving it 4*. First the positive: This hotel is in a fantastic location, in the town centre, in a quite road just off Via Nazionale, close to all the major attractions and Termini station. The actual property is very small, they must have about 7 or 8 rooms in total located across the 3rd and the 5th floor of an old building (on the other floors there are other hotels/businesses). The rooms are beautifully decorated with qualifty finishes such as marble floors and bathroom worktops, quality tiles, shower jets, luxurious soft furnishings, comfortable beds etc. It seems as if it had been decorated very recently as it all looks very fresh. The breakfast room is nice and cosy and offers a selection of sweet pastries, biscuits brioche, 1 type of bread rolls, cooked meat, 2 types of cheese, salami, 1 type of cereal, yogurts and almond tart. The service is excellent, their staff very friendly, nothing seems to be too much trouble for them. Now the negative: The lift is a very old fashioned one that involves having to manually open and close two sets of doors. One of the doors have a spring that makes them close all the time, so when you are coming in and out you have to use all your available limbs prop them open so that they will not be closing on you. This is particularly difficult if you have, bags, luggage and are large or heavily pregnant (such as me). If your room happens to be on the 5th floor, this is a nuisance since, the reception and breakfast room are located on the 3rd floor so you have to endure those lift doors several times a day. Another problem of staying on the 5th floor is that you have to double lock not only your own room but a sort of 'front room' so this added to the lift becomes a right pain on the backside after a while. The room I was given was a good size (not huge but not small either), the only problem is that the end of the bed was too close to the wall, and on top of that the TV was mounted on the wall, so, to get to that side of the bed I had to make some sort of contorsion which wasn't easy being heavily pregnant and I suppose the problem would be the same for someone large. Whilst the breakfast selection was good, it's not what I would award 5*. There was not enough variety of bread (no brown) or cereal. There was no cooked breakfast choice or eggs of any kind and I asked for some decaf coffee and got instant!! But overall, I'd say it's an excellent choice for the money paid, specially compared to the general standard of accommodation in Rome. Definitely recommended

Reviews.Title: “Another positive review”
Reviews.Author: CathP027
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights prior to cruise. Lovely accomodation and friendly/helpful staff. Very clean and spacious rooms. Great location close to transit and good restaurants. Coming off an overnight flight from Canada we were so glad we pre-arranged with the hotel to be picked up by car service. Worth every penny. The english speaking driver was waiting for us, assisted with luggage and we were off to the hotel with no worries of trying to find a taxi and then the taxi finding the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely lives up to the Great Reviews.”
Reviews.Author: lucida509
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at Residenza Cellini on our recent trip to Italy. Our stay could not have been more perfect. Our room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The hotel is in a great location, yet it is one street away from the "main" street. This made it very quiet which was much appreciated after a very busy day in overcrowded Rome. The staff is wonderful and very eager to help you locate a restaurant or provide directions or print tickets. The best thing about the breakfast is the coffee.....very good!! There is a mini bar in the room that, unlike US hotels, is not overpriced. The price of the Fresca and coke is the same as buying it from the street cart around the corner. It was nice not to feel like you were being nicked and dimed. The internet is free and works great.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: arnaud066
Reviews.Content: Very nice small hotel. Perfect service with a very very nice and helpful staff. Always there to offer you a coffee, helping you to find your way in Roma. Nice room, quiet, very confortable Bed.. I recomment without hesitation .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean, excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: wizzoKent
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Rome and took advice from trip-advisor ref where to stay. The Residenza Cellini was in a great location for walking to the must see destinations on our short visit to Rome ( 4 complete days ) The staff were all very helpful and our room ( no 5 ) was spotless, checked out the other rooms when we could and they looked good. Breakfast was ok, cold buffet, fruit and a lovely flan. Set us up for nicely. If you pay cash instead of c/c you should be able to haggle a reduced daily rate.

Reviews.Title: “Comforts of home”
Reviews.Author: post60745
Reviews.Content: After spending 10 days in Egypt had a stop over in Rome and decided to spend a few days. Found this little oasis on trip advisor and was very pleased with the whole experience. Arrived in late morning and we were sent to our room which had fresh flowers all over from desk to large sleeping quarters. Even though breakfast was over , we requested tea and was brought 2 pots of tea on a silver server. The staff was warm and accomodating. They gave information on dining as well as transportation which turned out just right for our needs. Would definetly stay there again. Koodos to Residenza Cellini for their warm hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “What a great find!”
Reviews.Author: pattyinidaho
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked Residenza Cellini as last leg to our 16-day Italian Adventure. I used Trip Advisor as a guide. The rest of our trip was coordinated by a cooking adventure (not really recommended, although we had a good time). We were delighted by our hotel. It is up 4 flights of stairs, which made me giddy with happiness as I had eaten my way through the Italian countryside! There is an elevator, it is just so tiny and slow, that a quick jog up the stairs was great. Residenza Cellini has a fabulous location near Termini station and many must-see attractions. And the metro station and ATM were just steps around the corner. As a matter of fact, we walked there from the station, as there had been a demonstation earlier in the day, and the cab drivers were using that as an excuse to charge 25EU to drive us a couple city blocks. Really, no big deal. Hard on the luggage wheels, but almost too close for the taxi at all! (of course, taxis in Rome are another story all together!) It is a TINY hotel, I think 24 rooms. Our room had a king-size bed (quite unusual for Italy) and was really spacious. Nice clean bathroom. Everything very clean and comfortable. But it was the staff, wow, what a staff! They were VERY helpful with our thousands of questions. They must have used up 10 maps drawing out walking/driving/metro directions for us! But they were always there to help. As a matter of fact, when we departed for the airport, VERY early in the morning, they asked if we would like coffee prior to leaving. Um, YES! Not only did they have coffee ready at 5:45 am, they had a whole breakfast spread ready. Now that is above and beyond service! Our room rate was outstanding (remember, cash IS king) so don't be shy to ask, prior to booking. If I had any gripe at all (and it is really not a fair gripe as it did not reflect badly on the hotel) was they had beautiful fresh lilies in vases. I hate the smell of lilies (they have that funeral smell) but, hey, the were beautiful, fresh-cut flowers! Oh, and can't remember names, but if you do stay at Residenza Cellini, on that same street, to the left, there is a little indoor mall. There is a pastry shop in there to die for! We took home and assortment of cookies and biscotti on the plane. No problems. Stop in for an espresso and a treat. Lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: LandscapesLandmarks
Reviews.Content: Residenza Cellini is elegantly decorated in both the rooms and the spacious common spaces including a landscaped outdoor covered balcony terrace with 3-4 comfortable seating areas -- wonderful for a or two glass of wine in the evening. We liked that space so much we rarely used our lovely private balcony. This was probably the best bathroom/shower we had on the trip – Jacuzzi shower. Mention Rick Steves at check in and, with cash payment, get a substantial rate reduction. This was the last place we stayed on our 2 week trip and a good way to end up – particularly as a no hassle walk to the train station to go to the airport on the way out. Also there’s Metro stop just around the corner, convenient for accessing other city destinations. We stayed 2 nights – after 1 night at Caesar Residenza which was closer to the Coliseum/Forum. The front desk was very helpful at Cellini but the vivacious person at the Caesar Residenza gives them the edge there. I won’t review Caesar separately but I’d highly recommend both places and would certainly stay at either again (having stayed at Caesar in the past) with the edge to Cellini on overall graciousness of the common spaces, breakfast area and location to public transportation and the edge going to Caesar in “walk to” location to the Coliseum/Forum/Palatine Hill and front desk sparkle . Both are wonderfully decorated – Caesar with more of a Euro-chic flair.

Reviews.Title: “Add this hotel to your "Top 10 Must Stay" List”
Reviews.Author: CatherinenRory
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fantastic .... We travelled with our 5 year old son and we could not have been treated in a more helpful manner. Our triple room was a very good size, excellent bathroom. Spotless !! Very quiet. Beautiful decor. Serene luxury !! Customer Service was out of this world. Staff made us feel we were the most important guests in the hotel !! I am sure all other guests felt the same way. Breakfast was served in a beautiful room, my only reservation was that if the 4 tables in the breakfast room were occupied (there are 11 bedrooms in the hotel) you had to wait for guests to finish their breakfast. However, this only happened once in our 3 night stay and we all muddled together to find enough chairs etc to accommodate ! We tended to go to breakfast later than most guests. Cheese and meat platters were replenished, even though we were rather late one morning ! Great location, Great Service, Very Very Special hotel to stay. So friendly, always smiling. Wonderful welcome when we arrived and Barbara ran through the best places to try on our first visit to Rome. The hotel is central to all main sights, but is also "off the beaten track" so you can easily find the better value for money restaurants, instead of paying the rather extortionate main tourist "Piazza" rates. Hotel round the corner called Target is out of this world, gorgeous seafood and house wine ! The best hotel I have stayed in. We will definitely be going back, can't wait !!!

Reviews.Title: “Bucky Badger”
Reviews.Author: JackJackCalifornia
Reviews.Content: If you have plans to visit Rome do yourself a favor and stay here. It was fantastic. The location allowed us to walk to all the sightseeing spots. And there were at least 4 fabulous places to eat within 6 blocks. The staff provided us with a level of service we have never encountered before. Our room was great, the breakfast was delicious, and the coffee was out of this world. I would never stay any place else.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful accomodation with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Holis47
Reviews.Content: I could not fault the Residenza Cellini. All the staff and owners are wonderful and could not be more genuinely helpful and courteous. There was always a smile to welcome us and nothing was too much trouble. The location was excellent, a short walk from the railway station and within walking distance to all the main sights. The rooms and public areas were beautiful and spotlessly clean. Our triple room was quite small but beautifully appointed throughout. The bathroom was gorgeous and although the shower cubicle was small, the hydro shower itself was hot and powerful and a lovely end to a busy day in Rome. Breakfast was plentiful and consisted of pastries, biscuits, cereal, meats, cheese, bread, crispbreads, yogurt, spreads ( jam, marmalade, Nutella, honey ), fruit and fruit juices, a large choice of different teas, coffee and hot chocolate. It was our wedding anniversary while we were there and we received a complementary bottle of wine and nibbles which was a lovely touch. Free internet access was also available. I would recommend this place to everyone and would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful gem in the heart of overpriced and underwhelming hotels”
Reviews.Author: Debkat4
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed 3 nights at this hotel; 9/25, 26, 27. It always felt like coming home and the end of the day. The rooms were clean and beautifully furnished. The staff was wonderful and treated all the guests like they were a family. Because they were only 6 rooms, the breakfast room was nice and small and gave us an opportunity to meet new guests every morning. This was the best hotel I have ever stayed at in Rome and I will ALWAYS return here.

Reviews.Title: “Best ever apartment and service! Thank you”
Reviews.Author: deanjo1979
Reviews.Content: We booked in the hotel originally but our flight didn't quite go to plan so we arrived 2 nights later but the hotel couldn't accommodate the new dates so offered us this wonderful apartment very central and very comfortable would recommend without hesitation. Given the chance if we visit Rome again we will stay here again. Thank you for your help and in depth brief in visiting locations in Rome upon arrival it was invaluable saved time and effort while travelling with our 2year old. Lovely place, accommodation and people!

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat”
Reviews.Author: Happytravels000
Reviews.Content: After reading a lot of reviews about this hotel I decided to try it for myself. I just stayed here for 5 nights and was very happy with the choice. It is very well located within easy walking distance to most of the main attractions, or just around the corner is the metro that is very easy and safe to use. I stayed on level 5 in a very nice room which down the hall had it's own terrace. Breakfast on level 3, also the main reception area, was very nice and relaxed and good quality. The staff were very friendly and helpful and made my stay a memorable one. This is my 4th visit to Rome and I can genuinely say this is the best place I have stayed in. Book early though as it is getting a well deserved reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: elkebritt
Reviews.Content: We spent our last night in Italy in this hotel. Although we were only there one night, it was the most comfortable we were the entire trip. The room was spacious and the jacuzzi shower was just what we needed after a long journey back to Rome. The staff was friendly and available 24 hours. They offered breakfast an hour an a half earlier than normal to accomodate our early departure for the airport. Hopefully we'll be able to visit Rome again soon and spend a few more nights in these wonderful accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: OhioIrish
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our trip to Italy which included a six night stay at the Residenza Cellini. This hotel had exactly what we wanted - a central location (quick walk to Termini Station, metro, and historic sites), a larger room (we had a junior suite) that was exceptionally clean, and attentive service. We also appreciated the free use of a computer and the willingness of the staff to assist us with excellent dining recommentations, directions, and arrangements for transportation to the airport. We found this hotel on TA and are so glad we stayed there. This is an excellent choice for your stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysPlanning
Reviews.Content: After a long plane flight, this property was a welcome relief. We were able to check in around 11:00 a.m. The room was small, but very clean well appointed. The hotel staff was very gracious to any request. It surprised me how quite the hotel was for being in a city. It was close to the Metro and bus routes.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time a Charm”
Reviews.Author: Traveler093
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Rome, and the Residenze Cellini, a second time. It was terrific. The hotel is small, quiet, friendly and charming. The bedroom was immaculate and the bathroom was state of the art and extremely clean. The breakfast was just right, and the staff was extremely accommodating and helpful (Thanks Georges). I would definitely stay at this hotel on my next trip to Rome, and would strongly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel -- definitely stay here”
Reviews.Author: avidtraveler0055
Reviews.Content: I'll echo every positive thing that has been said about this hotel: I wholeheartedly recommend it. The rooms are spacious, sparkling clean and nicely decorated (I was in a double). The bathrooms are also a good size and in great condition with jacuzzi jets in the shower (others have commented the showers are small -- they aren't large, but they're no smaller than any other shower I encountered in touring Italy). The staff is friendly, helpful and all speak English. They were always available to give us recommendations and draw directions on a map. Everywhere we wanted to go (Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Piazza Navona, Colosseum) was in walking distance, but there's also a metro stop a block away when you tire of walking (and the metro is included free if you buy a Roma pass). There's a buffet breakfast every morning that easily surpassed the other hotel breakfasts I had on my trip. I miss the croissants and cappuccino. In sum: you can't beat this place.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel of our Europe trip”
Reviews.Author: Natarajan_Sankar
Reviews.Content: Residenza Cellini was the last hotel on our Euro trip and we were totally delighted by the hotel. It was a 10 minute walk from the train station (2 min from the metro station) and is located in a great place. The staff at the reception is very very helpful and the room were great. The breakfast was amazing and there was a laptop along with internet which helped us check our mailboxes. All in all it is a great hotel for the price which was charged and this is definitely my pick of all the hotels we stayed in

Reviews.Title: “A lovely, peaceful base for a Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Minnie17
Reviews.Content: Residenza Cellini is a rather nice, rather Italian little hotel and as there are no half marks on Tripadvisor I have decided upon 4 stars rather than 5. Most of what needs to be said about this hotel has already been said by other reviewers, so I thought I would just mention the things that for me were most appreciated and most lacking. The location is great (15 mins walk to many landmarks and near to the train station and Metro), the staff is efficient and friendly and our room was large and comfortable with great air-con. Our room was very nicely furnished with quality furnishings and a comfortable bed. Our bathroom was also of high quality with marble fixtures. The hotel is quiet and characterful (reception and breakfast room on 3rd floor, our room and terrace on the 5th) and is serviced by a lovely, but quite tiny old lift. We also made use of the free, but rather erratic wifi. The breakfast appears to be a matter of slight contention with Tripadvisors, so for those interested I have uploaded some photos. For us, the breakfast was good – we enjoyed the freshly made cappuccinos and the pastries especially. Otherwise we could have had yoghurts, cheese, ham, rolls, a Special K type cereal, fruit, biscuits and those hard, little toast things with a selection of jams. Fairly basic fare, but good stuff all round. There are only a couple of negatives I would mention: there was no tourist information in the room which would have been useful and our room was slightly dark and without a view to speak of. I suspect, though, that all these negatives may be applicable to almost all Rome hotels. Overall I would strongly recommend this Residenza Cellini, primarily because of the kindness of the staff, the size of the rooms, the location and the character of the place. A lovely place to stay when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: foodie491
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights at Residenza Cellini. It met our expectations in every way. Staff was friendly and very helpful with excellent restaurant recommendations in the immediate area. Room (#5) was spacious and very clean. Fifth floor terrace was pleasant even in very hot Rome weather. Would look forward to returning on next visit to Rome and would highly recommend. Good value for price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great”
Reviews.Author: katarob
Reviews.Content: I am going to be a bit contrarian here , but I found this place a bit strange. The fact that it is not a full service hotel did not bother me. I knew that going in and have stayed many times at pensiones and B&Bs and know what to expect. I wasn't aware that the hotel is housed in a building which is shared by many other "hotels". It was not a problem in itself, just odd to go up in the elevator seeing all these assorted "hotels" on each floor. We joked that we were in a bordello! But that is not my complaint. Our room must have been the smallest one in the house, not what I would remotely call a " double superior" room and nothing like any of the pictures that they show in their website. When I asked if all "Double superior" were this size I was told "yes". However, the other few rooms I saw as they were being cleaned looked significantly bigger. The bathroom was equally small, specially the shower which was a joke. How do overweight people deal with that? My husband and I are thin and had trouble with it. The small shower enclosure is made even smaller by an added strip of "jacuzzi" jets. Ridiculous. The breakfast room is minimal. The tables were so close together that I felt I could hear what other people were thinking. Coffee was almost undrinkable. Some of the people that were at the front desk were very odd, and any request for basic things such as a blanket or how to adjust the A/C in the room, was met by a stare, like we were asking for something unheard of. As a matter of fact, we were told that we couldn't keep the room at a lower temp because it would blow a fuse. The temperature they kept adjusting it to the minute we left the room was barely acceptable for the hot temps in Rome. On the positive I will say that it was very clean and the decor was nice. Location was convenient for us as one of the days we were there we did a day trip by train and it's very close to Termini. It's also close to the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not worth the high ratings”
Reviews.Author: bostonbobby123
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Rome with my husband, mother and 4 children. We chose Cellini because of its high ratings, but I don't think they were deserved. The location was okay, close to the train station, metro and bus stop but far from many of the sights (Forum, Piazza Navona, Spanish Steps). The rooms were good, but not consistent. We had a quad and a triple, and our quad was spacious with a big bathroom. However, our triple was small and the bathroom was tiny. The breakfast was not very good (not enough options) and the breakfast room was way too small. Our quad and triple were on the 3rd and 5th floor of the building, which after a long day in the 90 degree heat seemed like a long hike. The old, small elevator did not fit all our bags and was not a way of getting up to our rooms. Overall, it was average and doesn't deserve the high ratings that other people give it.

Reviews.Title: “Large Apartment Great Location - Associated with Residenza Cellini”
Reviews.Author: ef10s2
Reviews.Content: Unlike in the US we found it challenging to find hotels in Europe with rooms that would accomodate 4 people, which they call Quads. Based on reviews we read on Trip Advisor we contacted Hotel Residenza Cellini but they did not have any "quads" available. However, they suggested we would be much more comfortable and it would be more affordable if we reserved an apartment that was managed by the Hotel rather than reserve 2 rooms at the hotel. They were right. And as we discovered, the apartment had a better location closer to the historical areas like the Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon than did the hotel. Upon our arrival we were met by Gaetano who showed us around the 3 bedroom apartment we rented on the 4th floor at Via M. Dionigi, #17. He also spent a lot of time with us to show us where we were located and where we could go nearby for dinners out. The hotel front desk could be called from the apartment for any questions or even to assist with dinner reservations. We stayed 5 nights and the apartment was cleaned once with fresh towels provided during our stay, which was sufficient. The master bedroom was very large and spacious and contained an in-wall safe, air conditioner, phone, and TV. The 2nd bedroom contained 2 twin beds and was also amply sized. The 3rd bedroom was very small and suitable only for one person and one small bed. The apartment was tastefully decorated, clean and very large. Although not luxurious, it was a very comfortable and quite place for us to stay. The main bathroom was plenty large and had an excellent shower and there was also a dining room off of the kitchen that was stocked with cooking hardware, refrigerator, and some breakfast basics like juice, croissants, toast, bread, jam, and milk. The neighborhood was quiet and safe and had several good places to dine in the evening if we didn't want to cross the river to walk to the historical site seeing areas. If we did decide to take a walk for dinner or shopping we could get to many places within about a half a mile. We were also very close to a bus stop that makes it easy to get over to the Coloseum and Forum, which are too far to walk to. We were a little weary of choosing an apartment rental over a full service hotel but in the end it worked out great for us. Unless you must have total luxury and full service amenities, we would highly recommend this apartment to families traveling as it definitely is more comfortable and more affordable than most other options. In our minds there is no comparison of the location versus the Residenza Cellini, which is further away from the historical sites and is also located on an upper level floor of a building. One word of caution - parking is extremely limited and difficult to find nearly every place in Rome and the area around the apartment is no exception.

Reviews.Title: “Jewel of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: thehaggs
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Close to the bus line and train station. Very helpful staff. Breakfast was yummy. Would definately return. We stayed in the large family room with our two older teenagers, was a bit tight, but we managed. Loved the big bathtub.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute jewel in Rome-perfection!”
Reviews.Author: Jenni721
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our wonderful 2 week trip to Italy where we had the extreme good fortune to stay in the Residenza Cellini in Rome for a total of 5 nights.. Every once in awhile a hotel comes along that is superior in every way and RC is that and more for the following reasons: Service: Truly the gold standard in this area-from the minute we walked in we were made to feel welcome and nurtured. When we would come home each evening and take the charming vintage elevator up to reception to pick up our room key, someone at the desk would be right there at the elevator door to hand us our key so we didn't even have to get off. In addition Georges and the rest of the staff answered our endless questions with patience, enthusiasm and good humor. Rooms: We felt so fortunate to stay in Rm 503 on the 5th floor which was cozy and sparkling clean, beautiful decor and we loved the state of the art bathroom! And we had our own private terrace which was enclosed in the larger 5th floor terrace that many other reviewers have referenced-absolutely lovely to sit out on with a cold drink after a long day of sightseeing. We took full advantage! It was extremely hot in Rome and when we returned to our room each day our A/C was turned on which was so lovely and refreshing. The A/C is controlled by remote so you are able to adjust at all times to personal preference-a big plus! Overall ambiance of hotel: Just lovely-we felt like we were staying in a very elegant home. The roooms and hallways are beautifully decorated and sparkle throughout. The breakfast room is very nice and was a great place to start each day. Breakfast: For us, the continental breakfast buffet was perfect. Pastries, breads, cereals, meat, cheese, fruit, yogurt, etc. And then of course the best part, your coffee preference (Expresso, cappucino, American coffee, etc) brought steaming hot to your table. We throughly enjoyed meeting others and sharing experiences, tips, etc. Location: We loved the location!! Easy access to Termini, metro and bus and we enjoyed the surrounding area very much-great restaurants, very clean, nice to stroll. It was a bit of a walk to the major sites but we liked being out of the 'hub' a bit. The front desk made it easy to navigate the area and all of the sites with their large stack of maps that they would mark for us each time we went out. In conclusion, we have travelled extensively and have enjoyed many, many different types of accomodations from motels to B&Bs to 5 star hotels/resorts and we can honestly give Residenza Cellini the highest recommendation with great enthusiasm. It was an absolutely wonderful place to 'come home' to each evening. We will never stay anywhere else in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Lovestotravel0401
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Residenza Cellini twice and absolutely love it! The staff is truly wonderful and always go the extra mile to make sure you are happy. The offer excellent suggestions as to restaurants and great places to shop. We had a fabulous stay both times and would be glad to stay there again should we return to Rome, which I hope we will.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Travellers000
Reviews.Content: This was everything advertised on the website and then some. Initial emails regarding reservations and follow-up were prompt and complete. Georges was fantastic, responding to our questions and the other staff were also very accommodating. Restaurant recommendations and tips regarding getting around Rome to the various sites were perfect. Reception upon arrival was very gracious and the room fantastic, clean, and comfortable. We enjoyed the breakfasts which were provided and they have a new covered porch a few floors above the hotel rooms which was very pleasant and quiet to just sit and sip wine after a full day of activities. The neighborhood was safe to walk day or night. We cannot say enough about this small hotel and can fully understand why it has been ranked as one of the best finds in Rome. We would most certainly plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay in the city.”
Reviews.Author: mustlovetravel
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here in the middle of our 2 week trip and returned for a final nights before our morning return flight to home. The rooms we had were quite nice with adequate space, spotless bathrooms and lovely decor. It was a wonderfully relaxing place to return to after a hectic day touring the city sights. We loved the fifth floor terrace and met many interesting guests there. Although the elevator is small and somewhat cumbersome, that is common in older buidlings. The staff were just great in assisting us with any of our needs. We would definitely return and highly recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “We were very pleased”
Reviews.Author: bikefast
Reviews.Content: Our first three nights in Italy were at Residenza Cellini and it got us off to a good start. Our room was clean, spacious and comfortable, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the location was great. Great access to the metro and busses, but you can walk to the major sites if you're into that. Be sure to get a Roma pass. We especially enjoyed the Target Restaurant 1/2 block away for both lunch and dinner. The Termilni-Metro connection isn't very convenient; you might want to use a cab. And where were all those pickpockets we kept reading about?

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: Kukie1
Reviews.Content: Look, it is difficult finding a quality hotel under 250 euros in the center of Rome in season and we found this hotel via TripAdvisor and we were delighted with the results. We chose a mini suite for a little extra money and it was well worth it. The staff was super friendly, the breakfast was adequate and the location is quiet and central. Plus they have a small terrace on the 5th floor if you want to sip a glass of wine. Lugging suitcases up in a very small elevator was no fun but it seems a lot of small hotels have this problem. This was the perfect hotel to end our 7 day trip of Italy!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Handy location and good service”
Reviews.Author: Dakotah1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at the Residenza Cellini in Rome. The quad room was large enough for a couple with children or four individuals who know each other very well. the bathrooms were beautiful, clean and efficient. The staff was helpful with reservations at local sites. The fifth floor terrace was a real treat after long days site seeing. Breakfast was excellent in the small breakfast room. Free internet was also very nice.

Reviews.Title: “paradise in the eternal city”
Reviews.Author: canmex23
Reviews.Content: Stayed with brother and wife for a second time which was equally as good as the first time. Perfect location, super friendly staff and excellent quality and services. I wouldn't want to experience Rome any other way and it is located close to everything. Thank you to all the staff for another wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: mdajmom1
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel with the most accomadating staff. Large, clean rooms great location and a staff that will go out of the way to make sure your trip is great. Breakfast is a nice touch and make sure you spend some time on the patio on the 5th floor its a great place to unwind.

Reviews.Title: “Best small hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: SQguy
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and this is ONE of the BEST small hotels I have stayed with my family. This hotel offers a very good size CLEAN room. good beds, clean layout, HOT water with good pressure, iron with stand (with request), FREE wifi , GOOD italian break fast, Facility for same day cleaning for cloths,,,,list goes on! The staff is great....Feels you are staying with a RICH family in Rome with all the comforts.....very good with recomendations for food....buying good quality Italian made shirts and ties...... This was my first visit to Residenza Cellini and will return again...HIGHLY RECOMENDED. Special thanks to Barbara, Donato, Georges, Robert and Magarita.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't recommend this small hotel highly enough.”
Reviews.Author: vallerenn
Reviews.Content: We booked a short 3 night stay, for my wife and myself. The hotel staff were very welcoming. We were surprised at the size and quality of the room - it was large, beautifully decorated with a small balcony. Bathroom had a jacuzzi. The continental Italian breakfast was good and available until 10.30. The staff were all very helpful and polite. The location was great to walk to most sights.The hotel recommended some restaurants, two of which we tried and were superb - Taverna Flavia and Rinaldi Al Quirinalle. Would definately go back to the hotel ( and restaurants).

Reviews.Title: “A Little boutique gem in the heart of the City of Eternal Light”
Reviews.Author: TripperGal
Reviews.Content: We had 8 days to spend in Rome, partly for business (spent at another conference hotel on the outskirts), and partly for pleasure. This is where we spent 5 of 8 days, for our leisure portion. Once our patient cab driver made his way from the airport through the blocked off streets (massive political rallies in the city that day), we found ourselves at this charming little boutique hotel, consisting of about a dozen rooms on two floors in a quaint "Belle Epoque" building near the Piazza della Repubblica- complete with tiny, cranky, luggage-challenged elevator cage, just like you see in the movies. You would actually walk right by it if you didn't know it was there. Certainly no grand facade or pretentions on the outside. There are 5 or 6 floors to the building, with each floor accommodating a few rooms as part of several small hotels within. Opt for the 5th floor, with outside terraces off the hallway and one of the rooms. Rooms are actually quite small, but very well-appointed, elegant and comfortable. Beds a bit on the hard side, but generous in size. Stunning, if small, bathrooms. TV service is about what you'd expect - once you figure out the "code" you can bring in more than just Italian-language programming. But who stays in Rome to watch TV?! If you stay more than 2 days, and pay cash, you get a reduced rate. Still a bit pricey, but given that you are a 5 minute walk from the "Republicca" metro station, or a 15 minute walk from some of the major sites (incl the Colosseum, the Tiber River, etc), it's worth it. Excellent restaurants within minutes' walking, and the accommodating staff are quite happy to make recommendations and reservations. Breakfast is included in the price; nothing special - standard continental fare of coffee/tea, juice, bread and pastries, meat and cheese trays, fresh fruit, yogurt and cereal, but enough to get you going. Some decent, affordable shopping just around the corner along Via Nationale. Charming, relaxed, old fashioned service in the heart of one of the most exciting cities in the world. Certainly worth its rating as one of the top places to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Easter Holidays”
Reviews.Author: Mefa2003
Reviews.Content: We spent the Easter weekend with our 2 kids (7 and 10) at the Residenza Cellini. We had a quadruple room which had a king size bed and two single beds. The room was spacious, clean and very beautiful with stuccoed ceiling and parquet flooring. We had a Jacuzzi bathtub which was great after a long day in the streets of Rome and Sky Cable TV with many English and children’s channels. Hotel Cellini is well located, within walking distance of Rome's major attractions and Termini. We took the bus from the airport to Termini and walked to Cellini. We also walked to Termini for the sightseeing and public buses which start there. At the following stops the buses were often too crowded for anyone to get in! Breakfast was very good with cappuccino, bread, ham, cheese, pastries, yoghurt and fruits. The staff is very caring and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location, outstanding staff.”
Reviews.Author: maryoffmarket
Reviews.Content: My daughter decided to run the Rome marathon and I traveled to Rome to witness the event and enjoy being in Italy. The hotel had been recommended to me by a friend. The service and attention by the staff was remarkable. When they knew she was running and would leave before the breakfast set up, they opened the entire breakfast up early so we could have something to eat before we left. They graciously rewarded her when she returned having completed 42 kilometers and were extraordinarily kind and helpful. I travel extensively for work and seldom find this level of attention. The hotel is located near the termini so easy to walk to all public transport options. The room we had was spacious and comfortable. I don't see myself staying anywhere else when I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid hotel”
Reviews.Author: danaUSA
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cellini is a superb hotel. The staff is cordial, charming and and helpful, the hotel itself is lovely and spotless -- literally, and the room was spacious, well equipped, and and beautiful. It felt like a quiet refuge in the midst of the rush and noise of Rome. The staff made you feel that they were delighted to see you. To the staff: Thank you for a wonderful week! LOVED HOTEL CELLINI

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: pinks2000
Reviews.Content: We had a truly wonderful experience at the Residenza Cellini. It is well located, within walking distance of Rome's major attractions. The facilities are attractive, and the staff was as nice and accommodating as any I have seen anywhere. The rooms are generously large and are attractive and recently renovated. Very clean. It was very nice to come back to the hotel at night. They make you feel like family. I would describe it as a hidden gem.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: BrennaBee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cellini for the 1st time last week for 3 days. The Residenza is about a 5 min walk from Termini very close we walked to the Hotel. We had a junior suite which was wonderful. The room had a large tub/shower, mini bar, TV where you could translate certain channels to english, a nice sofa, table & chairs for meals. The room was just perfect. In addition the staff are so helpful. Anything you need they can offer assistance. They put out breakfast at 6:30am for us since we were leaving for an ealry train. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: sb372116
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Residenza Cellini apartments with my family. This was our second time staying in the apartment. We loved everything about it- both times! We have not yet stayed in the hotel, but they told us that the hotel is near Termini. The apartments are over the river, a 5 minute walk to the Vatican. Also, it is only a 5 minute walk to Piazza Navona. The location was something that was important to us and we were very satisfied. We were there for 8 days walked almost everywhere since we were so close. The apartment itself is beautiful. Since we were traveling with several people, we wanted something nice, but spacious. There were 5 of us in total. There were three bedrooms- one with a single bed and two with a double bed. They also added another single bed at our request. We had 2 1/2 baths, a kitchen and a dining room- a very big apartment. They cleaned halfway through our trip as well. When we arrived our kitchen was stocked with milk, juice, and breakfast foods. That made our vacation much easier as we did not have to worry about breakfast. Also, we went on two day trips while we were in Rome and the front desk helped us with directions both times. Furthermore, the staff are very friendly. They are more than willing to help with any transportation needs. They arranged to have a van drive us to and from the airport. Overall, I would highly recommend the apartments to anyone who visits Rome. The apartment, location and staff exceeded our expectations- both times. They really did go above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely room to return to”
Reviews.Author: WhereeverIhangmyhat
Reviews.Content: We booked a junior suite room and enjoyed our stay. The room was large and included two armchairs and a small table, in addition to a large bed. The wooden flooring always looked clean. The bathroom was a generous size too and in good condition with a shower over a bath. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was continental style with fresh bread rolls, ham and cheese each day in addition to yoghurt and pastries. We found Rome was expensive but felt it was worth staying at Residenza Cellini. The reception is on the 3rd floor and some rooms are on the 5th floor but there is a lift if your feet are tired after a day's walking around town. There is also a small outdoor terrace set aside on the 5th floor that you can use.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: princessjenney
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints. Our room was clean. Breakfast was normal of Italy (pastries and cappuccino). The price was very decent. The location was great for us. We walked easily to the Spanish Steps, Trevi and Pantheon and I'm nearly 7 months pregnant. We took the metro to the Vatican and the Colosseum. The metro stop was right around the corner. All in all I had a great time in Rome with my husband =)

Reviews.Title: “Stay here, you will not be dissapointed.”
Reviews.Author: MarkHingham
Reviews.Content: On your first full day get a Roma pass. This gives you unlimited travel on bus/metro and you will need it as you will walk mega-miles even with transport. It also gives you free admission to 2 museum sites. Save one for the Colosseum as this allows you to jump the queue which will be long but you will not realise this until you get near the ticket office.So get one and save an hour. The hotel is wonderful, the staff are so helpfull and the room we had,junior suite, was quiet and very comfortable and spotlessly clean.We spend a lot of time in hotels and this one is right at the top of the list.Well done Residenza Cellini.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, great room, good location!!!”
Reviews.Author: DanielNNyc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at room number 2 (Junior Suite), for 3 nights. The hotel is located in a quiet street next to Republica Piazza and the Metro Station which is very convenient. Room is beautiful and extremely clean. Staff was VERY VERY helpful and friendly (assisted us in choosing local restaurants, public transport, and day trips). Breakfast was very good (coffee, fresh bread, chesse, cold cuts and pastries). Free internet access with the hotel's laptop...we would highly recommend this place for anyone who's looking for a piece of home in Rome. we'll definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Charming staff, elegant rooms”
Reviews.Author: SussexWorldtraveller
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights here. We originally contacted the hotel directly as a result of TripAdvisor reviews 18 months ago. We had to postpone our trip until now but when we recontacted the hotel, again they offered us a special rate. You get the best rate if you pay cash. Also, our stay was in low season, and we were staying more than 4 night, we were also offered a bottle of complimentary spumante. To describe the level of service at Residenza Cellini: Most hotels would just plonk your bottle of fizz in your room. We were asked what time we wanted ours served and where - either in the small beakfast area or in our room. At the appointed time we got a call just to check we were ready for our drink, then it was served on a silver tray, the bottle in a silver bucket of ice, with flutes, a selection of savoury nibbles, napkins and a stopper. Once we had drunk half the bottle, we felt we had had enough as we planned to have a bottle of wine with our dinner shortly. The staff were more than happy to suggest that they would keep the stoppered bottle in their fridge and all we needed to do was ask for it again. We had a repeat performance the next night! There is always somebody at the front desk and that person always has a welcoming smile, speak good English and is courteous, polite, helpful and willing. From the warm welcome on arrival, with a helpful briefing of how to get the best of Rome, the key transport options for the major sites from the doorstep and some suggestions of neighbourhood eateries, to our departure with a wave and plea to return one day, we could not fault the service. Our room was plenty large enough for our needs, with old fashioned furniture which suited the age and style of the building well. The bed was firm and comfortable, the lighting excellent for Italy and there was enough storage for our layers, this being winter. The bathroom was compact but again brightly lit and the sanitary ware modern and spotless. We had a minor problem with the toilet flush, but this was rectified immediately. The only complaint perhaps was that the room was always too hot for our liking for sleep, but this was easily remedied by turning the heating off and opening a window. We would make two comments of warning: The hotel is really more of a style B&B, housed in a large apartment in a large, old building. It is on the 3rd floor, and it is not easy to see the sign for it at the entrance door. Between the hours of 7.30pm and 9.00am roughly, the doors are locked when the building concierge is off duty. You then have to find and ring the doorbell to gain entry to the building. Also, owing to the narrow inset door, several steps before the door and more once inside before you reach the lift/elevator, which is very small, old fashioned and extremely awkward to get in and out of, the hotel is not the ideal choice of anybody with small children in buggies/strollers or with mobility restrictions.

Reviews.Title: “Our room was beautiful, staff helpful and respectful, central location.”
Reviews.Author: Exploringworks
Reviews.Content: This was a return visit to Residenza Cellini. The staff makes settling into Rome very easy with their knowledge, gentle voices, fluency in English. The room decor is sophisticated and well coordinated; the jacuzzi and high quality bathroom fixtures feel regal. The common areas are filled with blooming orchids. It's placid and alive at the same time. We like the location. There's a metro within 2 blocks and several bus lines that run along Via Nazionale, about 1.5 blocks away. We walked from Termini to the hotel with our luggage. We walk to the Spanish Steps, though as we get older the walk seems a little long in winter, maybe 15-20 minutes. We've stayed at other nice hotels in Rome near this location and elsewhere, but this hotel is the best for us in every way.

Reviews.Title: “We'll stay again”
Reviews.Author: ArttexSteve
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in an apartment nearby, we were looking for a hotel nearby and found the recommendations in Trip Advisor for Residenza Cellini. We stayed for 3 nights in Mid January and loved it. The room was great, and the staff friendly and informative. We loved the small hotel atmosphere and really enjoyed the hospitality and caring of the owners and staff. Great job! We will be back..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: aw7344
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for our silver wedding anniversary based on previous Trip Advisor reviews, so a big thank you to those who have contributed already. The hotel was fantastic. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and provided a map detailing all the usual places of interest, told us where to catch the buses and the Metro and how to get tickets. They also recommended the Roma Pass which cost 23 Euros and allowed us travel all over the city for three days on buses and the Metro and gets you into two museums for free. The room was very clean and comfortable and the shower was great - 3 settings, always hot enough and plenty of flow. Best of all though was the jacuzzi which was more than welcome after walking around the city all day. The breakfast was lovely with a great choice to suit all tastes (particularly those with a sweet tooth!) Our friends are going to Rome in August and I will ertainly recommend this hotel to them. I would love to go back to stay there again and was sorry to leave. I strongly recommend this hotel to others but not if it means that I can't get in next time as there are only a few rooms. Well worth its excellent rating.

Reviews.Title: “qulity hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: bentfords
Reviews.Content: We booked the Residenza Cellini for two nights on the first leg of our honeymoon. The hotel is in a great location next to the metro station. It actually shares the same building as the suite dreams hotel, must be something in the water! The staff were welcoming and could not do enough to help. Wireless access in the rooms was a great bonus. The room was well furnished, maybe not the most modern but exceptionally clean and with a large bathroom and jacuzzi bath. One night we brought home a bottle of bubbly thinking we would have to sneak it into the room. Only to be handed a wine cooler, ice and crystal flutes five minutes later. The hotel is also walking distance from the train station, dont get a taxi. Would recommend to anyone after a quiet hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ronerick
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a very quick trip to Rome totaling only 5 nights. Stayed 3 nights at another property, where my husband had a small conference. Decided to stay another couple nights, closer to the center of Rome. Like others have said, the staff are great. Not overbearing but very gracious and kind. The hotel has a lot of character and is sparkling clean. The only sad thing is now we're home and I feel we saw only a slice of what Rome has to offer. Would return to the eternal city, and the Residenza Cellini in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST stay in all of Italy!”
Reviews.Author: DebbieSMaryland_USA
Reviews.Content: I am in my mid-fifties and have traveled extensively. I have had the pleasure of staying in some of the best 4 and 5 star hotels in the world and I am delighted to share a wonderful find in the heart of Rome. We recently traveled to Italy with our family of eight. Our stay was two weeks so we hopped cities a good bit. Each night required 3 rooms. We found a bed and breakfast in the heart of Rome and booked our three rooms for the final leg of our trip. I was absolutely delighted with the place! The rooms were quite spacious, spotless and decorated beautifully. Breakfast each day was lovely as well. The kids were thrilled because they offered wi-fi in the rooms at no additional charge. But the best part of Residenza Cellini was a concierge named George. What a delight he was! This dear man did more than anyone anywhere has ever done in trying to make our stay as comfortable as possible. Whenever we approached with another question about restaurants, taxis, museums, or shopping he acted as if we were the only guests in the hotel. He was pleasant, smart, and so very helpful. Even when we did not need reservations we would arrive at a restaurant and find that George had called ahead to secure our table and even made sure there was a baby seat waiting for us. A few days before our departure he asked if we would need transportation to the airport. I had forgotten to line that up. Again, since we were such a large party with lots of luggage, he needed some advance notice to secure a large vehicle. We were unable to print our boarding passes and George brought something from home to allow us to print on the hotel's computer. Again, he spent most of an hour working with my husband to do that. Breakfast was served daily at 7:30 and we were slated to leave at 7:15 so I assumed we would eat when we got to the airport. The night before our departure George told us breakfast would be ready at 6:45 for us. He thought of absolutely everything! The last night there I asked for the owner's contact information so I could commend his service and he turned red and said there was no need for that. So self-effacing! And never without a smile! I would recommend Residenza Cellini at Via Modena, 5 Roma. www.residanzacellini.it to anyone looking for a great place to stay in Rome. I have absolutely nothing to gain by sharing other than the hope that you might experience the same joy we all felt in our home away from home in Rome. I promise you will be as pleased as we were.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious Living in the Heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: TravelerOklahomaCity
Reviews.Content: For a warm welcome and a thoughtful reception, Residenza Cellini and its staff are the best at beginning your stay with a sense of the hospitality that will continue while you are there. Our room was furniished with quality and taste. The amenities are excellent. And without doubt, Barbara De Paolis and her staff are quietly superb. Close to transportation by Metro and bus, the small (11 rooms) hotel is also close to major museums. We recommend Residenza Cellini highly! Dan and Barbara Batchelor Oklahoma City, Oklahoma, USA

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT, EXCELLENT, EXCELLENT WOULD RETURN IN A MINUTE”
Reviews.Author: Floridatravelingduo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residenza Cellini for 6 nights and it was just wonderful. I worked with Francesca and Georges to plan our hotel stay. I couldn't have asked for a cleaner hotel with impeccable service that was within walking distance to many attractions. It was 5 minutes to the train station and about 7 minutes to the bus station. It far exceeded our expectations. I can't say enough about the staff and the service. Anything we wanted or needed was taken care of including reservations to museums, restaurants or just plain directions. I felt like I was in a movie with the shinning marble floors and draperies from ceiling to floor. The next street over from the Residenza is the main road Nationale Republic which has lots of shopping, restaurants and a great little bar we found where the people were very friendly. That was relaxing at the end of our long day of touring. One thing I must say is that we left some items in the room when we departed and by the time we arrived home in the US we had a message from the Hotel about our items. They were immediately sent to us and some included dollars. I was really impressed but based on the people we interfaced with I wasn't surprised. They have very high standards. We will definitely stay at the Residenza Cellini during our next trip to Rome and highly recommend it to anyone thinking of traveling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, beautiful accommodations, friendly and helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: kwatson103
Reviews.Content: Location is the best! Train station is a 5 minute walk, metro a 1 minute walk (metro goes to Vatican, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, etc). Many sites are within walking distance (we walked to the Colisseum!) The hotel is located on a quiet street and is one of a few hotels in the same building, which is fun. There is an elevator if you don't want to walk up the three flights of beautiful marble stairs, but after eating the fabulous food in the neighborhood, you'll want to burn off some calories! The rooms are beautifully decorated and the bathrooms are large and elegant (with heated towel warmers!) The staff is very friendly, helpful and all speak excellent English. Internet is available all day long. The breakfast is delicious and although the breakfast room is small, you never feel pressured or crowded. I would recommend this hotel to everyone - you will feel pampered!

Reviews.Title: “Our best hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: Illinioisian
Reviews.Content: We stayed 10 nights at the Residenza Cellini and simply put it was our nicest hotel experience ever. The hotel itself is wonderful with high ceilings, wood floors, tastefully decorated rooms (with live orchids!), and the kind of old world charm that is very difficult to find in Europe any more. But, as with any hotel, it is the staff and owners that make a hotel and I can say that that the staff and owner at this hotel truly understand what service is all about. Without exception, the staff was kind, gracious, and helpful, something I cannot unfortunately say for the 5-star hotels in which we have have stayed. I was under the weather two days and they prepared breakfast trays for me at their suggestion. We asked where we could buy stamps and they got them for us. Our flight left early, so they set up the breakfast room an hour early, so we could have breakfast before we left. Because we were staying a long time, the owner sent us complimentary wine two different times and a take-home box of fine chocolates. This list goes on and on. Would we stay at the Cellini again? In a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, not disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Lizzypumpkin
Reviews.Content: This was our second time in Rome but the first time at Residenza Cellini. No disappointments there. T his hotel is on the 3rd and 5th floor. The breakfast room is on the 3rd floor along with the front desk. We stayed on the 5th floor in a newly renovated room. Modern bathroom that had a shower which was not large but adequate with choice of a regular shower head or multi jet. The room itself was large enough with sufficient storage space in an armoire. Very clean and made up every day. On our floor we had a terrific covered terrace to go and have a glass of wine before heading out for dinner. Breakfast was adequate. After all, this is Europe and they do not eat the same way that we do. There were meats (hams and salamis), cheeses, bread, pastries, yogurts and fresh fruit. And of course, the wonderful cappuccino's. The location is terrific and on a quiet street just behind the via Nationale. There are shops, retaurants, bus stops, and the metro station just a few steps away. About a 10 minute walk to the Spanish steps. Maybe 20 minutes from the Colloseum and 20 minutes from the Borghese museum. The people at the front desk were always ready to recommend restaurants, sites to visit or directions to whereever you were going. They also reserved the Borghese museum for us. Everyone was very polite and helpful and they all spoke English. This hotel somehow seemed to be a little above the standards of European hotels and I think it is very good value. When we go back to Rome we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: deserttraveler50
Reviews.Content: The Cellini is a wonderful boutique hotel in an old building near the main train, bus and metro station. This makes it easy to get around Rome. The staff is very friendly and helpful. They all speak excellent English. Rooms are newly remodeled and spacious. There is a beautiful rooftop terrace down the hall. A great place for relaxing and having a glass of wine. My only mild complaint would be the breakfast. It is minimal and the same every day which gets tiring if you are staying very long. They do have a WONDERFUL cappuccino in the morning though.

Reviews.Title: “Enthusiastic "2 Thumbs Up" Stay”
Reviews.Author: halelani
Reviews.Content: Never having visited Rome before, I researched the lodging descriptions, recommendations and user reviews of at least six different travel guide web sites and guide books. I searched by areas within the historical part of Rome and compared prices and ratings and finally located about six hotels to contact for availability and prices for our four night stay. Several of my choices offered online booking, but we contacted Residenza Cellini directly via email. Within 24 hours, the hotel responded with their offer based on a final payment of cash or travelers checks. We guaranteed our stay with a credit card and faxed that number to them. We could have called the hotel with the information, but were deterred by the time difference between CA and Rome. The hotel’s excellent service began immediately with prompt responses to our few questions about specific sightseeing recommendations and transfer options from the cruise terminal into the city. We appreciated the hotel's quiet location, one block north of Via Nationale, near Piazza Republica. The hotel’s sign on the building is smaller than expected, so we had a little trouble locating the building initially, but our Google map printed from home before departure came to the rescue. As first time visitors to Italy and Rome, we had no familiarity with the “residenza” lodging category, which seems to be a cross between a small hotel and a B & B. The reception area and some rooms are located on the third floor; our attractive and generous-sized room was located on the fifth floor across the hall from a lovely covered terrace where we ate our take away snacks. Our room and bathroom were spotless and very well maintained each day. The shower enclosure, about the size of a cruise ship shower, offered a variety of sprays and the wonderful water pressure was something I’d forgotten existed. The bed was firm, but because we walked a lot each day and returned exhausted in the evening, we had no trouble sleeping. The new flat screen TV offered a clear, sharp picture and a large selection of program options. The breakfast choices were ample with fresh cold meats and cheeses, cereal, yogurt, fresh fruits and juices, coffee, tea, assorted rolls, Danish, and cookies. Best of all were the suggestions and recommendations of the staff in response to our questions regarding sightseeing, transportation and places to eat. They graciously volunteered to make reservations for the Borghese museum and our transfer from the hotel to the airport. They even lent us a currency converter so that we could recharge our camera battery. The helpfulness and sincere concern of the owners and staff of Residenza Cellini made our visit to Rome something special-a memorable experience and the highlight of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Don't look any further, stay here.”
Reviews.Author: SarahVancouverIsland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real jewel. We stayed at another hotel in the same area for 2 nights, and then switched to the Cellini, and it was the best hotel we had for our entire trip in Italy. It really was a step above the others. Beautiful room, great bathroom, and a lovely covered outside patio area to sip wine at the end of the day. The staff were considerate, helpful and responded immediately to any of our requests. I would absolutely stay here again. I miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: dtdt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because my daughter and son in law stayed here on their honeymoon 2 years ago and were very pleased with the Hotel and staff. We were not disappointed ! Francesca, George, Robert and Jerry were the best staff any hotel could have. Someone is there at the desk 24/7 . We had an early flight out of Rome when we left , and Robert had coffee and a breakfast just for us, arranged at 3:30 in the morning!! Now that is service. We went to Venice halfway through our trip for a few days and took only one of our bags. Residenza Cellini took care of our other bags until we returned for the second half of our stay there. They also upgraded us for free for the second half of the trip. Service is fabulous. The location of the hotel is great. Near the metro, bus line and one metro stop from the train station. When we returned for the second half of our trip, we felt like we were home. Francesca was the first to greet us when we originally arrived and made sure we had everything we needed in our room. The 5th floor patio is great for a glass of wine and cheese and crackers at the end of a long day of touring. The staff was quick to provide wine glasses, knives, cork screw and plates for our little snack! We used their arrangements for transportation to and from the airport by private car. They were very prompt and efficient. This is a welcome sight after flying all night from the states to get to Rome. The hotel is quiet and clean and comfortable. . They also had the best internet in all the hotels we stayed at (3). A+

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the heart of busy Rome”
Reviews.Author: chriswhi1066
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time we have stayed here and it will not be the last, very comfotable and freindly, right in the heart of Rome I cannot recommend it too highly Chris Whitehead UK

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Ruinair
Reviews.Content: Having read the great reviews on Trip Advisor, we spent 5 nights there in October. The hotel itself is down a narrow street just off Via Nazionale. The location was great, only 1 minute from Repubblica metro station. The hotel was spotless and the room very spacious with a jacuzzi bath in the bathroom. The hotel staff could not have been more helpful. The breakfast was very nice also, with a good range of food on offer. On the 5th floor, the hotel had the use of a terrace which was very relaxing after a long day sightseeing. On our last day, the staff gave us a very nice gift and a bottle of wine which was a very thoughtful gesture. All in all, the hotel was expensive but very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem!! (Easy to find) Two Thumbs Up!!”
Reviews.Author: barriefolks
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with two other couples stayed at this remarkable little boutique hotel for 3 nights in October. I booked after reading reviews on the Trip Advisor site and was thrilled to find this little hotel lived up to it's fabulous reputation. The room was spacious and very clean, plenty of hot water in the morning. Complimentry use of a laptop with free internet service is available. Continental breakfast is served on the 3rd floor and is continually replenshed. They offer, cereal, fruit, yogurt, cheeses, meats, many many different types of breads & pastries, juices, tea, coffee, you will not start the day hungry. The cappuccinos are also first rate. The location is also very good and many of the major sites are within walking distance. All of that aside the best reason to stay at this hotel is because of the friendly & knowlagble staff. They made us feel like family. Everytime we approached the front desk with were greeted warmly and with a smile. They were there to offer tips and advice, provided us with directions, made reservations and on my birthday delivered a lovely bottle of sparkling wine with snacks, compliments of the hotel. On a return visit to Rome this would absolutely be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “This was the smartest choice I could have made...absolutely terrific hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MommomZ
Reviews.Content: I went to Rome from Philadelphia for a week this August with 2 grandsons, 17 and 20, and we were treated beautifully and all were thrilled with the accomodations. The folks at the desk always tried to make our stay an easy one...helping with reservations for excursions and reservations and suggestions for restaurants.. The rooms were immaculate, the breakfast more than adequate, the place was quiet and totally refined. I must say that the recommendatiion from trip Advisor was on the money and l later found that Rick Steves also had this hotel on his preferrred list. Merle Z

Reviews.Title: “Suberb service and great location to all the attractions”
Reviews.Author: Wanderer0244
