Reviews.Content: This hidden gem is immaculatly clean with impecable service and conveniently located to all the attractions and the metro.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect place to hang your head”
Reviews.Author: travelindan
Reviews.Content: This is a hidden gem. It is quiet, has a great location (2 blocks from the metro) and the staff is super. There are only 11 rooms, so book it early. We spent 4 nights here and hated to leave. The staff will help you in every way possible, recommending sites to visit, neighborhood restaurants with food to die for, arranging for a limo to take you to and from the airport, and keep the very nice breakfast bar full from 7:00am - 10:30 am. The price seems high for American standards but when comparing it to other hotels in Roma, it's worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Feel right at home”
Reviews.Author: estima7c
Reviews.Content: Trust all you read about this great find! Location, clean and comfortable rooms, free internet etc... but most important of all, the staff here really made the difference. No reservation in offering advices and making us as comfortable as possible throughout our 5 days in Rome. They made you feel right at home.....

Reviews.Title: “A perfect oasis in the middle of bustling Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Sukisen
Reviews.Content: With only 11 rooms, the very hospital staff cater to your every need, even offering to bring us a cappucino at 4 am before our departure. Jerry, George and Francesca are perfect hosts to the guests and will gladly help you find our way around Rome. Many great restaurants nearby. Great to have a free computer to use. The decor is so elegant, beautiful draperies and gorgeous marble and wood floors. And everything is spotless! Thank you so much, Carol and John, Vancouver Canada

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a gem!”
Reviews.Author: Vagabond121
Reviews.Content: The rave reviews for Residenza Cellini are well deserved!  The location is excellent, and even women travelling alone can feel safe here.  The rooms are immaculate and are comfortably furnished.  No permanent press sheets here.  The sheets on the beds at Residenza Cellini are beautifully pressed.  It is the staff, however, that make this hotel exceptional.  They make you feel as though you are a guest in their home.

Reviews.Title: “If you like small, charming and friendly hotels - this is for you!”
Reviews.Author: OnionBermuda
Reviews.Content: We loved this small, charming and friendly hotel. The staff were outstanding and helpful in all areas. The location, being near Termini, bus routes and the metro made getting around Rome very easy and economical. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, very small, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: nysteve
Reviews.Content: Only issue was concrete beds, which didn't really even matter after a long day of touring Rome, one tends to sleep very soundly. Otherwise, very nice small establishment. Priced right, staff very nice and down to earth, made great recommendations that enhanced our general time in Rome. Lovely people.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel of Trip”
Reviews.Author: feezakeeotrist
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 weeks in Europe. Our family vote placed Residenza Cellini at #1. Warm, efficient staff (especially Francesca) welcomed us and allowed early check in after a long flight. Room was a family quad - not suite - but, beds were all comfortable. Spacious bath. Good A/C; quiet; clean and well located. We walked to resaurants, but, often found that sights required a short metro ride (right around the corner) or a taxi. All other hotels we stayed in had either inattentive staff or ineffective a/c...or both. We would stay here again. Breaksfast was pastries, fruit, yogurt and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gizmo100
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel to stay in Rome. I was only here for one night but booked on the basis of the reviews. I would normaly have went for a chain hotel but you really do get individual attention - the staff are lovely and appreciated being shown to our room. Free wifi is great and there is a lovely terrace to sit out at night. Our room was realy nice and i believe from the owner it was one of the newly redecorated rooms and we had a lovely private terrace to sit out on. I think the criticism on the breakfast unfounded and I think they do very well cnsidering the number of bedrooms they have - Im sure the mentioned the breakfast room was going up t the large terrace so that will give them more room. The hotel also recommended a hotel which was absoluetly lovely and not a touristy hotel so we apprecaited that. If I knew anyone going to Rome for a short break would recommend this hotel. If you have your own car with you like we did there is a garage 10 meteres away that you can park but be warned is 30 euros per day!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: canadasbest
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in late June and can recommend this small hotel. The junior suite was large (by european standards), clean and well appointed. It is located on the 3rd floor but a quaint lift works fine. Staff were attentive and very courteous. Is located on a very quiet back street, but close to the metro (2 short blocks), with a cute terrace and free wifi. Would have rated this hotel a 5, but the continental breakfast was only functional --- could be vastly improved with a toaster or some warm pastries.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - Great people !!!”
Reviews.Author: ChuckBennett
Reviews.Content: The staff was great. They were available whenever needed. The rooms are average size but very nice. The shower was awesome. You shouls plan to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and shower but....”
Reviews.Author: MayDay21
Reviews.Content: From what I can tell...if you stay in one of the apartments it is very nice....it not, then.....really hard bed (even my husband who likes a firm mattress thought it was hard), good breakfast, some staff better than others, a GREAT shower, excellent location....It is very pricey and I am not sure it was worth the price....We were happy, but I got the sense that the Hotel Alder in the same great location would have been more our style -- more homey.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Special Birthday”
Reviews.Author: cmgrhs
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the back of the positive reviews we had read on this website, and were not disappointed. We stayed in room 504 on the fifth floor. room was large, airy and quiet for the centre of a city. The staff were extremely helpful, recommending restaurants, and helping with buses. I would stay here again and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “All the reviews you read about this hotel are true - great location, excellent value & fantastic staff.”
Reviews.Author: pebbles033
Reviews.Content: Travelling in a group of eight, we spent four nights here in June prior to taking a cruise from Civitavecchia. The staff could not have been more helpful especially Ajay & Francesca who made our stay memorable. Reception is on the third floor along with the suites & breakfast room. The standard rooms are on the fifth floor where there is a lovely terrace suitable for afternoon/pre-dinner drinks. The staff were always there to bring us glasses/ice etc to make our stay very comfortable. Our transport company who were supposed to pick us up to take us to Civitavecchia let us down & didn't arrive so Francesca organised for another company to collect us which they did with efficiency & ease. This was very much appreciated in what was a stressful situation at the time. The only downside I could think of is, if you are a big person, book a suite as they have shower/baths whereas the standard rooms have showers which are a little small. The breakfast room can also become quite crowded if everyone decides to have breakfast at the same time but these are only two very minor drawbacks.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: MichaelsMom07
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! Our room at Cellini was the nicest and biggest one compared to the other hotels we've stayed at during our Europen trip. My husband loved the free WIFI, my Mother in law loved the decor, my two year old loved the jacuzzi bathtub and I loved EVERYTHING! When I saw the hotel it took my breathe away! It was more than I expected and was the most beautiful hotel that we stayed in on our European tour (london, paris, florence and then finally rome). We had a junior suite one night and a triple the next night- both were great. We WILL stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely room.”
Reviews.Author: Svetlana09
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in April and found it to be lovely. Our room was a nice size, including the bathroom, and it was sparkling clean. The hotel itself was charming and tastefully decorated and the fresh flowers added a nice touch. Breakfast was good and there was always plenty. Availability of free internet was a wonderful plus. The location of this hotel was ideal (once you find it). It's very close to the train station and the hop-on-hop-off buses. Staff was very kind and always tried to be helpful. Would recommend Residenza Cellini.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: richandelsa
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th trip to Rome and our third stay at Cellini. They make us feel like close friends. We wouldn't consider any other place. The people are the best. The owners make you feel at home from the first minute to the last. Their care and attention are unique. The staff who work at breakfast and during the day and night are attentive, helpful and friendly. The location is excellent - close to metro, good bus routes, and many attractions within easy walking distance. The hotel is intimate and lovely. Nice fresh flowers all of the time, plenty of marble, tasteful decorations. The bathrooms are modern with plenty of water. Could not be quieter. There is a laptop computer available for use at no charge. The breakfast is pleasant and has good, made-to-order coffees, and some lovely peach nectar. The terraza is a lovely place to relax in the evening, at the end fo your day or before dinner. A great value in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “This is the place!”
Reviews.Author: SusanMcAustralia
Reviews.Content: Our room was lovely and comfortable with plenty of space, and lots of natural light. Bathrooms also nice and roomy. Location close to Republica Station - great for getting around. Bottle shops close by for that bottle of wine to enjoy on the lovely terrace, where you meet the other guesta while chilling out after a long day sightseeing. Such a quite spot in the middle of the city. The staff are exceptiponal, with wonderful recommendations on the local restaurants, which they will book for you (then you get special treatment from the restaurant!). Anything you need - just ask. Your wish is their command! Lovely breakfast - great coffee!

Reviews.Title: “Residenza Cellini is the right hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: laura3121
Reviews.Content: This trip marks our third to Roma and to the Cellini. We stayed there on our honeymoon (3rd floor), in their private apartment with our family, and now on their newly added additional floor (5th). We have loved each visit and would stay there again in a heartbeat. Their impeccable attention to details is unmatched and their very friendly customer service makes them unbeatable in many hotels anywhere, much less a bustling city like Roma. To say they bend over backwards to make sure your stay is perfect is an understatement. Plus, their rooms are quite large and their jacuzzi tubs make your body feel better after pounding the cobblestone streets of the wonderful city of Roma. During this stay, we even had a small balcony on which we could go out and look into the inner, quiet courtyard. The air conditioner is very efficient and the bathroom (a very important aspect to us) is fantastic, bright and roomy. If all that isn't enough, their breakfast buffet is wonderful, complete with meats, cheeses, yogurts, breads and delicious cappuccinos! There are other hotels in the same building with the Cellini. Don't choose them!!!! Choose the Residenza Cellini!! You won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: The_Skibums
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and it was a great. We had a superior double room for 1 night followed by 3 nights in a junior suite - the latter was in effect a much larger double room with a table and two chairs. Both rooms were very clean and fitted to a high standard. The beds were quite firm, although this suited us. These rooms faced an inner courtyard that was not worth looking at, but it meant there was no outside traffic noise at all. Rooms are located on the 3rd and 5th floors of a building which houses some other hotels. Breakfast (served in a petite room on the 3rd floor) was continental style with a good choice of meats, cheeses, fruits, pastries, croissants etc., plus juice, tea or coffee (refills as well). There is a small 5th floor terrace where you can relax with a drink. It seems this area is still 'work in progress' and may be extended in the future. The hotel staff were always helpful. We are so pleased we chose the Cellini and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MoRo8256
Reviews.Content: The rooms are so clean and the hotel is so comfortable. The staff is so helpful and friendly...probably the best hotel staff I have ever encountered! The only slightly negative thing I have to say about this hotel is the pillows, they are not very comfortable. Highly recommended!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Reviews are Correct.”
Reviews.Author: jerrymsf
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in mid-May, Some in a double and some in a jr suite. The suite is larger and has a jetted tub. Both have bidets which are standard in Italy. The double has a fine shower and was quieter since it faced the interior courtyard. We agree with and don't need to repeat all the prior reviews. However, if you are seniors, Rome is not so walkable, particularly if it is hot. Many Rome hotels have no easy access to public transit. Residenza is a few minutes walk to bus and subway. Particularly if you are going cross town to the Vatican the subway is a 1 euro bargin and gets you there in 10 minutes. Also, the security is better than in many hotels, You have to be buzzed in or use your key. At night you also have to be buzzed in at the front outside door. It all adds up to a fine and,for Rome, reasonably priced place to stay. And, while it is cheaper to take the train from the airport and walk from the station to the hotel, after a long flight nothing beats bing picked up at the airport and driven to the front door in a Mercedes. Its more than worth it!

Reviews.Title: “All that it promised....”
Reviews.Author: OxfordCT
Reviews.Content: Planned our trip well in advance and kept checking the comments on the Cellini, it was indeed everything that was written and promised, beautiful, exceptionally clean, tastefully decorated. The Junior Suite was spacious. The staff was helpful and warm...stay there! You won't be disappointed. The Poulins

Reviews.Title: “Personal informal service.”
Reviews.Author: BobTheDentist
Reviews.Content: Residenza cellini is located on a small quiet side street, very close to Piaza Republica and its Metro station. The Hotel is on the 3rd and 5th floor of a 19th century building, in which there are other small hotels. It has a typical quaint, italian metal cage lift found in buildings of this age. The staff were welcoming, and nothing was too much trouble. Our room was one of the junior suites. It was very spacious, with a very comfortable bed and a most welcoming jacquzzi, essential for tired feet after a day of sight-seeing. Rome is a small city and everything is walkable, but the closeness of the metro station, and bus stop outside make it easy to get everywhere, including the Vatican, by public transport. There is a Warner Brothers Cinema on the Piazza Republica, which shows one or two films in english (without subtitles) 3 times a day. Most convenient if they are showing Angels and Demons, with the first church, Santa Maria della Vittoria just round the corner. We would definitely stay here again, and recommend it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, we were satisfied”
Reviews.Author: travelswithdiane
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on reviews here on Tripadvisor where it was rated as one of the best hotels in the city. It also won an award in 2009 from Tripadvisor for its service. We are not in agreement with them on the service issue. This 11-room hotel is located near Termini and is within 20-25 minutes walking distance of tourist attractions. Actually, Rome is much smaller and walkable than I anticipated. We reserved junior suites at 210 euros (cash payment) per room, per night, for three nights. They are actually regular rooms, not what I would call suites, but huge by European standards, maybe even by American standards. I certainly could not complain about the size or decor of the room. Both rooms (us on the fifth floor with the other ladies on the third floor) were in very quiet locations. Our Romeo and Juliet balcony overlooked an inner courtyard (not an attractive courtyard, but a quiet one). My travel companions on the third floor even had a live orchid plant in their room. The outdoor terrace is lovely and we sat out there one evening. My only (minor) complaints about the room are the coarse linens and the (whirlpool) bathtub was very slippery. The breakfast room is small as some on Tripadvisor mentioned, but we seemed to be the only ones in there each morning. They kept a bowl of fresh fruit in the breakfast room all day and I enjoyed that. Regarding the service issues, I emailed them several weeks in advance asking them to call the Galleria Borghese for me with a question. They responded back quickly to tell me they would call and get right back with me. I never heard from them. After waiting several days, I worked out my answer on my own. Also, my travel companion had an early morning flight and asked the woman at the front desk one evening to look on the internet for train information for the Leonardo Express. It was over an hour with no answer – the woman said she was still trying to locate the requested information. I came back to the room to learn this, and it took me less than 60 seconds to get the information on the (free) internet access they provide in the breakfast room. I expected better service than this. BTW, the computer is removed from the breakfast room during the breakfast service, so be sure to use it in the evening if you want information for the next morning. Overall, I would stay here again as the rooms were spacious and attractive and I liked the location and cost, but my expectations on service would be lower.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay on our Whole Trip!”
Reviews.Author: EuropeanTraveler09
Reviews.Content: Stop looking for a hotel in Rome and stay here. The location is excellent and you can walk to most cites within 20 minutes. The hotel is close to the train station, subway station, grocery stores, lots of restaurants and just about anything you need. The staff go above an beyond. They are friendly and more than willing to help you with anything. They greet you each morning in the lovely breakfast room, offering a wonderful capiachino. The rooms are very large and comfortable. Much bigger than most rooms that you will see in Europe. The television has Sky satallite which allows from much English viewing, which is a nice treat when falling asleep after a long day of walking. We highly recommend taking advantage of the roof top patio with a bottle of Italian sparkling wine. For the price in Rome, there is no better. We would stay here again in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and outstanding helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Roadrunner15
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth stay at Residenza Cellini, and we love it. The location is so convenient. Just take the Leonardo Express train (11 Euros one way) from Fumincino Airport to Termini train station in Rome. It is a short walk (maybe 6 or seven blocks, depending on how you count it.) Each member of the staff truly does everything they can to make your stay outstanding. Among a few things, they provide free internet, maps, information, restaurant reservations, ice and wine bucket and glasses, call a driver for the airport or a taxi for you, help you with the elevator and luggage, etc. The free daily European breakfast is lovely and generous. The 5th floor balcony for the guests to utilize is a wonderful place to have your Prosecco or wine while relaxing after a long day of sightseeing. The staff will provide a wine bucket, ice, napkins, etc. We have stayed in room #5 junior suite (spacious and nice). This last stay was in Room 503 and one other room. Room #503 is not large, but has a small private balcony with table and chairs, which is delightful and more than makes up for the size of the room. The room has a king bed (probably two twins combined), a desk with chair, two nightstands each with its own lamp, another floor lamp, a wardrobe (with a safe inside). The room had a great air conditioner, which we could control and definitely needed in May. The balcony in #503 is so much fun that it becomes a toss-up as to whether we prefer it room 503 or the more spacious junior suite. The #5 Junior suite bath had a large tub. The #503 bath has a small shower, large marble-type sink, toilet, bidet, towel warmer, hair dryer, toiletry amenities (shampoo, shower cap, soap, shoe sponge) All the hotel furnishings are traditional, lovely, and updated. The common area hallway makes you feel as if you are in a lovely home. The hotel is light and airy - not dark and not depressing. Ceilings are tall. Each member of the staff truly is warm, friendly, helpful and will go out of their to make your visit a great one. We love this small hotel and plan to go again soon for our 5th visit.

Reviews.Title: “This was one the the very best hotels we have stayed in. excellent”
Reviews.Author: duckOliver
Reviews.Content: The staff was so helpful and accomodating. The rooms were lovely and very clean. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Hopefully we will be able to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “good location and service”
Reviews.Author: goingeuro
Reviews.Content: Residenza Cellini did not get a 5 star from us because that ELEVATOR was constantly out of order and we live on the 5th floor. The poor receptionist ladies had to help us carry the luggage... The service was great and much appreciated and they have this wonderful map of Rome which we used a lot. Close to metro and bus stop and supermarket close by. Also, the breakfast was the worst amongst the 4 hotels we stayed at. I don't think they have a kitchen, so the breads were always stale and the coffee could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Owned Business”
Reviews.Author: mterra
Reviews.Content: We travelled with a teenager and 2 ten year olds so we needed 2 rooms. The Residenza Cellini suggested their apartment (owned by a family member). It was more economical than renting 2 rooms. The apartment was great! in a nice safe (and quiet neighborhood). It was nicely decorated and Barbara met us there when we arrived and spent almost 2 hours going over the map and the apartment. Halfway through the stay she brought us a bottle of wine and spent more time while the apartment was cleaned. Very friendly and welcoming family owned business!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at Residenza Cellini”
Reviews.Author: Twirler_9
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from 3 day trip to Rome and as usual booked the Cellini via the previous reviews in Trip Advisor and thought I would submit this review. Don't expect big or traditional entrance etc. Cellini occupies part of the 3rd and 5th floors of a 6 or 7 floor building and entrance (shared with other building occupants) is one lovely huge timber door but don't let it put you off. Not easy to find as Cellini sign not that big at door. My advice is to get to top of Via Modena ('T' junction with large building facing you) where the Target Restaurant is located on R. H. corner then walk back down street approx. 20 paces and look at side of large wooden door on left for Cellini sign/buzzer or if usin taxi then they should know where street is and 'possibly' Cellini. I booked transfer from Fiumincino airport via net with Italycab Marco at [--] and off www.transfer-airport-rome.com site. They cost 85 euros return (same cost apparently for other airport with most companies?) and were there waiting at airport and collected bang on time at hotel with some decent commentary on way. Transfer time was approx, 25 mins but depends on traffic and your driver. Ours had been driving in and around Rome for 28 years (so knew how not to get stuck in traffic!). We found the location ideal for touring the city as approx. 300m from metro/inderground station. Easy to use metro (and we only use underground probably once every 2-3 years) and basically only couple of lines that can get you close to most locations of interest. Our room was on 5th floor (reception, breakfast room and other rooms on 3rd floor but they are moving all to 5th floor apparently where have nice outside covered terrace for breakfasts etc) and we never heard any noise whatsoever. Cellini staff very attentive and obliging and nothing seemed to much trouble. Room spotless and nicely fitted out but a bit small compared to some other rooms stayed in but not one that I would complain about. En-suite spotless with quality fittings/furniture, hot water within seconds and powershower but again a bit on small side but did not bother us. Room and en-suite 4 star quality. Breakfast is typical continental with reasonable choice, but if you like a nice big fried/cooked breakfast or lots of choice of cereals etc. then you may find it dissapointing. Again staff very attentive and obliging. Mini bar in room only stocks soft drinks and some snacks so if you fancy a little tipple before going out then bring/buy your own wine/beer. We ate in 3 different restaurants all within 5 minutes walking from Cellini and very good. The best (and cheapest of 3) was the Restaurant Target which is literally 15 paces from Cellini door and on the corner of block. Good traditional food with variety. We only ate here on last evening as passed this every day and thought it a 'touristy' place to serve quick food at high cost but not the case. We booked the Vatican City, Roman Forum, Colisseum and Palatine Hill tours via 'Through Eternity' Tours (www.througheternity.com) via their website and found them well worth the money. They may be a bit more expensive than some others but we booked online before travelling and got 20% reduction off normal rates. Their passion about the subjects and the detail and way in their delivery is excellent. I am not an arty person by any means and the initial thought of a 5 hour tour of the Vatican museum and St. Peter's Basilica and Sistine Chapel and Raphael rooms didn't quite give me a throb beforehand as I was more interested in the historical Roman achitecture and culture etc. BUT I can honestly say the tour was very very interesting with the way it was presented with their researched theories and opinions had me looking at the paintings with a different attitude. They only have a maximum of 15 in a tour and our tours were 10 maximum so if you had a question everyone could here it and the answer (not easy if you are at the back of one of the 20- 30+ tour groups we constantly saw walking around).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place, great location, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: NellieCT
Reviews.Content: While the Residenza Cellini itself was unavailable when I made our reservation, I was offered their "apartment". Although I was skeptical, the hotel had enough good reviews that we decided to trust reviews and go with the apartment. What a fantastic find and value! When we got our of the car they arranged at the airport, we were automatically met by a member of the hotel staff. He showed us around the apartment, gave us tips on Rome, maps and directions and set up our WiFi. It honestly couldn't have been better. While the apartment lacks a living room, it has great bedrooms, bathrooms, a nice kitchen and dining room. The neighborhood is safe and very centrally located. We felt like we lived in Rome! We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: beverley_atkinson
Reviews.Content: At the end of our multi-city Italian tour what a haven to find in Residenza Cellini. Neatly tucked on the third floor just a stones throw from the Republicca Piazza and a short walk to the train station. We were travelling with our 17 year old who was happy with the free internet access. The rooms were clean and we were upgraded (WITHOUT CHARGE). The breakfast was plentiful and we had an early breakfast arranged because of a tour to Pompeii, again arranged by the management/staff of Residenza Cellini. Greetings with biscotti and Good Byes with wine. a Five star experience.

Reviews.Title: “cozy, comfortable and enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: ghannouj
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for several days. The hotel is cozy and very clean. For a business trip, it is superb. Internet is available, service is excellent and reception guys are very friendly , nice and helpful. With them, you never feel strange cause they both: george and remi (I guess) go beyond their limits to help. However, the hotel is somehow small and the administrative staff are rarely involved in their customer's service ...they prefer that all contacts should be via their reception employees. despite the fact, they make wise decisions. The stay was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Rome At Cellini”
Reviews.Author: SOPHIELONDON99
Reviews.Content: An oasis of pleasure in the middle of Rome. All the staff were unfailingly helpful and friendly and made us really feel at home. Good rooms and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: SBfamily
Reviews.Content: Me, my husband, and our two sons (10 & 13) stayed for 3 nights at the Residenza Cellini. It is located about 3 blocks from the train station, and about 1 block from the metro. Very convenient. The first night we stayed in two rooms (a jr. suite and a superior room), and the remaining two nights we stayed in the family quad room. The jr. suite was wonderful. The room, bed, and bathroom were large. We were on the 5th floor and overlooked a crummy courtyard, but it was sure quiet. My only complaint was the bed. It was hard, the sheets were low quality (not soft and scratchy), and the pillow flat and hard. The bathroom was lovely. My son took a nice, leisurely bath in the tub one night and was in heaven. The superior room was very small, but perfectly fine for 2 people. The family room was on the 3rd floor overlooking the street. It was large enough to accommodate all four of us comfortably. I wouldn't recommend the 3rd floor due to the noise from the breakfast room and front desk, but it wasn't too big of a deal. The staff were highly professional and attentive to our every need. The service was impeccable. The free breakfast was nice, although I was getting tired of the cookies, rich pastries, and salami. Although delicious, my stomach wasn't use to such rich food in the morning. The cappuccinos were delicious. They did have some fresh fruit, yogurt, and one type of cereal, which is what I ended up eating the last two days. The hotel is located in a busy part of town, but then again, Rome is busy all over. Overall, the hotel is very nice and the staff is wonderful. I would recommend staying here when in Rome. P.S. If you need to do laundry, there is a wonderful self-service laundrymat not far. Ask the front desk for directions. The laundrymat has an attendant who will do all the washing and drying for you (but you should tip him). We dropped off our laundry, had dinner at Pizzeria Est, Est, Est, then came back to clean, dry laundry. All we had to do is fold.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Rome !”
Reviews.Author: robinhood77
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights and it was really the best hotel in Rome I have ever stayed in. Our junior-suite was clean, large and quiet. The location is perfect. Owners and staff are great ! Friendly and helpfull. A perfect place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: DevoEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the beggining of March 2009 for two nights. The staff were very nice and helpfull nothing was too much trouble. The hotel is very clean and the rooms very comfortable. The location is good for the metro. I will be going back again and would recommend to any one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: IrishRugbyFans
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Residence Cellini for 4 nights and we would highly recommend it. The room was small, but very comfortable and quiet at night. Location was ideal, walking distance to several of the tourist attractions, bus stop round the corner and metro at the top of the road. Best of all were the staff - very friendly, attentive to every detail and very helpful in providing guidance and arranging restaurant bookings. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “The best service anywhere”
Reviews.Author: MarqFlyer
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in a junior suite at the Residenza Cellini. Our room was spacious but not huge by European standards, and immaculate. I was surprised to read that others didn't find them clean, as ours was as clean as any room we've ever stayed in. The only (minor) negative I could find is that the rooms facing the street had some late night noise (trash collection?) -- if you're a light sleeper, you might want to request a room facing the courtyard. We found the breakfast well above average, with a nod to the excellent capuccino and espresso. And of course, the location is excellent -- a block to the Repubblica subway station and just a few more to the huge Termini station, and a reasonable walk to many of Rome's other attractions, including the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. But the highlight here is the attentive service. Any time we showed even a hint of a need for anything -- be it extra towels, restaurant recommendations or whatnot -- they were only too eager to help. Moreover, the responses were always warm and genuine, and they never lost patience answering question after question (as this was our first trip to Rome). By the end of our all too short 4-night stay, we felt like were leaving our home away from home. As a bonus, they were nearing completion of the 5th floor terrace where they plan to start serving breakfasts. It wasn't ready for us to eat there yet, but we enjoyed a couple of relaxing evenings over a bottle of wine. We look forward to staying there again....

Reviews.Title: “Off Season Getaway!!”
Reviews.Author: turner262
Reviews.Content: I met my wife in Rome for a romantic getaway and we stayed at the Residenza Cellini. We made our reservations way in advance and they gave us the best deal possible. If you mention the Rick Steve's guide book and pay in cash, they will give you money off the origional price. My wife and I stayed there for seven nights and after two nights, they bumped us up to the suite with a jacuzzi tub! The staff is very profesional and will help you with resevations and advice on touring the area. The breakfast was nice and the cappuccino was perfect! The location is perfect because the main train station is just around the corner which makes it east to hop on the metro or city bus. There are plenty of good dining options close by. Two thumbs up for this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “adding my praise”
Reviews.Author: TravelerChevyChaseMD
Reviews.Content: My wife's medical conference in Rome had us in a five star "grand" hotel but when she left and I stayed on for a couple of days of tourism I wanted somewhere better located and not so pricey. Thanks to Trip Advisor comments on Residenza Cellini I booked myself there for two nights, got what struck me as an acceptable rate (they preferred cash or travelers checks for the reduced rate) and recently completed a delightful 48 hour stay in this little gem. (Expanding, though; they proudly toured me thru their new second floor which adds 5 rooms plus a spacious breakfast terrace.) Swell place. A block from the metro. Immaculate rooms. Helpful, friendly, competent staff. Adequate breakfast.. As others have said, it's slightly hard to find, not least because there's no outside sign since it's on the 3rd (soon to be 3rd + 5th) floor of a largish building. Yes you have to take a (small, European-style) elevator to reach it. Yes, you have to be buzzed in to the building when you return in the evening or weekend. But I couldn't have been more pleased with the overall experience--or grateful to early T.A. reviewers for steering me here. (My guidebook also raves about it.)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bit pricey!”
Reviews.Author: 1980traveller
Reviews.Content: I booked this property for my boyfriend's birthday after seeing it ranking highly on Tripadvisor as I had no idea where to start with the number of hotels / properties in Rome. The hotel is in a great location right by Repubblica Metro Service (Linea A) which links to Termini - which has links to the airport in just 35 mins, and Linea B. The metro service forms a big X. We did also notice that a Linea C was being built. Most of the major tourist attractions are within walking distance, such as the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and the Colloseum. Those that aren't you can easily reach by Metro or Bus. I would strongly recommend taking the 110 Bus tour so that you can see just how close you are to everything. From the hotel you will notice that access west of the river is not as easy and will involve buses as there are limited metro's to the west. This meant that we saw very little of the Giancolo Hill and Travestere region (which is where all the best shops/restaurants are supposed to be). That said we ate in some lovely restaurants (always try the backstreets for the best and much cheaper prices). The 'hotel' is in an apartment building on the 3rd floor with a very old lift. There are a number of hotels within the building so do not expect a grand entrance at 5 via modena for Residenza Cellini as all you will find is a buzzer for the property. This is not clear from the website at all and was a bit of a surprse. However that said the staff are incredibly helpful and I'm surprised by the reviews that said otherwise. The rooms are basic but clean, the bigger rooms have a jaccuzzi bath although we had a lot of limescale come out of ours - not nice! The beds are very firm and unfortunately there is a lot of noise during the night either from other floors or the street, not much that they can do about that. Breakfast is very basic and continental so don't expect a hot buffet and I agree with other reviews that the breakfast room is very small and the food on offer is in short supply. Nonetheless what we did have was very nice. I think the price we paid was a bit much for the hotel but that said it was in a fab location and we both had a lovely time.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: AnnaUK
Reviews.Content: I chose the Cellini based on all the wonderful reviews I had read on Tripadvisor. I was extremely disappointed and agree with everything said in the honest negative reviews of the hotel. This place is nothing special and needs to do a lot more to regain its #1 rating on Tripadvisor! I stayed in a Junior Suite with my family. The room is not a Suite it is a room with a king size bed and two single beds! It is a family room and nothing more! It was not filthy dirty but it could have been cleaner particularly in the bathroom. The hotel staff did no more than they should have done for us. The breakfast was poor and the cold meat and cheese looked as if it had been there for months. I would not stay there again. I really cannot understand all the positive reviews for this hotel on Tripadvisor, this hotel is far too expensive for what you get! I have travelled all over Italy and have stayed in Rome many times, try the Hotel Sant Anna in Borgo Pio, near the Vatican same price but 100% better!

Reviews.Title: “Residenza Cellini - a real find in the middle of Rome”
Reviews.Author: JoniLondon
Reviews.Content: An oasis of calm in the middle of Rome. A real find. All the staff were unfailingly helpful and friendly and made us really feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Italy”
Reviews.Author: KAGroglio
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Italy, this was a family trip to celebrate my wife's birthday as well as Christmas. We booked this hotel based on the reviews here on TA as well as the Rick Steve's book. We booked the "marvelous Junior Suite" as described by the hotel itself for our family of 4. While the size of the room was suffiecient, it was by no means a suite, but rather a single room with a king-sized bed, a twin bed and a twin-sized cot bed - all of which were extremely hard and uncomfortable. The room was clean as was the bathroom which was roomy enough and we did have clean towels replenished each day, though soap was provided only the first day of 5. The sheets were clean and decent. The only big problem was the NOISE. Our room was directly on via Modena which seems to be a very small street, but street noise was ongoing and started very, very early in the morning and it was extremely difficult to sleep. The breakfast which was provided was OK, but not great. There was just one choice of cereal with a pitcher of warm milk, hard rolls and just very few croissants each day (no matter how early we arrived), some warm cheese and meat (also minimal) and a daily plate of cookies which would have been more welcome as a late afternoon snack. Two small pitchers of juice were also provided along with room temperature yogurts. There was a bowl of fruit on 3 out of the 5 days we were there and hot beverages were offered on some mornings to us only. The breakfast room is VERY small and can only accomodate a few people. Some mornings we were welcomed and others we were just stared at - depending upon the staff member on duty. We were never told of the 5th floor terrace by any staff member and only read about it on review here upon our return home. We did receive a very nice bottle of sparkling wine upon arrival and did recieve some directions when asked, but the staff generally had no recomendations for restaurants close by which was surprising. They also did not know what was open on Christmas and the surrounding days. They did keep some of our luggage while we went to Florence for 2 nights which was a really big help and most appreciated. But on our last night we requested a wake-up call for the next day as we had an early flight home - we got no wake up call and woke up and hour late (there are no clocks in the room) with only 1/2 hour for four people to shower. That was most unhelpful. There is one laptop with free internet service which were were able to use which was great. The location of the hotel is close to the train station (termini) which is good if you are utilizing that, but otherwise all sites are quite a hike away. We walked all day & evening and felt quite safe and there were always people walking around outside which was nice - even on Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: skf805
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed in this hotel from Dec 30 to jan 4 2009. The service was really good. We didn't ask for much but when we did ask they did great. I even used the mini bar and they didn't charge me! The beds were set everyday and the room was cleaned very well everyday. They even left us chocolate in the room everyday after cleaning it (except for last day :-) but no big deal). I think the only downfall to the whole place is the price but you get what you pay for and we payed well and were treated well, on my next visit to Rome I would definitley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Residenza Cellini”
Reviews.Author: cfj3
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a junior suite at the Residenza Cellini at the end of November and found the positive reviews we had read on Trip Advisor to be true. The room was very comfortable for the three of us (Parents with a teen-aged daughter) and all of the staff members were very helpful with restaurants, directions, airport transportation, etc. For example, we left very early in the AM the day of our departure and had asked for coffee - the staff set out the full breakfast for us even though we left an hour before the usual beginning time for breakfast! We would definitely stay at the hotel again if we return to Rome. I was initially worried about the location but it was quiet at night and conveniently located. Close to public transportation and also easy walking distance to some major sites.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: Italianoincardiff
Reviews.Content: I do not believe all the positive reveiws on Tripadvisor for this hotel are genuine! We stayed at the hotel for two nights just before Christmas and we were extremely disappointed. We booked a Junior Suite for three adults and one child. The hotel calls a small cramped room with two single and one kingsize bed a suite! Believe me it is not! Expect a UK Holiday Inn Express or Travel Lodge type family room and then you won't be disappointed except by the over inflated price you've paid! The junior suite is a small family room with a jacuzzi bath. When you hear the words 'Junior Suite' you expect some luxury but you will not get that at the Cellini! The bathroom was a fair size but was not clean, there was mould around the bath and dust and hair on the floor. The shower over the bath soaked the floor because the shower screen was useless. We didn't try the jacuzzi because the jets looked clogged with scary looking human hair (not from heads but other unmentionable parts of the body!) Toiletries were sparce and not replaced once used. Towels were clean and ok. The breakfast room was tiny with only enough room for two people to sit at each table. The breakfast was poor in quality , the cold meats and cheese looked as if they'd been left out in the sun for a fortnight before being served. The staff were ok but nothing special. We love Rome and have stayed there many times but this was our first and last time at the Cellini! I cannot understand the rave reviews about this hotel hotel on Tripadvisor???? The Residenza Cellini is a poor quality bed and breakfast charging 4 star hotel prices. I honestly would not recommend this hotel. Avoid!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful home base in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MFol
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights at the Cellini in late November. The location is convenient to transportation (Republica and Termini). The room was nicely decorated and had plenty of space, especially by Roman standards. The bathroom was extremely clean. Breakfasts were good. The staff was very helpful and knowledgeable. They go above and beyond for their guests! We arrived in the late afternoon, when many restaurants are closed, and we had not had any lunch. It was pouring rain outside. The staff took care of everything for us -- bringing up some bread, cheese, and meats with a bottle of wine. It was such a treat and exactly what we needed after a long day of travel. We would recommend the hotel to anyone going to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ted_Ed
Reviews.Content: Great location, central to all attractions, very clean facilities. Staff were very helpful and friendly. If you come from a non European country, the hotel at first sight is not what is expected. However, the property is divided with other boutique hotels, on different floors of the building, and is a real surprise package, once the little lift to reception is negotiated. Rooms are a good size, as is the bathroom, and the atmosphere is very quiet which is surprising given the central location and the amount of nearby traffic. Only one very minor criticism: the pillows were too flat for our liking. Would recommend to travellers who are willing to walk to nearby attractions and who want to be right in the centre of Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: carcruiserVT
Reviews.Content: We were looking for the perfect Roman getaway prior to leaving for a 12 day cruise. Well, we got it. It was easy to find and the hotel staff was very helpful with transfer arrangements from the airport and to the port. Rooms were beautiful and clean. Breakfast was more than we could ask for. Well worth the research.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: sossoParis
Reviews.Content: This tiny hotel was a wonderful experience. The most amazing thing though about this place is the +++ service. Everyone was absolutely gracious and very helpful ( night and day). I have travelled quite a bit but have never seen such good service. Our room (503),on the 5th floor, was not huge but very very quiet with a little patio. The bedding was excellent but very firm. I would recommend rooms on the 5th floor ( as opposed to the 3rd) as the breakfast room and reception desk are on the 3rd. The breakfast buffet is not huge but has essentials. In short , I would highly recommend this place for its service, location ( central, close to subway, buses, 15mn walk to the Trevi fountain, 10mn walk to the Quirinal) and its charm ( beautiful marble floors, nicely decorated rooms

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Gem in the Heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: dtjammer68
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our stay in Rome based on the reviews posted on the website and a strong recommendation from a trusted guide book. Far and way, we were pleased with our four night stay at this hotel. The location was ideal since it was within walking distance of the Spanish Steps (and surrounding attractions) or a short metro/taxi ride to all the other major sites in Rome. The staff was very cordial and knowledgeable regarding restaurant recommendations and best way to get to the various points of interest within Rome. The staff recommended a restaurant nearby, Target Restaurant, that turned out to be one of the best meals we enjoyed. As a matter of fact, we returned for another meal two nights later and the waiter remembered us and brought us complimentary drinks. The room was clean and was made up in a timely manner every morning. Only minus was a somewhat uncomfortable bed and a shower stall that did not fit an adult over 200 lbs. The continental breakfast was very nice and your typical Italian-style breakfast of cereal, yogurt, breads, etc. We would certainly consider staying at this hotel on any return trips to Rome - we would just be sure to ask for a room that had a bathtub in addition to the shower stall.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice small hotel in central Rome”
Reviews.Author: annybenetou
Reviews.Content: The only reason I am not rating this hotel with 5 stars is the lack of a lobby to sit and relax. There is a terrace - most suitable for the summer-autumn period- but we didn,t feel that this was the same as having a nice closed,winter lobby. There is also the possility to stay in the small room where breakfast is served, but still I would love to have a real sofa to sit and relax. Apart from this drawback, the hotel is lovely, big, very clean and well decorated rooms,breakfast tasty and fresh- nothing missing-,very friendly staff with good recommendations and help to reserve museums and tours. Two nice restaurants that are nearby and I would recommend are the following: 1. Pizzaria Est,Est,Est Via Genova. Old touch in the environment (maybe the oldest in town), nice pizza and good prices 2.De Giovanni

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: guruyowie
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at this hotel for 5 days in late October 2008. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was quite nice and had plenty of room for a European hotel room but the actual shower enclosure was small. If you were a big person, say over 220 lbs, I think you would have trouble in it. The continental breakfast was very nice and the staff made you cappuccinos on the spot. The location was excellent. Right around the corner from Piazza Republica, which has its own metro station and also walking distance to Rome Termini station. So when we flew in we just took the Leonardo express train from the airport to the Termini station and walked to the hotel. Very cheap and convenient. On our way out we took a train to Venice from Termini, so again it was very close and easy. The hotel is a little tricky to find as it is not well marked on the street. It is actually on the 4th floor of the building with other businesses and hotels sharing the same building. There are plenty of restaurants and shops nearby and it is walking distance to most of the central Rome tourist sites. We would typically catch the metro somewhere in the morning and then walk back to the hotel in the evening. Overall it was a great experience and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: nwtraveler98005
Reviews.Content: We loved the Residenza Celini. Good Rome location just one block off Via Nationale. Friendly, helpful staff, good breakfast. The hotel was very quiet for Rome - we had an insde room that looked out over a typical Rome "courtyard" scene. The hotel is on the upper floors of the building and there is a lift. There is a little terrace on the 5th floor which was nice for a bottle of wine and snacks after a long day of touring!

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenglar
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Cellini for 3 nights in early October 2008. The service was excellent, room large (though the shower was very tiny) and loved the terrace. The staff was extremely helpful with restaurant recommendations, taxis, obtaining a car from the airport, etc. Great location. Would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ra
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Residenza Cellini prior to a cruise and we can not say enough about this small and intimate inn. We and our friends had three rooms on the third floor, two of which had jacuzzi tubs - perfect after a long day of sight seeing! The owners and staff were lovely and very helpful. They have a computer with complimentary internet and breakfast each morning complete with cappuccinos. The outdoor terrace on the fifth floor was the perfect place to relax with a glass of wine and visit with the other guests. And there were many good restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: photogal1022
Reviews.Content: This is a very lovely hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful! the room was average size. It was clean, quiet and very comfortable. breakfast was not large, but adequate. Everything was fresh and tasty! I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: jzo77
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great and very reasonably priced for what you get. Huge rooms, especially for a city hotel, and extremely clean. We were in room 5, with a Jacuzzi, high ceilings, king bed, satellite tv, wireless internet, etc. The breakfast was very typical…meats, cheeses, fruit, yogurt, and fresh coffee made just for you. The people that work there are extremely accommodating and friendly. We needed to make a call while we were there, and the phone in our room was not working. They let us use the front desk phone, and a new phone was in the room within an hour. One tip…do NOT drive in Rome. We had a car on our trip and we were dropping it off in Rome. We had to drop off our luggage at the hotel before we took the car in. Driving in the city was completely insane, and we’re from NYC! Finding parking in front of the hotel to unload was just as hard. We got it done, but would never do it again. The hotel location was fine, but there wasn’t much going on in the neighborhood. The place was fantastic and we definitely recommend it, but if we were to go back to Rome, we would probably want to stay in another neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, friendly stay”
Reviews.Author: movinabout
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the Cellini in early Sept. and enjoyed it very much. Thank you Trip Advisor reviewers for helping us find this gem. The Cellini is a small hotel located in a building it shares with a couple of other small hotels. The Cellini's rooms are on two of the floors in the building. Some have lamented about the small antiquated elevator but I found it kind of adds to the charm of the place. A few general statements about the hotel: The front desk staff could not have been more helpful, professional and friendly. Rooms not huge but more than adequate and very clean. Like all the hotels we stayed in in Italy, the beds seemed a little harder than we are used to in the states but comfortable enough. The hotel's location is very good located right near Piazza Nationale and a not too distant walk from the train station. It's located in a quiet neighborhood but not far from sites, shopping and good restaurants. We ate at the nearby restaurant Target and found it quite good. Reasonably priced by Rome standards, well located, clean and friendly, I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good as ever”
Reviews.Author: Lionmaine
Reviews.Content: Great to see the your name brandished by the cab driver (arranged by the cellini), to whisk you from the airport by his secret traffic-free way to the cellini, he was only caught out by the road works on the Nazionale, about 45 minutes. This was the 3rd time at the Cellini, as before immaculate public spaces, and the same junior suite with jacuzzi bath lovely and cool after the blistering heat outside. The rooms are always cleaned and ready whenever we returned from a hard days touristing, the maids are never intrusive, in fact we never saw them. Nothing is ever too much trouble for the staff, even though there are a couple of new faces at the desk. I didn't realise that the last two weeks of august is a little lull in the season, our favourite restaurant was closed the first night (last day of august), so we took the hotel's recommendation (well sort of, we asked for one very close as we were very foot weary) il cotti, just across the Nazionale, only open 12 months but always busy, very nice for al fresco modern dining. When you check out other hotels, you realise this is a bargain, ok it has no room service, pool, or bar, but, you can get a drink, very well served and very very reasonably priced. If ever the roof terrace is finished, and breakfast served up there as planned, with the chance of a late afternoon drink, or ealry evening cocktail, then this will be the perfect spot. We checked out white's whilst here, yes a lovely place, but at 1000 euros extra, i think i'll keep the grand, and spend it on more sightseeing whilst staying at the Cellini.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Bipps
Reviews.Content: We arrived early morning after having just done a weeks cruise. The hotel arranged for us to be picked up and our driver had no trouble finding the hotel despite what appeared to be a very complicated route. Despite our room not being quite ready (It was just after 9 in the morning!?) we were made to feel at home with lovely cappucinos! Our children (aged 10 and 12) were slightly tired and emotional on arrival having left the ship reluctantly, but soon perked up when they saw our lovely room. The opportunity for them to have a bed each, after sharing for a week, was fantastic and we loved the quietness of this hotel. The lovely jacuzzi bath was also a big plus. The breakfasts were just right and we loved how most of the guests would go to the dining room and just leave their rooms open as if you were amongst family or friends. If I had one criticism it would be that the dining room was tiny which, when you have an accident prone 10 year old can cause some fraying of the nerves!! Great location and lovely staff, would definitely go back but possibly without the kids!.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: hannah7241
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a romantic 3 night birthday break with my boyfriend for my birthday. The hotel was lovely. Our room was a new one on the 5th floor room 52. The air con was a god send after a hot day exploring. Rooms were spacious and extremly clean. The bathroom had a massage shower. The reception staff were extremly helpful and recommended a lovely resturant and provided a map with all the sights on and bus numbers to get there. The location is perfect. The metro is just around the corner. 2 stops to Spanish Steps and 5 to the Vatican. I would definatly stay here again. The open tour buses stop just around the corner. Breakfast was traditional itailian.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find”
Reviews.Author: retiredfun
Reviews.Content: There's a reason why this hotel is rated #1 in Rome. It's the service: staff make you feel that you are their #1 priority. For those arriving by train, location is excellent: no need to worry about cabs as the hotel is a short walk from the station. It is advisable to print a map from mapquest as the hotel is not immediately obvious. It is a fairly easy walk to most tourist sites and there are good restaurants in the vicinity. Breakfasts were good and the free internet is a nice touch. Excellent value for a hotel of this calibre in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Traveler093
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at an apartment managed by Residenza Cellini, and then on an overnight return to Rome, stayed at the Residenza Cellini. Both were fantastic. The hotel is very clean, very central and just perfect for a stay in central Rome. The apartment was terrific: very convenient, and allowed us to accommodate our large family in a residential area of Rome that was very quite yet very central. The operators were extremely helpful, and entirely professional and accommodating. I would highly recommend a stay at Residenza Cellini on any travel to Rome. Thank you Gaetano and others for making our trip to Rome very memorable.

Reviews.Title: “cozy and central”
Reviews.Author: leslie17
Reviews.Content: a little hard for cab to find but very central to metro-(super easy) and close to excellent shopping and old rome. Staff extremely helpful and very friendly. Nice to see the same faces Highly recommend Leslie(Thunder Bay, Canada)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: csuosu
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from July 2 - 5, 2008. Very nice accomodations. The room was clean and large. The bed was a bit hard, but this is common in Eurpope. The bathroom was nice and clean. This hotel has a lift that can be used for a suitcase or two. As with the other reviews, it is true that the lift is small, but it definitely was useful. The only negative about this hotel may be its location. We had been in Venice and Florence before Rome and had gotten used to being able to simply walk to all of the major sites. This hotel, while convenient to the train station, is not really walkable to most of the tourist sites. At least not in the hot summer. The price of this hotel, combined with the rooms themselves, cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel, spacious room”
Reviews.Author: robinpark
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great find. Very close to Termini train station and reasonably close to all the sights (about 10 to 15 mins walk). It is a bit out of the way, so therefore more quiet than traditional Rome hotels. It is a small hotel, and therefore has great friendly service. The rooms are larger than average. We had a quad room for a family of four, and it was clean and spacious. Would highly recommend this hotel, as a peaceful haven

Reviews.Title: “Romantic break”
Reviews.Author: Ninjatania
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Feb for a Valentines break, as all the reviews say this pace is a hidden gem and with amazing service, nothing is too much trouble. With its great rooms decorated beautifully. It is in a great position for travelling arround and also close to some great resturaunts or just a wander to the spanish steps. We ate in Target which was very good and also has the great benefit of being close. We also ate in The Doney which is in the western hotel, if you fancy something a little bit special this was superb service and an unbelievable menu. Thanks to everyone at the cellini for all there advice and help.

Reviews.Title: “nice touch”
Reviews.Author: johannamva
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cellini 5 nights in the beginning of June and returned for another 3 nights near the end of June. We were impressed with the level of gracious service and the general feel of calm in this small hotel. Our room a Junior Suite was spacious,well appointed and spotless. We enjoyed returning to our oasis after a full day of touring ,always warmly welcomed by the staff and a cool room. The breakfast room was cheerful and well stocked with fresh Italian food items and of course capuccino to order. We conversed with fellow travellers and exchanged travel stories during breakfast,before starting off on our daily walking. The location of the hotel is excellent near the Termini and Metro but very walkable to many of the sites. On our return to the Cellini at the end of the month we were "welcomed" back. The excellent service was truly a nice touch, ie: we had left our battery charger behind and Georges kindly sent it to our hotel in Florence. Also I had badly injured my back in Tuscany and was bed ridden for the last 3 days in Rome, the staff insured I had breakfast ,snacks and water delivered to my room so my husband was able to enjoy his stay in Rome. I would certainly return to this delightful hotel if we were to return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service”
Reviews.Author: Colorado17
Reviews.Content: The excellent reviews are well deserved. I did extensive research before booking and was not disappointed. When we arrived for our 8 day stay earlier in June, Donato who was manning the desk and checked us in easily spending half an hour giving us maps and tips for gelato places, restaurants and public transportation. He couldn't do enough for us. Without our inquiring, he also told us we would be eligible for a room rate discount because of the length of our stay. On another evening we spent at least an hour talking to him about living in Rome and Italy in general. The real pleasure of our trips to other countries is the opportunity to talk and connect to local people and discuss every day things. Donato was a delight to talk with. Our room was located furthest from the breakfast room and very quiet. The room was clean, the bed comfortable and reasonably sized for a European hotel. What really impressed us as veterans of more than 30 trips to Europe over the years was how well the wireless internet and air conditioning worked. During our stay the staff responded to every request and couldn't have worked harder to deliver nothing but the best service and experience. Staying in this hotel with such few rooms and very personalized service made us feel very cared for. As others have mentioned, the hotel is located on a quiet street close to the Termini. We also ate at Target and Guilio restaurants both within walking distance of the hotel. Target has good food, outside covered tables, very good service and serves dinner fairly early not to mention the advantage of being within steps of the hotel. Another restaurant we'd recommend most highly is Monte Caruso on Via Farini. Also close to the Rezidenza Cellini, this restaurant was wonderful in every way; food, service and atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: grandmahazel
Reviews.Content: Residenza Cellini The staff at this hotel were very helpful and always available. The breakfast was very good, lots of breads, meat, cheese, fruit and juice. There was a nice sun room that we used to eat our take-out pizza. My granddaughters had a room with a large tub and they liked taking bubble baths, but our shower was a little small. The only small problem was that you had to go up to the third floor to the receptionist and get your key and then get back on the elevator to go to your room. Then back to the third floor to leave your key before going down and out. The hotel is in walking distance to the train station and the National Museum. We did have some problem with the internet service, but it was free.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: jjjday
Reviews.Content: GREAT service, great room, great elevator/"lift", great location. Perfect start to our long vacation! They will help you with anything here! I wish we had people who worked so so hard in the states!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: sigridmarie
Reviews.Content: My son, who is on college, and I stayed at this residenza for five nights in June. It was our last stay at the end of a three week trip in Italy and Vienna. It was wonderful. Great location (not far from the train station, walk or take the metro to all the sights, took the taxi to the Borghese), quiet (on a small side street), great room (WIFI and TV with comfortable beds), nice bathroom (good size), wonderful staff (extremely helpful and friendly), good breakfast (cereal, yogurt, juice, sweets, crocoints, and cappuccino!), flowers in the hall and in your room, nicely decorated throughout (very clean and up to date). It is two floors in a large building, with a lift. Ring the bell on the street to get in. The inside door to the hotel is also aways locked, and staff is on duty 24 hours a day. The staff recommended some wonderful restaurants (we ate at Target downstairs three times, recommend the pear salad!), Del Giglio, a few blocks from the hotel by the opera house, and a great pizza place by Piaza Navona, Pizza Baffetto. Our room was outside the breakfast room, and one morning when some guests were being quite boysterous, the staff very quickly showed them into the breakfast room and closed the door so we could have some quiet. I loved this residenza and would definately stay again. A very good price for the location in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our Apartment”
Reviews.Author: Marcia47
Reviews.Content: When I contacted the hotel, they did not have availability at the hotel, but offered us a 3 bedroom apartment. I found one review on Rick Steves and one on TripAdvisor highly recommending the apartment, so I took a leap of faith (which was also the advice given to us from one of our tour guides in Rome when crossing the streets). I'm so glad we did. The location was the best. Just a block away from the Tiber river, away from the hustle and bustle, yet close enough to walk to the Spanish Steps or the Pantheon. The apartment was clean, a kitchen supplied with breakfast (milk, juice, cereal and coffee), a nice bathroom with a good shower, an elevator, and very quiet at night. Gaetano was a most gracious host. He helped us get a taxi to the train station on our departure and waited with us until the taxi arrived. The apartment made our stay in Rome very pleasurable and I would recommend this to all. The cost for 3 nights was 840 euros cash, but this seemed comparable to other quality hotels in the city (we were booking two rooms).

Reviews.Title: “Second time staying at this lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: davidgriffith123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came to this hotel three years ago and had a wonderful time; our return in June 2008 has been just as pleasant. The hotel is on the third and fifth floors of an old Italian building, so it can be a bit tricky to find, but once inside we found the staff and the the hotel itself exceeded our expectations. As it is a small hotel we got to know the staff very well; they know the surrounding area very well and provided fantastic information on travel and the best places to eat in Rome. I would give the hotel 4.6 out of 5, the only thing that let it down on this last visit was the water pressure in the bathroom was very low, but this was not a big deal. I love this hotel and if we come back to Rome I would definitely stay here again. Thank you to all the staff, in particular Francesca, Ireneo and Gaetano for making our second visit to Rome as fantastic as the first.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rae B.C.
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in mid-May. Loved it. Best part was our own little patio, sheltered by tiny, fragrant white blossoms and thck green foliage. I sat up late one night, just soaking it all in and writing in my travel journal. Our room was small, but since we are out exploring Rome all day; we don't need anything large. Bathroom was nice. Breakfast was very good, too. Free internet in the breakfast room was a bonus. Staff were very helpful, professional and courteous. All spoke English well. One fellow provided excellent restaurant recommendation for a special dinner just a short walk away. The hotel is discreetly situated on a short street that appears a bit "iffy". However, it is actually a decent location, within walking distance of the train station and easy access to many sights and the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Nokia99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Cellini for three nights in April 2008 and were very happy. A great central location near a happening part of Rome. Our room was large by european standards and had a patio. We also loved the large common patio area where all guests on the floor could relax after a hectic day sightseeing. Staff were most friendly and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful choice”
Reviews.Author: CA-to-DC
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Staff very friendly and helpful. Needed to call US. Suggested phone card, where to purchase, and helped with use. Computer available without charge. Wonderful breakfast with wide variety of choices. Nice outdoor, covered deck/patio for evening drink or take-out dinner if too tired to go to a restaurant. Great location, near train station. Good market several blocks south on Nazionale for fruits, vegetables, wine. Room has safe, refrigerator, wonderful shower. Room and bath comfortably large. Area feels very safe to walk at night. One tip: if paying with cash for the 5% discount, I had problems with several ATMs. They would not accept a request for OTHER amount, larger than 250euro. Had to make multiple withdrawals for 250euro to get desired amount. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service and spotless”
Reviews.Author: pattibo
Reviews.Content: I was a bit unsure about booking this hotel as I thought due to its size it might be too intimate and I like anonymity. However, after the initial maps & advice at reception which was detailed and helpful, we were on our own unless we required further information ,which was always readily available with an albrite smile. On writing down our passport numbers the lady on reception (Barbara, I think) noticed it was my husbands birthday the following day & organised a bottle of chianti for our room before dinner that evening which was a very personal & nice touch. The rooms & terrace were beautifully clean & well presented. The night porter was a gentleman with a permanant smile & genuine demeanour, ie. not saccherine.Breakfast staff ditto. The only reservation I had was having to drop the keys to reception as we came and went due to the fact we were on the 5th floor and the reception was on the 3rd floor, however, I would get over this in light of all the positive elements of this residence. It is more of a resdence than a hotel but in ways it's nicer than a hotel due to the level of care given (Not overly so, though), the friendliness and eagerness to assist through English. The location is also fabulous and once you get your bearings you can fly around the city from this point. Hard enough to find, so if you're travelling a long way, I think I'd organise a taxi just to make it easier.

Reviews.Title: “Best Personal Service”
Reviews.Author: skymasterztl
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the personal attention a service we received at this cute boutique hotel. The hotel is on the 3rd floor (really the 4th in the U.S. if you decide to use the stairs with luggage!). The gentleman at the desk when we arrived was very courteous and helpful with our luggage and gave us a warm welcome to Rome. We booked room 54 and it was very large with a huge vaulted ceiling. All the basic amenities were present including a jaccuzzi tub. There was a private terrace for the 4or 5 rooms on our floor with nice patio furniture to bring your own breakfast or luch and relax. Breakfast was the standard breads, meats, and cheeses with fresh cappuccino made to order. Location is hard to beat here with only a 5 minute walk to the A line(to the Vatican) and a 10 minute walk to the B line(to the Colloseo) and Roma Termini. One special note: The hotel staff must have noticed my wifes dying bouquet she was travelling with as long as she could, in our room (we had married a few days before) so they arranged to deliver a complimentary bottle of spumante with hors devours. Thats excellent customer service with the perfect personal touch in my book!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Rome”
Reviews.Author: december13
Reviews.Content: What wonderful service at this small hotel. The location is excellent with easy access to the train station, metro and attractions. The staff was available and very helpful. Their recommendations for attractions, restaurants and directions were on point making our visit a great one. The facilities were spotless and the breakfast much better than we have gotten in other European hotels. The only drawback for us was that the bed was very firm. We would highly recommend this hotel and would readily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: darrelldolan
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels around the world. I would rate this hotel ahead of any 5 star I have stayed in. The service is second to none. The morning we were leaving, they offered to make us breakfast eventhough we were leaving an hour before breafast was due to start. When we arrived, the guy at reception spent a half an hour pointing out restaurants bus stop etc for us. Breakfast was lovely too. What makes this hotel is the service (first class) and the location. Right beside the main train station and major bus stops and some fabulous restaurants and pubs. They had Sky digital on tv too which I liked. I will definitely stay there again when I go back

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!”
Reviews.Author: Sandabear
Reviews.Content: The Residenza Cellini was absolutely perfect. The rooms and bathrooms were beautiful and spotless. The hotel staff were extremely nice and helpful. I have very bad allergies and this is the first place I have stayed where I had no problems. Breakfasts were charming and of course so was the elevator. The location was wonderful--we walked everywhere except for the Vatican and even then the subway was just a block away. We asked the hotel to send a van to pick us up from the airport and that was a wild ride--my family loved it! Definitely stay there! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: UKRoger
