Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights at the Residenza Cellini and we were delighted with the location, cleanliness, friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. Nothing was too much trouble. Advice was given freely on places to visit, bus and metro, places to eat, etc. They really did made us fell very welcome indeed. We were told the area was safe to walk around at night and we never had any problems doing this. On the last night we were offered a lovely chilled bottle of bubbly for us to enjoy as a thank you for our visit. My wife and I like to visit different cities once or twice a year. It is our philosophy never to go back to the same city again, as there are always new ones to visit with new sights to see. However, if we did decide to go back to Rome we would have no hesitation at all in booking the Residenza Cellini again. Other recommendations for your stay: Get a taxi to the hotel when you arrive at the airport. The hotel is situated on a little back-street and even the taxi diver with sat-nav had difficulty finding it. If we had arrived by train to the local terminal and had to drag our suit cases looking for the hotel it would have been very hard work. However once you get your bearings, making your own way back to the airport is very easy. Footware: Make sure you have good footware as you will most likely walk alot. The pavements and roads are generally of the cobbled variety and can be very hard going on the feet. Vatican: By chance we happened on a good way to see all the attractions at the Vatican. We arrived early in the morning (8:30am) to see the Vatican museums. There was hardly a queue. After spending a few hours in the museums we headed to the square to see St Peter's Basillica and its Treasure museum. The queue was so long it stretched right aroung the square. Estimated queuing time was aroung 1:30 - 2:00 hours. So we decided to come back again the next morning, which we did, and again arrived early (9:00) and there was no queue at all! So, if you have the time to go on two separate half-days, that definately is the way to do it. P.S. the Treasure museum in St. Peter's was just amazing!! For a day out from Rome: Visit Tivolli! On a sunny day the gardens with their many waterfalls are just out of this world. Finally, may I ask all Trip-Advisors...if possible allow yourselves to be contacted. It is so helpful to be able to ask questions. I always do and I have had written conversations with some really nice people!

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel”
Reviews.Author: imdaman84
Reviews.Content: the residenza cellini was a cute hotel, it was brilliant. Old but very nice room, not so good view. the bathroom was clean as everyone expects it to be. the breakfast was delicious. great location. rate it 5/5 I would reccommend it to everybody going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ZonaNJ
Reviews.Content: Cellini was our last stop for 3 nights of our 9 day Italy trip. It is on one (maybe 2) floors of what looks like a regular building on a regular Via in Rome. The minute we went in we felt we had left the busy Roman streets behind us. The main hall was wide and had marble floors, relaxing chairs and live plants. Our room was large as was our bath. The Jacuzzi tub was great after walking around Rome all day! The street outside was quiet. Cellini is in an excellent location for walking and using the subway. The staff was really helpful and had very good suggestions for what to do and where to eat. The breakfast was not as ample as some of the other places but I think by then I was tired of cheese and salami.

Reviews.Title: “What a fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: oscarboscar
Reviews.Content: We had read the reviews on Trip Advisor before booking at Residenza Cellini and we certainly were not disappointed! It is such a lovely, calm oasis of a hotel with the most helpful and cheerful staff. Our room was beautiful, peaceful and had everything we needed. I have stayed in 5* hotels where the service isn't as good as it is here. Thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mhellberg
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed at the hotel for 8 days, best cost benefit ever. The staff is very kind and helpful, one day they forgot to send out my cleaning, when I complained they had it done in less than two hours. Next time in Rome we will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Rome”
Reviews.Author: carolson
Reviews.Content: My stay at Cellini was top notch. Hotel and room was none other than magnificent, service was excellent, concierge was extremely helpful. We were lucky enough to book a room at a discount due to the season. We were treated like royalty and the staff was not only professional and courteous but sincerely friendly as well. Location is also very convenient. If only EVERY hotel were like this one!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at Residenza Cellini”
Reviews.Author: traveladdict98
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights at the Residenza Cellini during our honeymoon, and we absolutely loved this small, intimate hotel. It was in a perfect location (not far from the train station and close to public transportation, which we took everywhere!) and the service was impeccable. The breakfasts were great. The hotel is sparkling clean and I still recall how nice it smelled, not just clean but lightly scented by the lovely flower arrangements in the hall. The room itself was perfect for the two of us: a comfortable king-sized bed, a spacious bathroom, plenty of room for our suitcases. We would certainly stay again and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Making Rome Memorable”
Reviews.Author: ronifer
Reviews.Content: What makes the Residenza Cellini so unique is their geniune interest in making your stay world class. One quick, example. My wife and I had a 7am flight leaving Rome. The staff arranged for the pickup and had breakfast ready for us when we left at 4am. Also, the night before we left they had a bottle of Spumanti chilled for us with some sweet treats. Some of the great perks that make Residenza a notch above the rest. - Proximity to Metro and Termini - Proximity to most top sites in Rome (Trevi, Colloseo, Forum, Pantheon, Spanish Steps, Borghese, etc...) - Attention to detail - Great "local" reccommendations for restaurants, tours, groceries, etc... - Flexibility in working with your needs. - A nice jacuzzi in room. A rarity in a moderately priced hotel in Europe. The only reccommendation would be to get a newer computer for internet access. But overall a truly memorable experience that made a honeymoon unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Sydney027
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the Residenza Cellini from Mar 5-12, 2008. We stayed in a superior double room which was big enough for 2 adults. It had a king size bed, a desk, a small table, and 2 desk chairs. There was also an armoire that had an easy to use safe where we stored our passports. The bathroom was small compared to North American standards and we did not have a tub. However, the shower was very nice with good pressure and lots of hot water. My husband found the shower to be a bit cramped but he is 6'7"tall so that wasn't a big surprise and I had no trouble with the size at all. We did peek into a suite and found it to be quite large with a gorgeous whirlpool tub and a shower set up in the tub. We would probably stay in a suite next time - its worth the extra cost, if you want extra space and a bath!! We found the area around the hotel to be safe and quiet - it is just behind the Via Nationale so the location was great - easy to access transportation and the sites we wanted to see, but not noisy as it was just off this main road. We could walk the length of Via Nationale in about 10 - 15 minutes and could reach the Pantheon in about 15 minutes. We bought a metro pass and found the buses and subway easy to get to and efficient. We were able to get to the Colosseum in about 5 minutes on the subway. There was a grocery store on the Via Nationale, about a five minute walk away from the hotel, and we stocked up there on affordable snacks, pop, and sandwich supplies. We were able to take things out of our minibar fridge and store our purchases in there, which was great. Our email correspondence to Francesca was always answered promptly and she was always friendly and efficient. We did use the service of the driver that the hotel arranged to get us to and from the airport and that was very helpful especially when we were jetlagged. As has been mentioned already, the staff of this hotel are amazing. They were always friendly, helpful, and available and all went above and beyond the call of duty. For example, on one day our tour started at 7 am. Breakfast runs from 7 - 10 am so the staff arranged for breakfast to be set up early so that we would be able to still have breakfast at the hotel prior to our tour departure. Also, we had a rainy day trip to Pompeii. When we returned to our room the staff had given us a bottle of red wine and chocolates as they knew we'd be wet and tired - what a great surprise!! All in all, we thought this hotel was wonderful and we would highly recommend it. If we ever have the opportunity to return to Rome, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonPisces
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at this wonderful hotel. Our room was beautiful as was the bathroom with the jacuzzi. Francesca could not have done enough for us, recommended and booked wonderful restaurants during our stay. The hotel is in a fantastic location, just off Via Nationale and very close to all public transport links. Will definitely return to this hotel on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Small & wonderful”
Reviews.Author: debsimmonds
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residenza Cellini over Christmas last year. The family-room accommodation was very spacious with a king and two regular size twin beds perfect for mom and two college-age children, very spacious. The Residenza excels at making guests feel at home in this 6 room gem. The staff is very friendly and addresses guests by name. The location is perfectly located just off Via Nationale. It’s close to the metro (underground), buses to the Vatican, plenty of taxis and just a few blocks from the train station. Even with the proximity to all the transportation, the hotel is located on a quite street making for a good night’s sleep. Breakfast was beautifully presented each morning. On Christmas Eve they put out a wonderful evening snack of chocolates, cakes and champagne. On Christmas morning they greeted us with a delicious breakfast. It's the kind of hotel where you get to know the other guests and share travel tips. Nothing in Rome is cheap, this hotel is no exception. But, the safe, intimate accommodations make for a fulfilling visit to the Eternal City.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable, well located”
Reviews.Author: Statt0
Reviews.Content: This is a well located property for sightseeing in Rome. Most of the major sights are within walking distance (if you like a good walk), and several are very close indeed. Access to public transport is excellent, with a bus stop in Via Nazionale only 100m away, a Metro stop 200m away, and Termini rail station perhaps 500m (half hourly train service to/from airport). The outstanding reason for recommending Residenza Cellini so highly is the very friendly staff, who went out of their way to help with sightseeing tips, including how to get to each spot (eg which number bus to get and how many stops), and excellent restaurant recommendations. All spoke adequate, and some quite excellent, English. In terms of facilities, the property consists of a front desk, breakfast room and bedrooms only. That is all I wanted, and all I wanted to pay for, but if you are after in-house 'hotel' facilities, this is not for you. Breakfast buffet was varied and unlimited in amount. Quality was good, and proper coffee was available to order (my espresso doppios were consistently very good). The room (I had number 53). By European standards, very adequate in size. Bathroom small but very well equipped. Efficient and quiet air conditioning with in room control. Functioning in room safe. Nearby reliable restaurant (I had 3 meals there)- Il Giglio, in Via Torino, just the other side of Via Nazionale. Hint: when looking for it for the first time, the property is not conspicuous. It is the first building on the left as you turn into Via Modena out of Via Torino, one block off Via Nazionale. There is a plaque on the left side of the doorway, just above a more prominent one for the Hotel Adler (which is on the 2nd floor). The front desk is on the 3rd floor (European numbering, 4th American).

Reviews.Title: “The Real Deal”
Reviews.Author: aliwag
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Cellini for 4 nights in December 2007. There were 2 adults and 2 children (ages 9 and 13). We had room number 3, a family suite. It had a really comfortable large double bed and two standard singles. The room was very well decorated and had every comfort required. There were even orchids in our room. The bathroom was very modern and well designed. The spa bath was a real treat for tired and aching bodies after our days of sightseeing. The breakfast room, although small, was adequate and the food was fresh and plentiful. Just enough to see us thru the day. This small hotel is an oasis amid the hustle and bustle of Rome. It is an adventure trying to fit everyone in the lift and the children enjoyed the novelty of such an “old fashioned” contraption. What made this hotel special was the attentiveness and friendliness of the staff. Nothing was too much trouble for the desk staff. They offered plenty of advice for restaurants, transport etc. There was a laptop available to guests which was useful (until it developed a technical fault and went in for repairs!). The hotel’s location was ideal. It was close to the main station where the Terravision bus dropped us from Ciampino airport, so it was only a short walk with suitcases to the hotel. The hotel is very close to the main bus routes, underground and most of the sights are within an easy walking distance. We loved one of the recommended restaurants, Da Giovanni (sp) on Via Salandra. We went there twice! It was reasonably priced and very non-touristy. My family and I recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome, and know now why it has such a high rating on this website.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice”
Reviews.Author: BuckBrisbaneAus
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Residenza Cellini was wonderful. I agree wholeheartedly with all that has been written. All the staff were friendly, approachable and went out of their way to help you whenever they could. We were given a Junior suite (no 3) and there was plent of room for our family of 4 . After a big day of sightseeing the staff were happy to provide a pot of tea for us. Any request was handled cheerfully and quickly. We did not see the terrace that is mentioned in some reviews and photos. It was never mentioned. I'm not sure why? Maybe it is not available during winter??? !0 out of 10 !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Elegant”
Reviews.Author: Nonna-Papa
Reviews.Content: We had read so many wonderful comments about the Residenza Cellini, that on a return trip to Rome, prior to our Mediterranean cruise, we chose to stay two nights at this lovely hotel. There is a charm and elegance to the hotel, in not only the furnishings and decor, but in the manner that the staff exemplifies. Because this is family owned and run, the guests are made to feel that they have been gracioulsy welcomed into a private home. There is no impersonal, lack of customer service provided here as can be found in so many other hotel choices. Instead, our needs were warmly met by each staff member we encountered, and our expectations were fully realized. Thank you, Barbara, Donato, Francesca and Peter for all that you did to make our stay a memorable one. The Baileys

Reviews.Title: “Tripadvisor gem”
Reviews.Author: John&Jennifer
Reviews.Content: This is what Tripadvisor is all about, finding places like this. Tucked away down a side street, but with all you could possibly want, shops, restaurants and bars a few minutes walk away. The hotel is impeccably clean and the staff are superb, all enquiries before and during our trip where met with friendly efficiency, as if you where a close friend. We walked to all the main sites during our 3 day stay and where always completely shattered at the end of each day, but you do get to see so much more. If you are not to keen on the walking, the open top tour bus is the next best option, jumping on and off at the sites you wish to see. Travelling in November means no excess of tourists, but would recommend booking the Vatican tour well in advance what ever time you visit. Make sure you have the street map in your pocket at all times and go explore, what a place! A few extra notes on the hotel, if you are going to walk a lot, you will need to book a suite to have a bath for a soak at the end of the day, as the deluxe rooms only have showers, room service exellent value, ask regarding wine, as it is not on the list of items, they do have a good selection, hotel booked limo transfer (60 euros each way with tip) from and to airport, exellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Neighborhood Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oceanlover22
Reviews.Content: After our Mediterranean cruise in September, we decided we needed to spend extra time in Rome. After viewing Trip Advisor as well as Rick Steves' travel guides, we were convinced this was the place to stay. Francesca and her staff are so warm and welcoming and go above and beyond to help with restaurant reservations and suggestions, transfers to and from the airport, directions, etc. etc. They even made us a cappuccino at 4:30 am so that we could catch our incredibly early flight out. The hotel is centrally located and feels very safe (up on the 6th floor of a beautiful old building); even has a rooftop patio where we enjoyed a glass of wine as well as meeting fellow travelers. You can't go wrong with this hotel and when we return to Rome (after all, we threw a coin in the Trevi Fountain), we will definitely stay at the Residenza Cellini!

Reviews.Title: “Glorious, classic, central boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelLady50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this fabulous hotel for four nights in mid-September. Within walking distance of main train terminal and subway and bus depot and many sights, including the amazing Basilica of Saint Mary of the Angels and Martyrs with the Meridian Line and Clementine sundial. Spotlessly clean, heavenly, comfortable beds, fabulous, relaxing hydro-jet tub, gracious hosts, wonderful continental breakfast. Double doors in the room which opened onto a Juliette balcony. Outdoor garden terrace on fifth floor, where our room was located--was an ideal spot for relaxing during the mid-day heat and enjoying a glass of wine. Quaint, antique elevator--like something out of an old movie-tiny, but worked perfectly. We were referred by friends, and have since recommended it to everyone we know who may visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Charm & Comfort”
Reviews.Author: PDXpopcorn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our three nights in room 3 of this lovely small hotel. The staff could not have been more helpful, pleasant and interested in our comfort. The location is convenient to Piazza Repubblica, the metro, bus stops, numerous small cafes and restaurants. My only suggestion for improvement to the hotel is that they include skin lotion in the toiletries tht are provided in the bathroom. Since airline restrictions prohibit lotions in any quantity larger than a few ounces, this was something I missed having. Oh, the towel warmers are a luxurious and appreciated touch! The satff arranged for a limo to take us to the airport our last morning there which was on-time, nice service in a newer Mercedes with a highly professional, well-spoken driver who used the extra time we had since we were all early to give us a last minute, sunrise tour of some wonderful sights in Rome. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Couple of details”
Reviews.Author: ChefGeorge
Reviews.Content: We basically were very happy with the Residenza. As everyone else has said, the graciousness of the staff, the immaculate condition of everything, and the absolute quiet are very important features. We were happy with its location, steps from the Metro, several important churches, Termini, etc. I'm happy to read of their plans to move reception up to their new 5th floor. Our room was on 5th, and having to go up & down for breakfast, to retrieve & drop off the room keys each time we left, etc was a bit tedious. So if you think that may be an isue for you, try to get your room on the same floor as reception, wherever it happens to be. The hotel has absolutely no view, if that's important to you. The 5th floor terrace is very nice, but there's nothing to be seen from it nor, as best I can tell, any of the room windows. We very much appreciated the free wireless access, but it only worked intermittently up in our room. We often had to lug the laptop down to the 3rd floor to get more reliable connection. These are minor whines, and for the price, there's probably not a better place to stay in Rome. As for getting there, we were very pleased with Rome Shuttle limousine. For 35 E, a handsome young man in a suit met us at baggage claim, carried our bags to his Mercedes, and drove very civilly to the Residenza door, pointing out a few landmarks and the presidential convoy that we passed enroute.

Reviews.Title: “Residenza Cellini Apartment”
Reviews.Author: TDSantaRosa
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent option for a family or group who wants a kitchen and some extra space! The apartment has three bedrooms, one and a half bathrooms, dining room and a well stocked kitchen. The location was wonderful, just a ten minute walk to the Spanish Steps or the Piazza Navona. This is a quiet non-touristy neighborhood with a nice coffee place right outside the door and a grocery store around the corner. We found the prices for everything from a cappuccino to a bottle of water to be significantly cheaper in this neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless Elegance w/Superior Service”
Reviews.Author: DC79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I picked this hotel because of its rating and the reviews on TripAdvisor and we were not disappointed. The staff is wonderful. We arrived with two huge suitcases after an overnight flight and the woman at the desk helped us arrange our baggage in the charming (but tiny) antique elevator and showed us to our room. We were also given maps and directions to the main sites. The breakfasts were wonderful and the staff again, was very accommodating. It was no problem to have the hotel call a taxi and the staff even made restaurant reservations for us before we arrived. The rooms were spotless with high ceilings and modern bathrooms. The beds are firm (but what you would expect in Europe) and the fifth flour terrace was wonderful for an afternoon break. The one downside to this hotel is that it is a walk to any of the sites. We are in our late 20s and very active and our legs definitely hurt by the end of the day. The metro is convenient though and cabs are plentiful. Another word of caution… we went in mid-October which is not the main tourist season, but as the Vatican Museum has shortened its hours quite a bit, the line was over four hours long and the crowds were like nothing I had ever seen. Of course the museum was worth it, but expect a wait as the Museum is only open from 10am – 3:30pm. But, if you are going to Rome, this is the place to stay -- great value for the money, wonderful service, and beautiful, spotless accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little place, Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: hgw1996
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Residenza Cellini October 20-25, 2007. Wonderful hotel with spacious and clean rooms! The staff was the best and very accommodating.. We had to leave before breakfast a couple of mornings and they put some things out early for us! The hotel is within walking distance to the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps & the Colosseum/Forum. Great restaurants nearby too. Again, we were more than pleased staying here. Would strongly recommend this hotel and certainly stay again for our next visit to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that lives up to its reviews!”
Reviews.Author: lisa22Boston
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel paying close attention to all the reviews I could find and all I read was true. We stayed 3 nights and were treated with kindness and much guidance, just what we needed having never been to Rome before. It is as clean as you can get and beautifully decorated. Our room, #5 was very spacious with a small balcony with atrium doors that opened to a large courtyard below. The jacuzzi tub was perfect for having walked hours every day. We used the internet several times to keep in contact at home. The breakfast, although continental, had more than enough to offer. The staff were truely the kindest people and sweet. Although the caged lift is somewhat small, it is full of character and works fine. We went up to the terrace and met visitors from Australia and enjoyed some wine. The train, ATM, and many good eating places are just around the block. Every time we went out, Francesca or Barbara mapped the way making it so much easier. Will stay again someday....

Reviews.Title: “What a find! Thanks TA”
Reviews.Author: starward
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Resadenza Cellini Oct 6-10th. What a great find, it really does deserve all the raves. The rooms were immaculate and large by european standards. The staff was so helpful and always ready to answer any questions. The terrace on the 5th floor was a great place to relax with a glass of wine in the evening. We would never stay anywhere else while in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like a Palace”
Reviews.Author: viajeelmundo
Reviews.Content: As you walk down the hallway of this hotel, you feel like you are in a mini palace. All the rooms have double-doors and the hallway floor is marble. We stayed in Rm #5 - double-bed with a nice size bathroom. The room was very clean and the staff was friendly. Breakfast was the standard continental spread. The hotel is located on the 3rd floor of a building that houses other hotels as well. On the 3rd floor alone there are 2 other hotels. There is an elevator/lift from the entrance floor. The area is very quiet and safe at night for walking. The hotel is 2 blocks away from the Metro, bus stop and taxi stand. There is also an ATM (bancomat) a block away. The nearby restaurants that Rick Steves recommends are all good. My one complaint is that I felt the hotel was far from all the sights. You could walk to certain sights but it would take at least a realistic 20 minutes, and that would be the closest sight. You are better off taking the Metro which was very easy and cheap. Look into the RomaPass. If you don't mind taking public transportation instead of walking, then this place is for you. As much as I like the hotel I prefer something closer to the action. Other than that, this place is great.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: ajhaeh
Reviews.Content: I booked the Cellini online after reading the reviews on TA. The communication from the outset was excellent and I booked the airport limo service which I did not regret. The air conditioned Mercedes dropped us at the entrance to the Cellini which is on a narrow street, Via Modena, which runs parallel to the larger and much busier Via Nazionale. The Hotel is a five minute walk away from the Plaza de Republica and the train, bus stations at the Termini. The open top tour buses commence here and the ‘110 Open’ leaves the square every ten minutes. A great ‘hop on / off’ way to see the city. Like every other city, the areas around the bus & railway stations attract the undesirables. The reception to the hotel is on the 3rd floor of the building and access to it is via the ‘old style’ cage lift or the stairs. The lift is rather restrictive and two people with suitcases are about the maximum. The check in was hassle free and the staff most helpful. Our room was on the 5th floor, so it was back to the lift. Our bags were taken care of and we were shown to the room and given the ‘guided tour’. The breakfast room was very small and found behind reception and the terrace was directly opposite our 5th floor room. The marble flooring added to the ambience. The room was not the biggest but spacious enough for our 5 night stay. It was immaculately clean, modern and had air con, mini bar fridge & room safe. The bathroom was modern with a ‘massaging’ shower that was a tight fit to squeeze into. There was a range of toiletries and also a hair dryer. The soft towels were replaced every day. The view from the room was of an interior courtyard below and was very quiet at night. On saying that, the noise from the air con was far too loud. The roof terrace was easily accessible but building work was taking place as the plans are to re locate the reception to the 5th floor and serve breakfast on the terrace. Breakfast was served in the small room at reception and there was ample choice of cereals, fruit, breads, hams, cheeses, yoghurts, fruit juices, tea & coffee. The hotel staff were extremely helpful with booking restaurants, directions and the loan of maps & guide books. Nothing is too much for them. The Target restaurant on the corner of Via Modena is worthy of a visit. It was explained that 'August' is the month that tourists visit Rome and most of the restaurants close as a result. The Cellini is about a 20 minute walk from Vittoria Emanuel and the roads to the Forum & Coliseum. The route is directly down Via Nazionale. Would I stay at the Cellini if I visited Rome again.. yes I would. Would I recommend it to friends & family… most definitely

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: mdarch
Reviews.Content: I fear never being able to reserve a room at Residenza Cellini again due to its small size and immense popularity with Trip Advisor users, but I feel it is fair that I give RC its due. This is a wonderful little gem of a hotel as many others have stated. Barbara, Gaetano and the rest of the staff are quite simply amazing. They speak perfectly fluent English, they are glad to help with restaurant recommendations/reservations, wayfinding in the city, public transportation info., etc. My husband and I stayed here for four nights of our honeymoon and were absolutely thrilled with this place. Our room was spacious with high ceilings and a wonderfully clean bathroom. The bed was comfortable and the sheets were nice. Breakfast was a nice mix of fruit, yogurt, pastries, juice, coffee, etc., and was a great start to the day. Also, Barbara provided a bottle of chilled champagne for us upon our arrival as a welcome gift since we were on our honeymoon. As others have mentioned the sign for the hotel is very small so if you arrive via train and walk there (as opposed to taking a taxi), look carefully for it or you will walk right by it. Lastly, the bus stop is closeby for public transport, which we used to get the Vatican, the Forum and other not so close locations. I highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: moe in SC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week for 2 nights because of the reviews on Trip Adviser. The reviews are not wrong. The Residenza Celling is a gem in Rome. The front desk people, Barbara, Donado, etc., are wonderful and helpful. Room was large by Europe standards , clean, and comfortable. Breakfast was great. We had to leave at 5:30AM to catch a flight. At 5:15A, there was a little knock on our door and we were handed a tray with 2 cappuccinos. You just don't get treated like this in many hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ingatestonian
Reviews.Content: Like many others, I booked based on Tripadvisor. The hotel is an ideal location for a city break being a calm place to go back to after a day of visiting sights. The rooms are excellent, very clean with high ceilings and well fitted bathrooms. The service is friendly and personal. Location wise, everything is walkable, although the Vatican would be stretching it. The hotel would especially suit people arriving by train as it is only about 5 minutes from Termini. Some reviews have said that the area around the hotel was not the best but we always felt very safe and would happily return.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Marvelous!!!”
Reviews.Author: Their_Grandmommy
Reviews.Content: There is not enough space to mention all the wonderful attributes of this hotel! After I had emailed over 40 hotels in Rome, I decided that we would stay at the Residenza Cellini based on value and proximity to the train station. We were astounded! The level of service exceeded most 5 star hotels in which we've stayed!!! Our room was far, far above the standard as well with many of the amenities you would find deluxe hotels! They have opened up another floor of rooms within the last few months and the details are first class...all of them! Additionally, the small hotel being two blocks from the metro made getting anywhere in Rome quite simple. AND...You'll love the breakfasts...it would be difficult to improve upon their "Continental" offerings! Look carefully at your map before trying to find this little treasure because it occupies just part of a building and there is only a sign at the door . Be sure to ask at the desk for restaurant suggestions...I failed to do that the first night and the result was terrible food and having my cell phone stolen by a gypsy - right before my eyes! I am certain that, if you choose Residenza Cellini, you'll be very glad that you did! Our four nights were hardly enough!

Reviews.Title: “Believe the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: travelnfools
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this little hotel. At the end of July we stayed for 3 nights and than returned for 2 nights on a trip back to the US. The rooms are very clean and just as they appear on their website. Both rooms we stayed in had air conditioning. Oh, loved, loved, loved the elevator. Very, very small but made of beautiful Maghogany surrounded by a old iron gate probably from the 20's. Do not pay attention to the scale of the maps they give you, they are not to scale!! Everything is MUCH closer than it appears. The location is great. Walk to the right than left on the main street you will see the grand fountain, just beyond that is Termini Station (HINT: walk to Termini station and ride the on and off bus, they will take you everywhere, OR instead of left make a right and go a few blocks, than make a left you will see the Colloseum! Each morning at 7:30 set in a beatuiful, but small room, a breakfeat area set up. They could not be more accomodating. The morning of our departure, we had to leave the hotel at 7:30,so they set the entire room up at 6:30 just of us so that we could have something to eat before we leave. We would stay again!! Thanks for the wonderful experience. Deborah and Barry

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: Pattok
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after reading many reviews and we were extremely pleased with this hotel ! The rooms are lovely and clean and feel homely. The hotel itself is very quaint, with a little rooftop terrace. The staff are soo helpful and want you to be happy. Breakfast is fruit, yoghurts, croissants, cheese, hams and cereal. Its plenty. We walked everywhere within 20 minutes, except the Vatican as we got the hotel to book us a tour - Definitely book a tour with Carrani. It starts at 7 am but well worth not queuing for 3-4 hours to get in ! Rome is amazing and I would stay at this hotel again . Its not 5 star as you would imagine, but 5 star in service, surroundings and something different.

Reviews.Title: “Best accommodation, location and value”
Reviews.Author: LadyMarion1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a friend who is a travel agent and I also read the reviews on TripAdvisor. We had an excellent experience. We arrived by taxi since we weren't sure exactly where it was, but once we got there and got oriented, we found it extremely easy to find. You could walk to many attractions, or go about one block to the Metro or all kinds of buses to all major attractions. The people on the desk were all helpful, but the one there when we arrived was particularly helpful. He spoke excellent English and took about a half hour to map out all of the attractions for us, including giving us bus numbers to get there, plus recommendations for other sights and restaurants. We went to a restaurant on Isolo Tibernia that was excellent, with a view of the remains of a 4th century B.C. bridge. We also ate at Terazza Barberieni, which is about a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel and we also enjoyed that one. They have a casual pizzeria downstairs, or a nicer rooftop restaurant where you can eat inside or out. Our room was lovely with a kingsize bed and a well-appointed bathroom with a fancy shower and a bidet. Reception was on the 3rd floor, as was the breakfast room, but we stayed on the 5th. The breakfast was just so-so, but since it was included, who cares? They gave us a better rate if we paid by cash or travellers cheques versus credit card, which they let us know ahead of time. We're in our 50's as an F.Y.I.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: MHB01
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 that stayed in 2 rooms at the Residenza Cellini at the beginning of August 2007. I booked the hotel because of all the reviews I read on Trip Advisor and I was not sorry. The review before mine pretty much tells the whole story. The hardest part for us was getting the luggage up and down because there was a lot of luggage and a very tiny elevator. There were also some steps at the front of the hotel. You do need to do this all yourself. But other than that, the stay was quite pleasant and the people were as well. I found the rooms quite spacious ( I can't remember the actual type that I booked). When I arrived, the hotel booked a tour of the Vatican Museum for me for the following day. The hotel is about a 15 minute walk to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. The breakfast was simple - enough to hold us over. It was a very good choice and I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value at Residenza Cellini”
Reviews.Author: chitowntravelguy
Reviews.Content: We are in our late 20s and recently stayed 2 nights at Residenza Cellini to kick off our honeymoon. It was a nice start to our trip and overall a pleasant stay. More importantly, we felt it was a good value for the money spent. Though you should not expect some of the luxury amenities that you might receive at a Ritz Carlton (luggage service, room service, etc.), you are not paying Ritz Carlton prices, and we feel the personal touch and feeling of someone “hosting” us compensated for any shortcomings in amenities. The driver (that the hotel arranged for us) picked us up at the airport and took us to the hotel. We would recommend arranging this if you are flying in (even though it costs 55 Euros plus tip and he’ll likely drive extremely fast), as after a long flight you do not want to have to wait for a taxi. The hotel is on a narrow street in a small building with several other businesses and hotels. There is only a small sign for Residenza Cellini out front (along with signs for other tenants), and the building at first does not look all that nice. The street only has one lane, and other cars cannot easily get by (and they will honk) and it may not be possible to pull over far enough, so be prepared to unload your bags quickly and without assistance except for the driver, as the hotel does not really have anyone to assist with luggage (same when you depart). To get to the hotel reception, you can either take the stairs or the elevator (like most European elevators, it is incredibly small and will likely take several trips to transport you and your luggage). The elevator looks scary, but we found it charming by the end. Once you step into the hotel, you’ll find that the décor is much nicer, with marble floors and fresh flowers. It presents well and is quite clean. Though we were not able to check in upon arrival in mid-morning, we were able to leave our luggage and head out to explore Rome. We would have preferred to store our luggage in a secure room instead of in the hall next to the reception desk, but it appeared that it was adequately monitored by the desk attendant. I was able to store my laptop behind the reception desk upon request, which made me more comfortable. One of the best aspects of our stay was the assistance we received prior to our arrival from Francesca and Georges at the reception desk, who made reservations for us at the Coliseum as well as several restaurants (their favorite, del Giglio, was closed for August, but we very much enjoyed and would recommend the nearby Terrazza Barberini, Target, and also Osteria Ponte Sisto which is a bit further away but worthwhile). They also helped us book a tour of the Vatican with Carrani, a local tour operator, and gave us directions to other spots in the city, such as the catacombs. We would strongly recommend making reservations for the main attractions ahead of time (Francesca and Georges speak excellent English and are very responsive on e-mail), as the lines for those who did not do so looked unbearable (especially the Vatican…wow). It is worth noting that the hotel is at least a 15-20 minute walk from most of the major sites. We were able to walk it without trouble, but older guests and those sensitive to heat should consider having the hotel call you a taxi. They arrive in 5 minutes, and be ready to go because they start charging you from the time they are called! When we returned in the early afternoon from sightseeing, our room was ready and our luggage was in it. The air conditioning was good, and the room, though on the smaller side and with no view of note, was clean and certainly adequate. We would definitely recommend booking a junior suite, as it is not much more expensive and still not a very large room (the less expensive rooms must be quite small). The TV is small and does get CNN, but you probably won’t watch it much anyway. The bed is hard as a rock, but we found that to be the case at the other Italian hotels at which we stayed. There is an iron available free upon request, but all guests share it so don’t count on keeping it in the room. Free wireless internet and a laptop available for guest use was a nice touch. The bathroom was clean and fairly spacious, but water from the shower (at least in ours) reached part of the sink area, so do not leave anything there while showering. Water pressure was excellent and there was enough hot water. My wife reports that the hair dryer was not particularly good compared to those at other Italian hotels. One thing we weren’t wild about was that our room was located right in the main hallway just around the corner from the reception desk and breakfast room. As a result, we heard more foot traffic outside our room than we would have liked. The walls also were not terribly thick, but we only heard a few noises that were not terribly disruptive. We did not hear any noise from the outside. The free breakfast in the breakfast room next to the reception desk was nice, though small and with few choices (hard to criticize it when it is free). We were curious why they weren’t hosting it in the outdoor area a few floors up (a wonderful under-utilized area that we would not have even known about had we not read about it on this site). At check-out, they were flexible with giving us a few extra minutes which was greatly appreciated. They also accepted traveler’s checks without a fee, also appreciated. We had a pleasant stay at the Residenza Cellini and felt it was a good value for the money spent. Upon returning to Rome, we might look at hotels closer to the sites, but if they proved to be too expensive, we would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Starbuckjo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice and the room was spacious. We arrived early and the room was all ready for us. We had arranged a car pickup from the airport through the hotel and the driver was waiting for us with a sign. The tiny old elevator was a bit scary but worked perfectly. The a/c was fantastic and the bathroom was very clean. As everyone else has mentioned, the staff were all extremely helpful. The free internet was a plus. My boyfriend felt the bed was too hard although I prefer a hard bed. The hotel was very quiet and there was no street noise at all. The location was great and walking distance to all the major sights. I would definitely recommend this hotel however, I do think there are some less expensive options in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best.”
Reviews.Author: GlobetrotterToronto
Reviews.Content: We have just returned, July 30,2007 from a wonderful stay at this very friendly, service oriented family hotel. The room was very large with high ceilings and a modern luxury bathroom. The bed is a little hard for our taste but after spending all day walking you won't notice. Nice air conditioning in the room. Many hotels we stayed in advertise this feature but some just don't work well or others ( Paris Hilton ) shut it off at midnight. It's really hot now in Rome so be warned. Bring lots of cool clothes. If you go to the Vatican,ladies need their shoulders covered. The staff, Barbara,Francesca,Georges,Donatello are the best. The breakfast buffet is super and they make coffees and beverages to order. Just remember this is a small family hotel with 4 or 5 rooms on 2 floors. Don't expect room service or such from a large luxury hotel. The best place is the location. We walked everywhere to the Spanish steps, Trevi fountains, Pantheon, Colosseum. We did use the underground train several times. Very safe, modern,clean, and cheap to get around. We never waited more than 3 minutes for a train. They have air conditioning to. Restaurants we went to included La del Giglio, ( 5 mins walk ), Squisito, ( just across from the US embassy ). Other restaurants that were recommended but we didn't go to were Il Cabriello and Hostaria Romana. They were all recommended by Georges. We went to 2 that were great. He only works 2 days a week so you might miss him. Sunday night is hard to find a restaurant since many are closed. If you go the the Pantheon in the evening there is a bunch of restaurants sitting around a small fountain. We ate at a couple for lunch and dinner and they were OK. Go to the La Griffe hotel on Via Nazionale on your last night. 5 mins walk. Go to the roof top restaurant on the 10 th floor. Beautiful view to the Vatican city. Amazing views and nice and cool. I would go before and book a table of your choice. They have a great corner table for 2 (the only 1 ) to see the view. Remember all the diners start arriving between 9-10 pm so go before 9 pm to get seated. We arranged for the hotel to get a limo pick up at Rome airport. 55 Euros and worth every penny. Depending on time of day arrival the trip can take from 30 mins to 2 hours because of traffic.We had a new Mercedes Benz. The taxi drivers are nuts and drive like maniacs. Be warned. Also have bad reputations for fraudulent practices of deliberately taking you the long way to drive up the fare. If you go to the Colosseum get your entry ticket in advance. We waited in line for 1 hour or more. The hotel staff will tell you where to get it. Take your tickets and walk past the lineups on the left hand side. It will take you all the way to the entry turnstiles. Last note, if your are booked for August cancel now. Go another time. We found every attraction just jam packed.The locals tell us in August it is just impossible since all of Europe is on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “A welcome oasis in bustling Rome”
Reviews.Author: Texas Family Travelers
Reviews.Content: The Residenza Cellini is a welcome haven from the busy city of Rome, which can be gritty, hot, crowded, and generally overwhelming at times. The hotel is located on two floors of a building that houses other hotels, businesses, and residences. Our room was big and lovely, and the bathroom was gorgeous. Perhaps the best part is the staff: Gaetano, Barbara, and Francesca, as well as the other personnel, always had a smile for us and were helpful in every way. The breakfasts were good, with delicious cappucino. There is a pretty outdoor patio in progress; this may be a future option for al fresco breakfasts. Location is convenient - just tell the taxi to drop you off at Piazza della Reppublica nearby and walk the rest of the way. The hotel is close enough to walk to many of the major sights. The train station is within walking distance, too. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful respite in Rome”
Reviews.Author: TripAdvice52
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent five nights at this wonderful quiet place beginning on June 26. We stayed in a junior suite which was worth the extra Euros. The location is unbeatable with a nearby metro stop, the termini train station, and plenty of places to eat. Don't be mislead by the comments about the neighborhood. It is quite safe and the locals are great . The staff is very helpful, the breakfast was really good.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet sanctuary”
Reviews.Author: SatisfiedTraveller46
Reviews.Content: In April this year, my family of 4 (2 adults, 13 year old and 10 year old) spent four amazing nights at Residenza Cellini. This small hotel was a home away from home in the bustling city of Rome. The location is ideal - close to the main station and near the Hop On Hop Off bus depot. The family suite was well appointed with a very tasteful decor. The large room was clean and quiet. The staff particularly George were very friendly and extremely helpful. They gave us excellent suggestions for places to eat authentic Italian food. The delicious buffet was more than adequate for us. The Italian Opera playing in the background was very fitting in this peaceful sanctuary. The wireless internet access enabled my family to keep in contact with friends. I would highly recommend this hotel to families.

Reviews.Title: “Residenza Cellini an Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelMiam525
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Residenza Cellini for four nights June 3 - 7. I can't say enough of this place. It was impeccably clean. The service was second to none. They were very helpful and attentive to our needs. Our room was very large and beautifully decorated. The bathroom was huge and modern. It has the comforts and look of a luxury hotel, but with a personal touch. The breakfast is plentiful and served in a cozy and elegant setting. They made cappucino for us every morning. I would highly recommend this place to anyone. If you are a family of four like us (2 adults and 2 teenagers) their family suite is perfect. Also, the location of the hotel is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: SanFranciscoLucy
Reviews.Content: We booked at the Cellini because of the reveiws in TripAdvisor. We were not disappointed. This small hotel is in a great, central location. Yet it is a quiet neighborhood. The room was handsomely decorated (next time we'll reserve a junior suite for more space, but it was fine). The staff couldn't have been more helpful. They helped us book a guide ahead of time. They made reservations for a tour to Tivoli and for local restaurants. The breakfast was perfectly adequate and will probably be even better in the soon-to-be-open bigger breakfast room. And the price is very reasonable for such a good accommodation in Rome. We'll go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pennywise3
Reviews.Content: It was clean, well situated, quiet at night, wonderful rooms, great staff, great breakfast etc. The sheets on the bed were so wonderful that I asked if they could direct me to a store to buy some. They did and I got the most fabulous cotton/linen blend sheets for only 30E each.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: patcaro
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this lovely hotel for three nights in June 2007. The hotel is away from the main tourist sights which affords some relaxation from the hustle and bustle. The room was very clean and large; the terrace beautiful and a good place to relax (breakfast will be served there soon), breakfast was exceptional compared to other hotels in Italy. The main reason I will definitely return is Barbara and Gaitano. They were friendly, extremely helpful, and made us feel right at home. I would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is worth all of the hype!”
Reviews.Author: Cubsfan_1974
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at Residenza Cellini after reading the incredible reviews on TripAdvisor. This hotel did not disappoint. The hotel is beautiful; the rooms are big; the staff is incomparable; and the hotel has a beautiful terrace on the roof that's fantastic for sharing a late-night bottle of wine. Our room was immaculate, and we were surprised by the private terrace off of our room (I think it's the only room in the hotel with a private terrace so try to request it if you can). I can't stay enough about the staff too. This is a family-operated B&B and they were unbelievably accomodating and geniunely nice throughout our stay. They also speak English, which came in handy for us. The breakfast that was included was sufficient (although not huge). There is wireless internet access and they provide a laptop in the afternoons for guests. The location is great for touring the city--closely located to a main train station. In fairness of a thorough review, I'll caution that the showers are very small. I'm not a large person and it was a squeeze. If you are going to be in Rome for any amount of time, you should definitely stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Small Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: smaudrey
Reviews.Content: We had a WONDERFUL stay at Residenza Cellini. We were a group of 6 and had 3 rooms on the 5th floor with access to the outside patio, where we had our own "happy hour". The staff was very helpful with wine glasses and bottle opener. The rooms were very quiet and extremely clean. We toured each others rooms, and found them all to be exactly the same in layout and cleanliness. The hotel is in a large building that is shares with a few other businesses, hotels, etc. They have rooms on the 3rd and 5th floor of building. The breakfasts were very good and the cappuccino's were the BEST. The hotel is close to the subway stop if needed. We walked from main train station, but some may chose to take subway one stop to Republica (?); the hotel is literally around the corner. I would definitely stay here again and highly recommend. You will not be diappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Masha-from-Russia
Reviews.Content: Benissimo, great, unreal!!!!I love this hotel. Great personal, great room, great everything...Great Manager=)Thanx for all Maria from Russia

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Oasis in the Heart of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: cetacean
Reviews.Content: My wife, our nearly 2-year-old child, and I stayed at the Hotel Cellini for two nights last year and feel so lucky to have found this wonderful place. It was one of the recommendations in Rick Steves' Italy handbook, and this was one of Rick's great recommendations! We were treated like royalty, which is so welcome when travelling with a toddler. Our room was very comfortable, and our hosts were kind and generous. The hotel is very quiet and relaxing, which is something that I didn't expect for a hotel that was so close to the Rome's central train station. I've stayed near the station in years past and know first hand how loud and uncomfortable some hotels near the station can be. As my title for this review says, the Hotel Cellini really is an oasis. I only wish that we could have stayed for more than a week instead of only two nights. We will most definitely stay at this hotel the next time we're in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Met all of our expectations.... and more”
Reviews.Author: JohnofStamford
Reviews.Content: When you read that the hotel you are staying at is #2 of over a 1000 hotels in Rome, you have high expectations! Fortunately, all of ours were met! We stayed at the Residenza Cellini from 27 May -1 June 2007. My first piece of advice for anyone reading this review is read plenty of reviews of this hotel on tripadvisor!! What this isn’t is a glitzy 300 bedroom hotel with restaurants and bars aplenty. What it is , is a boutique 3rd floor residence where personal service, quality and cleanliness mean everything. The entrance, via a side street intercom, is not the Ritz but from the moment of arrival we were made to feel very welcome. Francesca gave us a very good map of Rome and gave us some helpful advice to get around this wonderful city. We were shown to our room which was large, very comfortable and spotlessly clean, complete with aircon and minibar (soft drinks only). We hate public transport and were happy to travel everywhere on foot. The Trevi Fountain is 12 minutes away, Spanish steps (and designer shopping) 15 minutes, Pantheon 20 minutes, Roman Forum 20 minutes, Colliseum 25 minutes, St. Peters 35 minutes – and that was at a pretty leisurely pace. Hotel facilities were fine – a comfortable bed and a very nice continental breakfast (meats, cheese, rolls, croissants, cakes, fresh fruit, yoghurts, fresh tea / coffee) each morning – served in the small but elegant breakfast room. We travelled with friends, one of whom fell ill with a very serious back problem. The Cellini were fantastic in arranging an emergency doctor (in the middle of the night) and rearranging flights with Alitalia for an early return. They could not do enough and enquired each day with us about the condition of our friend. Overall, a very pleasant stay, lovely people and close enough to all the attractions. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “If this is what you want, then it's great.”
Reviews.Author: Bunny-Man
Reviews.Content: Much is written about the RC, and it seems to fluctuate between delight and disappointment. We did three nights, in mid May, and therefore were looking to see the most of Rome, and not much of the Hotel, and this is where I think the clash of opinions arises. If on your holiday you want a bit of time to relax around the hotel, then I can't see how the RC is for you. If however, you want an attractive, well located B&B, then I can't see the RC, being beaten. What causes the RC to rate so highly, is the level of attention that the staff provide. We had no need of any extra assistance, and therefore, the RC was just our base. This said, I don't think it is often appreciated, how much staying in a hotel, with never a thing going wrong, can be to highly rated, especially when you read other peoples experience of other hotels in TA. The RC is always neat and tidy, the staff are always attentive, the rooms were always made up upon our return, the bathrooms always clean, the breakfast table continually topped up, room service quickly provided. For B&B, what more do you want? We did see several other guests, asking for help on many different tasks, and the efforts that the staff made to fulfil this requests was very impressive. Therefore if you just want a base for your adventures in Rome, with high levels of personal assistance to aid you in your arrangements, we cannot recommend the RC to highly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: Mardee
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel; room was very large, clean, good bathroom with Jacuzzi bath. Very good breakfast by Italian standards. Free Internet access. Extremely helpful staff (rare in Italian hotels by the sound of it!). We walked pretty much everywhere; it's not right beside the sites but not too far if you don't mind a stroll. About 20min walk to the Coliseum. For the price this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fan of the Cellini”
Reviews.Author: bikerjohnny
Reviews.Content: Having read fantastic reviews of this place on Trip Advisor we booked for a three day stay here and were not disappointed. We had one of the junior suites on the fifth floor which gave us access to the shared terrace which was still under construction but still pleasant anyway. The room was a good size (especially for the rates charged) and very nicely decorated.(and we are fussy). There was no view from our room but the terrace just along the corridor made up for that. Breakfast was definitely adequate for our needs, my wife and I are split on the coffee debate with me liking and her not but the thing that sets this place apart from pretty much everywhere else in Rome was the service. The staff here were so helpful and pleasant (definitely a distinct comparison to all the restaurants we ate in) and the rooms were all kept immaculately clean and tidy each day. Only slight moan was that the bed was rock hard, though our friends staying on the third floor had just a firm bed which suited them nicely. With regard to the rest of Rome, we found it to be a lot dirtier than our last visit ten years ago, more graffiti and loads of dumped fliers everywhere with a tourist attraction. nearby. We did enjoy the break but this was more to do with the company than the place, but still Rome is a fantastic place to visit just for the architecture alone, we just felt the place had been touristified beyond belief resembling more of a Spanish beach resort than an ancient city.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience”
Reviews.Author: mika98
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RC for 4 nights prior to a Princess cruise. I chose this place from the reviews on TripAdvisor and was not disappointed. We had arranged for them to pick us up at the airport which was hassle free and much appreciated after a long flight from Canada. We were welcomed by Franscesca who personally took us to our Junior Suite which was huge for European standards and beautifully clean. I am really picky about cleanliness and I could not even find one piece of dust or hair anywhere in the room or the bathroom. The bed felt hard at first but was really comfortable. No sore back in the morning. Each morning we were met by Peter who ensured everything was there for our breakfast plus anything we needed for our day of touring. He even offered to personally take us by train to his home town about 20 minutes out of Rome. It unfortunately was raining and so we did not end up going. The whole experience was wonderful and I cannot recommend this place enough. It is quaint, private and quiet. Thank you to all the staff at RC for making our second visit to Rome most memorable. We will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful oasis”
Reviews.Author: kenandmrss
Reviews.Content: how anyone can find a single bad thing to write about this place is beyond me. Firstly get it straight - it's not a hotel, it's a residenzia, so, no pool, no bar, no concierge etc. but, what you do get is the most helpful and friendly staff you could want, beautiful thoughtfully designed and coordinated public areas, and a very nice room. My room had a little balcony that overlooked this inner courtyard (not accessible), with a wonderful modern bathroom and a tiredness defeating jacuzzi bathtub. OK the little room used for breakfast can get crowded, but when the roof terrace is completed the breakfasts and any daytime drinks will be taken there, and it's a lovely place, high above the bustle of the street below. One reviewer stating that breakfast was bread and yoghurt seems to have overlooked the cooked meats, cheeses, pastries, biscuits, cereals, the wonderful coffees and teas, juices and fruit, in fact the only thing not available here that you'd get in a snobby 5 star hotel is the scrambled eggs and frankfurters. Now the location, well, it's less than 5 minutes to the nearest metro station, less than 3 minutes to the bus stop, and i think i walkded to the trevi fountain in about 20 minutes (not recommended - take the metro. use the metro to get to the colesseum, vatican, pantheon etc etc, at 11 euros for a 3 day pass (which includes bus, tram, metro) what a bargain. When you first arrive in the little street (via modena) all you see is an ancient door with a few bell pushes, but clearly stated is "residenzia cellini" push the bell, your buzzed in then use the wonderfully ancient lift to floor 3, again you get buzzed in, so 2 levels of security and there is someone on the desk 24 7 what more can you ask. all i can say further, is that i'm going back just as soon as next year's flights are out. the rooms go very quickly here.

Reviews.Title: “not #3”
Reviews.Author: pdkmd
Reviews.Content: Residena Cellini is an "okay" place to stay while in Rome but certainly not worth it's very high rating . It is a work in progress and may eventually deserve a good spot on ones list of romes's hotels but certainly not near the top.The good---short walk from train station ( about 10 mins if you don't get lost), very helpfulful(great restaurant suggestions) and friendly staff, potentially nice rooms (our had a nice balcony)........the bad: really not all that close to any of the main sites by foot and public transport can be difficult to figure out at times ( despite what 'Rick S' might say). Little annoyances abound: small over-crowded breakfast room, our room was probably the smallest room ( although very well apointed) on our trip (to walk to one side of the bed -one had to maneuver around a drapery cord holder that more than once gave me a good shot in my thigh( The room IS SMALL )- soaps and shampoo not replaced once used,and a number of other small but significant negatives, Remember, it is located in a rather large office type building and reception is on the 3rd floor, our room was on the 5th.......All in all, an okay place but there are MANY better (location,amenities, room size,etc) for the same price in Rome. Of all the places we stayed in on our 6 city jaunt in Italy this is the only one we would not return to.Sorry Cellini, you are okay but not number 3 to us......

Reviews.Title: “A calm oasis”
Reviews.Author: JAH52
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Residenza Cellini in April and had a wonderful stay. Our stay was part of a two week trip to Italy. Our flight from the US arrived in Rome and we spent one night at the Cellini before heading off to Tuscany. We then returned to the Cellini for three nights before our departure back to the US. Breaking up our stay in this way turned out to be a great idea. We recovered from our jet lag in the quiet comfort of the hotel and then we left a small suitcase of clothes at the hotel for our return. When we came back to the hotel, we had clean clothes waiting for us and we felt like we were returning home. The hotel even gave us a bottle of wine to welcome us back. On our return, we stayed in one of the new rooms on the fifth floor and it was very nice. The great thing about this hotel is that it provides a quiet spot to revive from the wonderful chaos of Rome. Because we knew we could relax completely in the comfort of the Cellini, we loved Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel shame about the city.”
Reviews.Author: alexandriab
Reviews.Content: Stopped at the R.C for 3 nights in April. Booked this on the strength of the reviews. Hotel is on two floors of a four storey block located in a side street. Very clean and tidy but other than a nice bedroom nothing else much to shout about.Barbara greeted us on our arrival and kindly gave us a few pointers on what to do and where to go. Breakfast very basic and in a very small room. Rome was pretty much what I expected tired ,congested, grubby in a lot of places and plastered in graffiti. When you go out at night be prepared to dodge the thousands of black rubbish bags which line the streets and the kamikaze scooter riders who seem to specialise in driving up one way streets the wrong way one handed whilst on a mobile phone.. It pays to book your restaurants in advance as in any capital city as the ones you can get in are usually pretty average at best. If you don't care much for pizza and pasta you better take some sandwiches. Sorry to say lots of beggars around and street vendors hawking tat. It did upset the wife a little when a wretched shell of a man with two raw stumps for hands which he bumped together for effect descended on our table one evening seeking a hand out. ( no pun intended ). You go to Rome for the Vatican and the Colloseum and boy they don't disapoint , the view from the top of St Peters is worth the trip alone.The Trevi fountains and the Spanish steps can be done in 15mins a piece and basically give the local pickpockets and chancers a guaranteed choice of punters so keep your wits about you,be practical try not to look too much like a tourist and don't get too obsessed about getting ripped off even though this seems to be a speciality occupation for a sizable minority of Italians.

Reviews.Title: “Very Reliable B&B”
Reviews.Author: roseoakhil
Reviews.Content: We have just come back form the Recidenza Cellini overall we are very happy. I do think it has been made a little over rated by this site though. Firstly location is not so great yes its walkable to most things but so is most of Rome wherever you stay, The Homeless people sleeping on the doorsteps at night certainly dont make you think you are staying in the most desirable of neighbour hoods. We booked our transfer with a seperate company (Rome Cabs) as they were cheeper then what was quoted by the hotel. On arrival we had a very warm welcome and were given a map of Rome and a few resturant recomendations which proved to be very good, particular mention goes to Il Gabriello, just off the spanish steps, also the gentleman pointed out a few things for us to visit, even though we had planned out what we were going to do i must admit helped us alot and perhaps changed our plans for the better. Our room was beautifull, lovely furnishings and fresh flowers, we had been appointed room 2 which is just across from the breakfast room and facing the street, however the noise wasnt to bad at all, yes we could hear people but i havent stayed in a single hotel where i couldnt here people walking around on occasion. Our only gripe(s) with the rooms were the bathroom, firstly we had ants in the bathroom but only on one occasion, which we think may have come through the window when it was open and also the jacuzzi bath, yes it was lovely and great when my feet were tired but unfortunatly the jets were dirty and i think very unpleasently the previous occupant had been shaving before hand and used the jacuzzi as you can imagine not particularly nice, apart from that very comfortable homely rooms. Apart frrom reception & the breakfast rooms there isnt much else to the place, it certainly doesnt come under the Hotel catagory. The lift i found great fun, cartinely an experience, but top tip dont ever leave the metal gate open as not only does it stop someone else calling the lift but you will get shouted at by a very angry Italian man. Breakfast was simple mainly bread products and yogurt definatly improvment needs to be made there. There was no problem in getting them to call a taxi which would arrive in seconds, i will admit to mainly using the taxi in rome as its relativley cheap and the bus just once was not a plesent experience, however i was suprised by the tube and how clean they are. Overall i loved Rome,we managed to pack most of the sites in in 2 1/2 days, we particuarly enjoyed the cat sanctuary (sounds odd i know but worth a visit). Trevi fountain is crowded all day long, Spanish steps we found was fairly quiet in the mornings. We toured Colleseum and Roman Forum (do the forum first at about 9 its so quiet then compared to the crowd later on). The Vatican was really quiet when we went at 12:00 no Q's for Vatican Museum at all. We were really suprised how compact rome is we expected sites to be a long way away from where we were then all of a sudden they were in front of you. No problems with pick pockets but it pays to be cautious of who is around you, i can imagine the trevi fountain as a hot spot.

Reviews.Title: “Bed and Breakfast Cellini”
Reviews.Author: Calgary03
Reviews.Content: We arrove at night via one of their cars they provide. Which I must say drove about 180 down the highway. We're young but that would have scared anyone else just as much. The cab driver had trouble driving up the street because th street was so narrow. He dropped us off in what looked like an alley to us Canadians, but nope just a narrow street. Lighting was very poor and there was no sign of a Hotel of what we know in sight. We figured we were getting robbed. The guy I was with started being rather abrupt...asking what he was doing...he didn't speak english well, and snapped back.. residenze cellini. He went to this door that would be off alice in wonderland - half size and rand the doorbell. The door is so samll with no hotel markings on it at all. This was surprising to me because the hotel website looks like a nice corner building. Anyway the cab driver says something in Italian and the door never opens. He throws up his hands and gets back into the cab. Needless to say they were reliable because he brought back the camera that I left in the back seat, so fortunate for me. So we stood outside this door while a street person, who lied there each night, was there to greet us. I was so creeped out I said do you want to walk and find a different hotel? Oh my, all the reviews were so good! Which when we borrowed the laptop inside it had an internet history of going to this site many times..? Maybe vacationers. Anyway after ringing three times, finally someone answered gain sounded angry and we said Hi we're staying at the hotel..the door buzzed to what seemed like an apartment. The quaint lift was just big enough for us and our luggage piled on top of each other. We had no idea what floor so we went one by one. Nothing was signed, until we hit the first hotel looking place, we got off, and he directed us up a few floors to the residenza cellini. The hotel is more like a bed and breakfast to us Canadians. It is not a hotel or resort by any means. It was clean and bright and had a huge bouquet of flowers on the desk. Marble floors. We were let down a large hall which also for heels on marble was quite loud. Everday we could hear peoples conversations and everyone who walked down this large marble hallway, it echoed but was quite quiet when no one was around. We heard one night office guy hacking coughing all night long and water run down the pipes outside. We couldn't sleep very well, and the pillows reminded me of cinder blocks, the beds as hard as rocks. They also had no idea what a facecloth is. They handed me bathtowels every time I tried to motion to wash my face. Regardless of this, the staff and owner tried to serve us whatever we needed and the gentleman was very excellent with ideas and helpfulness in getting around was also useful. It is quaint, their breakfast nook, seats about 4 tables, so you ate with similar people in a small room, which was a tad uncomfortable at first, but got easier as the people were all very friendly, and the breakfast was a minimal continental breakfast but fresh. I have only stayed in luxury resorts and hotels but tried this one. The only other downfall, is that they claimed they never receieved my fax that our flight was rescheduled, and asked me if I brought the fax confirmation number..they said no fax came through so they charged me for that extra night with no negotiating and the cab they ordered for us. So that also was a bit distasteful I thought, and since we stayed there 4 more days and paid cash, I'd think there's something that could have been done there to make me a happy customer. Otherwise the staff was friendly and helpful, and the rooms and place very clean.

Reviews.Title: “All is true”
Reviews.Author: subortna
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a five night stay at the Rezidenza Cellini. All the reports praising this establishment are true. The hospitality is outstanding - all of the staff go out of their way to be helpful. The rooms are spotlessly clean, as are the public areas and corridors, the latter so tastefully decorated. We had lots of good advice about places to eat and how to get to sites around the city. Airport transfers were arranged for us - not cheap but 100% reliable. Our only reservation would be the breakfasts - certainly wholly adequate, but the content was none too inspiring. This, a minor quibble, would certainly not prevent us returning again and again, and recommending the R.C. unreservedly to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: JimmyGEHT
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent 4 nights at Residenza Cellini.This hidden gem is located on a quiet side street within walking distance of all major attractions except the Vatican which is a short cab or metro ride away.The spacious,classy furnished room includes a private marble bathroom.Although the shower was a bit snug the bathroom is of ample size.The staff is friendly and helpful and was able to provide us with tickets for seats at the Pope's Easter Sunday Mass in St.Peter's Square.I highly recommend Residenza Cellini to anyone visiting Rome who likes a small hotel with atmosphere and warmth.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis”
Reviews.Author: rdytogo1
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in many hotels in Rome this is absolutely one of the best. My wife, sister-in-law and niece finished up a Tuscan holidy by spending 2 nights in Rome prior to our flight home. My wife and I had room #2 and the others were in #6. I can't heap enough praise on the staff at this fantastic, 6 room, property. They are courteous, helpful and truly concerned about your comfort and well being. Clean, comfortable and quiet. Lovely breakfast and free internet via the laptop in the breakfast room. A metro stop is a block around the corner. You can walk to this property from Termini station but I suggest a cab if it's your first time in Rome. Thank you Rezidenza Cellini...we'll be back !

Reviews.Title: “Great, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: MDRedSox
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Residenza Cellini last week and found the staff extremely helpful and willing to answer any questions. We arrived at 10:00 in the morning and our room was already awaiting us (a major plus when flying from the States!) so we were able to settle in, even eat some breakfast before setting off to explore Rome. We walked to the Colisseum and Roman forum but took the bus to the vatican as we were told it would be 35-40 minutes to walk. The bus (#64) to the Vatican was very easy to take and dropped us right outside St. Peter's Square. We took the train to the Spanish Steps (2 stops) and then walked from there to Villa Borghese, Trevi Fountain and Piazza Navona before gopping on a bus tot ake back to Cellini. Staff was always willing to mkae coffee, tea, cappuccino at any time (though they do charge you...probably about 2 Euro/cup). Our room (junior Suite) was great.
