Plenty of room and the jacuzzi tub was an added bonus after a long day of walking. TV had a few English speaking channels (CCN, SKY TV, BBC, and a few movie channels).

Reviews.Title: “Everything that we hoped for and more”
Reviews.Author: Yetton
Reviews.Content: I had nearly driven myself to distraction researching for a hotel in Rome. So many had negative comments. That was until I found the Residenza Cellini. Having booked a similar property ( no bar or restaurant ) in Venice and being suitably impressed ( If you can't find a bar or restaurant in Rome / Venice then you need serious help ) I contacted the hotel. From our first contact to our departure the whole experience was a delight. The hotel now covers the third and fifth floor of a multi occupancy building, having just opened five rooms and a roof terrace on the fifth floor, with access by stairs for the fit or a 'quaint' lift that holds three. We were on the fifth floor. The room was beautifully furnished, the bathroom too was quality although, to be fair, a bit long and narrow. Our friends had a square bathroom which was a better shape. But you can only use the space that you have to the best advantage. The hotel supplied us, on request, with a bottle or two of wine each evening which we drank on the terrace. Although it is not yet complete it did not detract from the pleasant experience. What is more, and this applied to the mini bar items, they charged very reasonable prices. Not out to fleece the punters as many hotels try to do. The breakfast was more than adequate to set you up for the day although now the hotel has doubled it's accommodation, from 6 rooms to 11, we could see potential problems if all the guests descended at once but It didn't happen to us. Our bed linen, cool and fresh, was changed after two nights. All the staff were delightful and out to please without being overbearing. As mentioned the hotel is in a multi occupancy building, Via Modena being just off the Via Nazionale and close to most major attractions. We walked either to or from most, using the Red tour bus to hop on and off ( you will need the right change as they will not give you any if you don't tender the right amount ) or taxis which we found very reasonable. I can't post any photos as I had my camera lifted from my shoulder bag as we arrived. To be fair I had left it by the lift on the gound floor but when it was returned, some ten minutes later, it was minus the camera. Can't blame the hotel for that, my own stupidity but it did make us aware throughout our visit of the possibilities. Everyone is entitled to a viewpoint but I feel saddened at the review by SeattleTravelDiva. I can understand being upset and marking the hotel down in a particular area but to be negative and not acknowledge all the good things about this hotel is just not cricket as we Brits say. Book this hotel with confidence and enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: StrangeWat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and daughter of 14 visited RC in the first week of April 07, staying for four nights in the junior triple suite room 3. The bedrooms are very traditional although large but the stylish bathrooms very up-to-date with bidet and Jacuzzi, everywhere was exceptionally clean. The room had a new flat screen TV with sky box with english speaking stations such as CNN and sky news available. Of an evening a laptop connected to broadband internet was made readily available in the dining room at no charge which was invaluable for checking in our return flights and my daughter keeping in touch via msn (could they survive without MSN?) fruit and sweets were always on offer in the hall. Breakfast was open from 6:30 to 11:00 for late risers with a good selection of freshly squeezed juices, rolls, meats, cheeses and pastries, we ate around 10'ish and found this was sufficient until our evening meal, suplemented by a coffee or two throughout the day. The hotel is well situated, we walked to the vatican, colosseum, trevi fountain, spanish steps etc, only taking a bus to the catacombes which are too far. Walking is really advised, the streets are narrow and behind every turn is a treasure, there seems to be no restrictions at each venue and no problems taking photos, many venues are free. Don't miss visiting the 17th century church Chiesa di Santa Maria della Concezzione in the street Via Vittoria just a few streets from the hotel, take the main stairs to the right to the crypt (no charge but make a donation) the Capuchin monks used the bones from 4,000 of their departed brothers to decorate the walls, why didn't t they bury them very bizarre, loved to have been at that brain storming session!! Recommend you take guided tours wherever possible we did'nt for the vatican and missed out, however we did for the coloseum and the catacombes, we used Roamaround tours who are located at the exit to the coloseum (they hold up blue signs), Elaine in particular was amazing for the catacombe tour, not just a guide but she is studying roman archaeology and added so much more than we could have got from a guide book, we have no experience of other tours so can't compare. Restaraunts are reasonably basic we never found a particularly good one, we found the portions very variable from generous to meagre, advise if you find a good one then stick with it. The hotel staff are fantastic, accomodating without being overpowering, and speak english well, always happy to give directions, make reccomendations or arrangements. Unfortunatly they could only accomodate us for four days of our six day holiday and for the remaining two days we stayed at another hotel which was £100 per night more expensive, but no better in any respect, this hotel really does represent very good value for money. Very fond memories and no hesitation in staying there again, highly reccomended. Enjoy Rome it is AMAZING!! Hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations!”
Reviews.Author: nola44
Reviews.Content: We decided to try this hotel based on TripAdvisor recommendations (and despite the fact that it is listed in Rick Steves book). It really lived up to our expectations. The staff were just excellent. We had a stressful drive to get to the hotel (yup, we drove in Rome--NOT our smartest idea) and when we arrived there was nowhere to park the car to unload the luggage and it started to rain, but the staff rallied to help us get our luggage to the room, provided umbrellas to keep us dry and were warm and welcoming. They gave us impecable directions to return the car and recommended the very good Dal Giglio for dinner. We felt comfortable asking for whatever we needed during our three night stay because they went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. The room, one of the new ones on the 5th floor, was just lovely. It was large, by European standards, and quiet, with a comfortable bed. We were able to sleep with the windows open--in Rome! It wasn't completely finished yet so did not have a phone or facial tissues, but otherwise was really very well appointed. Their complimentary toiletries are very nice. The shower was one of those multijet things and small (normal size for Europe, we found). The breakfast was good--breads, sweet pastries, cold cuts, cheese, cereal, two different types of juices, coffee, etc. It filled us up for sightseeing. The hotel is located very near the Piazza della Repubblica metro station. It was close enough for comfortable sightseeing but far enough away to be quiet at night. We really enjoyed our stay at the Residenza Cellini and look forward to staying there again on any subsequent trips to Rome. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: EL344
Reviews.Content: The staff was warm and welcoming, our room was ready when we arrived at 9:30 a.m., our room was immaculate and, for a European hotel, fairly spacious. The hotel is 5 minutes from the metro and within fairly easy walking distance to most sights. Breakfast was standard but good.

Reviews.Title: “Jacuzzi? Yes Please”
Reviews.Author: jbutters
Reviews.Content: Residenza Cellini was our last stop in Italy where we spent a week in the large junior Suite room #4 with a Jacuzzi (which was great) and an extra sofa bed. After reading a number of reviews we were concerned about noise in rooms 1, 2, 3 and chose 4 since room 6 was booked. I could see how the first two rooms could be a problem as they are right near the front desk but you are pretty safe from three on since they are far enough from the counter. Although room 3 is across from the breakfast room we did not notice a lot of traffic there during our stay. The Residenza is located on the third floor of a building right around the corner from Via Nazionale, the main street that cuts through downtown Rome. Therefore it’s a central location near the major sites of the city although expect to do some serious walking in Rome in general. We booked the hotel on the Rick Steves discount and received a bit off. The only caveat is that you must pay the total amount in cash. Booking this so far in advance I actually forgot and only had a credit card but they honored the rates anyway. To celebrate our honeymoon they brought us a bottle of champagne and delivered hot chocolate to our room along with various breakfast snacks before our many excursions. We never even used the breakfast room choosing to have ‘breakfast in bed’ everyday. The breakfast was not our best in Italy but consisted of an above standard continental breakfast with various cold foods such as bread, ham, cheese and pastries. They booked our tour to the Vatican and also scheduled a reservation for the Borghese Museum and recommended various restaurants nearby. Overall this was a very pleasant stay and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a refuge from busy Rome yet close enough to all of the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and charming hotel!”
Reviews.Author: wibby_01
Reviews.Content: What more can I say? We visited RC on the recommendation of Rick Steves and our friends. The hotel was so close to everything that it made it easy to come back in the middle of the day without losing too much time. Each of the staff went out of his or her way to be accommodating and helpful, especially Barbara! My only advice is to ask for a room that faces the courtyard, not the street. It was a tad noisy, but nothing unbearable. Regarding the travelers who had problems with reservations, I must say that we had the exact opposite experience! Barbara took it upon herself (we weren't looking for discounts) and went out of her way to recalculate our rate when she saw our Rick Steves book (without our mentioning or expecting it), even after we had paid for our room. It was so charming to wake up every morning and have breakfast together in the adorable little dining room. They even kept it out later than usual for us late risers :) I couldn't have asked for a more knowledgeable, trustworthy, or helpful group of people than those that we found at Residenza Cellini. We will be back for many years to come! Thanks, Barbara!

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: Jaye52
Reviews.Content: Tucked away on a sidestreet, the Residenza Cellini is a peaceful oasis. The 6 room hotel oozes charm. The staff was charming, the room was charming, immaculate, comfortable and tastefully decorated. The only negative was the "cruise ship sized" shower. My only regret is that we had only 1 night to spend there!

Reviews.Title: “Do not trust with Credit Card info”
Reviews.Author: SeattleTravelDiva
Reviews.Content: Warning! While planning our honeymoon we contacted Cellini based on Rick Steves and Tripadvisor reviews. All seemed well - until we emailed to re-confirm our reservation that they suddenly lost. Interesting that we were quoted a discount rate from the Rick Steves book and then suddenly forgotten about during high travel season. A #1 rating should be earned through follow through and service. Not accepting credit card information and then losing it. We're quite disappointed indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Cellini Apartment - like coming home”
Reviews.Author: clairerom
Reviews.Content: Residenza Cellini 2 bedroom Apartment was a real haven for my husband and I during a rainy stay in Rome. It was spacious, thoughtfully put-together and well looked-after by conscientious di Paulis family, who really do care about the comfort of their guests. It seems petty to point out problems, but the dripping tap in the bathroom did get quite irritating and it would have been nice to be able to close the shutters in the bedroom during the evening (impossible due to strange installation of air conditioning pipe). The location of the apartment was good. There were few tourists and plenty of life, with restaurants, cafes, boutique shops and also a large, modern cinema on Piaza Cavour. Easy walking to main sights and 2 mins walk to bus nr 70 which takes you further afield to Forum and Termini. Our favourite restaurant was Il ragno d'Oro, run with great energy by a father in hip-hop jeans and his expressive family. No menu as such, just depends on what is being cooked that evening – always delicious. I recommend, if you have time, that you take a trip out of town to see the astoundingly well-preserved ruins at Ostia Antica. Surprisingly few other tourists seem to take the trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect accommodation in Rome”
Reviews.Author: LovetravelBelfast
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a short holiday (3 days) in Rome during which time we stayed at Residenza Cellini. We could not find anything to fault about our room, the staff or the location of this hotel. It could be described as bed and breakfast accommodation rather than a hotel however it is more like staying with close friends who cannot do enough for you. I have been very fortunate in having the opportunity to stay in hotels all over the world from luxury in Barbados to not quite so luxurious in London, and the staff in the Residenza Cellini have to rate as the most pleasant I have ever met. The hotel is located about 10 mins walk from Termini station and a few hundred yards from the metro. We got a shuttle bus there on our first day which took approximately 25mins from Ciampino Airport and cost 30euro for the two of us. (I would advise not to join the long queue for the TerraVision Bus recommended by EasyJet. If you leave through the main arrivals door and turn left you will see another bus stop with slightly cheaper direct services to Termini.) We arrived at the hotel at 1pm and received excellent information from George on reception as to where we should go for lunch. He rang ahead to make a reservation for us which meant we were treated to free glasses of champagne on arrival!! The food was also delicious – there are lots of other places near at hand to eat although we only ate at restaurants recommended by the Cellini staff. The hotel is ideally placed for sightseeing. You can either get the metro to local sites or do as we did and walk everywhere. We are not usually so energetic but the weather was really nice and it was just lovely to walk through Rome with nothing else to do but sightsee and haggle with the on-street traders. As stated by another reviewer, it was great to come back and relax in the Jacuzzi bath – pure heaven. The room did not have tea or coffee making facilities however George told us that he wouldn’t mind making this for us anytime we wanted it. The hotel is entirely on the third floor of the building and is unbelievably quiet considering its location; we were neither disturbed by guests inside or people and traffic outside. It was our wedding anniversary when we were there and we were surprised when we were presented with a lovely bottle of Asti served on a silver tray with accompanying ice bucket and lovely glasses. Our daughter told us on our return that she had asked the hotel to organise this for us and that they had insisted they would do so free of charge! Breakfast in the morning was continental and included cereal, juices, croissants, Danish and other types of pastry, different breads, cold meats, cheeses and fruit. While it is served in the breakfast room, my husband encountered no difficulties whatsoever obtaining a tray to bring me breakfast in bed on a particularly lazy morning. The cappuccino was also delicious! We booked the hotel directly with them and received a special rate as we were willing to pay in cash rather than credit card. Other “cheap” booking sites had said that there was no availability at the time of booking so it is worthwhile contacting the hotel directly and the rate was in fact cheaper than that offered elsewhere. Rome is definitely one of my favourite places to visit and Residenza Cellini now ranks as one of, if not my most favourite hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Met my expectations”
Reviews.Author: AlexanderG
Reviews.Content: I have chosen the hotel based on the reviews on TripAdvisor and I can only confirm what has been already said. Good location: 1) close to Railway station (Termini) that gives excellent opportunities for easy arrival from Fiumicino airport and 1-day visits to other cities. 2) good for sightseeing in Rome - 2-3 mins from the metro station and 15-20 minutes on walking distance from all the major attractions. Beautiful and clean rooms in classical roman style. Excelent family-like service To conclude - very good for the price in off-season. For summer - probably a bit overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Bed & Breakfast with a little extra.”
Reviews.Author: mylesb
Reviews.Content: Good Points Hotel Vgood Room number 5 People were very friendly on the desk. Very centrally located Room was good. Great Jacuzzi. Lovely balcony. Nice décor and fresh flowers in the room. Bad Points King size bed is actually two single best pushed together. Entrance is a little hard to find and does not look the best. Limo transfer is not an Irish limo it’s a normal merc taxi. Overall the Hotel or ‘residence’ was very good. The food in Rome was a little disappointing. Also the people were not very friendly and we always got the impression that we were being ripped off. As for the famous pick pockets around the Trevi fountain I think the Italians could go a long way to improving the experience by clearing all these undesirable away from the place. Good Irish Pub called Scholars though ask for Declan.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Indeed”
Reviews.Author: KLNorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: Found Residenza Cellini through TripAdvisor. We were not disappointed. Rooms were excellent, service excellent, location excellent. It is a small, intimate property, so if you are looking for large public rooms with lots of people watching, this isn't it, but if you want a very comfortable stay in Rome with accessibilty to everything, personal service, and privacy, you can't do much better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Cellini”
Reviews.Author: CBaier
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend the Residenza Cellini to anyone looking for central accommodations in Rome. Barbara and the rest of the staff were amazing. My wife and I spent the last 4 days of a 2-week Italian vacation at Residenza Cellini over the '06/'07 winter holidays. Our hotels in Venice and Florence had been nice, but felt more like efficiency rooms than the comfort provided by the Residenza Cellini. For the same price we had paid elsewhere, our room was much larger, had a king-size bed, satellite TV, a beautiful bathroom, was impeccably clean, and adorned by live, fresh orchids. Beyond the physical aspects of the room, I can not overstate the terrific service we received. One day my wife and I returned from visiting the Vatican and the staff had voluntarily brought a tray of red wine glasses and tableware into our room because they saw we had stopped at a local market the day before to pick up a light, stay-at-home dinner. It really helped to turn a simple night into a fun, romantic treat we will not forget.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: ntlane
Reviews.Content: I really loved this hotel. I adored everyone that worked there. They're so wonderful and they add a special touch of kindness and charm to everything they do. They would be happy to accomodate any request! The location was perfect. The rooms were spotless and large. The lobby / breakfast suite were warm and accomodating with a fantastic breakfast spread. The free internet was great. I don't remember the last time I stayed at a hotel that I liked as much as this one!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best”
Reviews.Author: Dubhain
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Residenza Cellini in Rome with my mum and sister for four nights in December, having read the reviews on Trip Advisor. The place is excellent. Admittedly it is a little hard to find in that this hotel is part of a building, which it shares with other hotels and language schools. Don't let this put you off. The location is fantastic only a stones throw from Republica Metro stop and a short walk from Termini train station. When we arrived the lady at reception gave us a huge amount of information i.e. recommendation of local restaurants, opening times of mueseums, which buses, trams to use. The breakfast in the morning was lovely typical continental style breakfast. My sister and I have gluten free diets which we informed the hotel on booking and on arrival we were given an array of tasty gluten free crackers, biscuits and buns. They also provided us with a kettle in our room when we requested it, so that we could make tea coffee when we liked. There were always clean cups and a variety of teas available in our room also. If you are debating whether to book this hotel, then my advice is book it, you wont regret it. The weather was fabulous while we were there and I would recommend people go and see Rome in the quieter off peak season. We bought the weekly transport ticket which was invaluable, however if you like comfort then taxis are relatively cheap especially if you are sharing with three or four people. Be careful at pedestrian crossings. They don't operate the same in Italy as they do in Ireland and the UK. Bring comfortable shoes, you will do alot of walking. Rome is beautiful, the Residenza Cellini just makes the experience that bit more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: babyboo999
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a great deal for where it was in Rome, it was in walking distance to most major site in Italy and was very safe...It would seem to most Americans to be a bed and breakfast type of set up.... We came rom FLorence and we got to the hotel through a Eurostar termini which was about a quarter of a mile away, without luggage this was not so far but with luggage it was pain in the butt! The streets are full of cobblestones and signs a bit difficult to follow...Do yourself a favor anf just take a cab if you are coming from the Termini... This hotel was in the RIck Steves book so lots of people call for it many month in advance from their stay, the hotel responds very promptly... Once you arrive at the hotel there is a very small elevator that you need to get in and out of to get to the Residenzia which is on the third floor..( as I remember)... The elevator was tempermental.... They are very secue at the hotel and there is always someone at the front desk..WHen you leave, they ask you to leave your key in case they need to clean your room..which I felt weird about at first but it was fine.. The rooms are anice size but are two twin beds pushed together and my husband and I got got tired of that crease.... The bathrooms ar enice..Towel warmers broken but the offered us a free bottle of champagne... It was Martini and Ross.. WHich was nice with some almond cookies I hated.. But it was a nice gesture.. There is no view from the room and a little bit hard to find on our own... The front desk which is Georges and two girls were nice but the would not always communicate with each other about our needs for the reservations to certain museums and as a result we did not get to the Accademia Galleria and another... You need to make sure you check up on them because they change shifts and different museums are closed on weird days and although they will make the reservation for you... You need to make sure that the days you are there do not overlap with the days they are open.... The room was cleaned daily and there was a really nice LCD television but he decor was tasteful and the room was immaculately clean... The breakfast was the same as all the other hotels we went to in italy, some emat and cheeses with breab, juices, coffee, and cereal... We got tired of that by then and just went out because it was our seven day in Italy...All the hotels we stayyed in supplied breakfasts... Overall well priced....for the area your are in..there is lots of shooping nearby.... The best Gelato was at Gellateria....We tried some thing in the RIck Steves book that the front desk let us borrow..they weren't all winners....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Res. Cellini !”
Reviews.Author: ParisNovis
Reviews.Content: Thank-you Tripadvisor for yet another Gem! We booked direct with this family run 6 room residence. The contact was fast and efficient. The hotel offered airport transfers for 4 of us for 55euro. The driver was waiting with a sign at the airport (and our flight was delayed). Brand new comfey 8 seater to ourselves. We arrived at the hotel at 1.30am - very hungry. Peter the night desk clerk was lovely. Checked us in and then prepared us silver trays with plates of ham, cheese and rolls and lg bottles of mineral water. Truly above and beyond the call of duty. We were well impressed! The service throughout was friendly. They made a restaurant booking for us at 'Ristorante Del Giglio' just around the corner and the meal was superb (160euro for 4 incl wine). The hotel was absolutely spotless. Actually the cleanest I've ever stayed in. Our Junior suite was spacious and comfortable. The Hotel location was in walking distance of virtually all sights and close to great shopping. When (not if) we return to Rome, our trip will be booked around availability at this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I feel sorry for Audrey Hepburn”
Reviews.Author: Bluester
Reviews.Content: I took my Husband to Rome for 3 nights for his Birthday in October. After reading all of the rave reviews about this hotel I e-mailed them for a price. The response was quick, detailed and so friendly i booked up right away. We had a Junior suite which was spacious and beautifully decorated. There were lovely touches such as flowers in the room. They also gave us a free bottle of sparkling wine to celebrate my Husbands Birthday. Even this was served on a silver platter with nibbles and a proper champagne bucket!! The hotel receommnded and booked Giglios for us which was fabulous. The food was fantastic and the service was faultless. When you first arrive they pour you a glass of prosecco (sparkling wine) which was lovely. We both had a pasta entree and a steak. My Husband gave up at this point as he was so full. (The waiter came back to the table to ask if the steak had been ok as the chef was concerend that he had not finished it!) I on the other hand managed a home made tartufo........yum. We adored Rome. The sights, the food, the people. It was all great. I would recommend that you are selective about the sights you go to see. It would be a shame to spend your whole holiday queing with hundreds of other tourists. The better way to enjoy Rome is to launch yourself into the Roman way of living. Enjoy the lovely restaurants and bars and try a bit of italian. We met some great people. We will be going back next year and of course will be staying at the Residenza Cellini.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cturkeyhollow
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our first trip to Rome and what a wonderful time we had! Our stay at Residenza Cellini was everything we had hoped for and all we had read about it was true! The room was small, but very clean and comfortable. The staff was fantastic and friendly, very helpful and the breakfast every day was wonderful! We loved the lift up to the rooms! The location was great and at night we left the windows open and listened to the bustle of the street below and a violin off somewhere...we felt so 'Roman"! They gave us Champagne on our last night! The gentleman who works the night shift even gave us a personal escort to Ostia Antica, a maze of metro stops, and delivered us right at the gate! Everone was just so nice! I highly recommend this small hotel and would absolutely stay there again if we are lucky enough to return! They deserve their #1 TripAdvisor rating! Thanks You, Residenza Cellini, for your part in making this trip such a pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “A gem of an hotel”
Reviews.Author: FungusGS
Reviews.Content: My Wife & I stayed at Residenza Cellini this last weekend as a romantic city break. It started badly, when we arrived in Rome to find that one of our two cases had never been loaded on the 'plane. Only toilet gear & undies in the one that arrived. The hotel staff took all the details from our "Lost Luggage" report & called daily to see if there was any news. They confirmed our reservation at Hostaria dell'Orso where we had booked a meal at for the Saturday night & checked their dress code (elegant....!) so we had an excuse to go shopping around the Via Condotti for something suitable to wear. The hotel staff were an absolute Godsend & assisted in any way they could. The room was beautifully appointed & had one of the most comfortble beds I've ever slept in. Nice touches like an orchid decorating the table, flat TV & lots of space. Like everyone else, we can't praise highly enough - if only all hotels were this good....

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: D&K911
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in January this year, taking two rooms for our family of four. When he returned the passports to us after checking in, the owner said he noticed that our son would be having his 21st birthday while we were at the hotel and he offered to give us a bottle of champagne to celebrate on that day. As promised, late afternoon on the birthday, they provided a bottle of champagne and tasty snacks in the hotel's breakfast room. One of the owners sat with us for about an hour while we drank and engaged in good conversation. If you need the endless number of services that you get in a big impersonal hotel with a grand lobby, this hotel is not for you. But if you want wonderful rooms and personal service, we can't imagine a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “happy to see they made it to 1st place”
Reviews.Author: zsuzsanna22
Reviews.Content: When my husband and I discovered the Residenza Cellini on Trip Advisor last year, it was in the #2 spot. Even so, based on the effusively wonderful reviews, we decided that it would be the best place for us to spend our week in Rome over the Thanksgiving holiday. I am very remiss in waiting so long to write this review, but I am very happy to see, though not at all surprised, that the Cellini has made it to #1. As so many other reviewers have so eloquently stated, this place is absolutely deserving of all of the praise. We are world travellers, going somewhere different 1-2 times every year. We are also very particular and discerning about the places we choose to stay, preferring small boutique hotels with good services and warm, helpful staff. We have found many places around the world that satisfy our criteria. The Residenza Cellini, however, is far and away the best in that category. We could not have been happier with the warmth of the staff or the extreme quality of the service. Congratulations to Barbara, her siblings and staff for continuing to run such a truly wonderful establishment. We wouldn't think of staying anywhere else in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, Comfortable, Friendly, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: HLinkowich
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our vacation in Italy and we had a wonderful stay at the Residenza Cellini. We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights and were so thankful for the location. The hotel is within walking distance to the main Rome Termini so we didn't have to drag our luggage on the subway. We took the subway everywhere which was very convenient. The room was beautiful and the breakfast was so nice. Peter who serves breakfast was so friendly and helpful. The last day, we left for Florence after our check out time and the hotel gladly let us keep our luggage in the hotel. When we returned to pick up our luggage to go to the train station, I received a message from my parents wishing me a happy birthday. Donato found out while we were there and offered us a bottle of champagne. This was so generous and topped off our stay in Rome. The only slight downside is the noise level which is just street noise. In general, I don't think you can get quieter at any other place in Rome. I'm just a light sleeper. By the way, we loved the antique elevator. What can you expect from a building that is hundreds of years old? Overall, our stay in Rome was absolutely wonderful at the Residenza Cellini!

Reviews.Title: “Great Apartment”
Reviews.Author: tbonesq
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 had a great time staying at Residenza Cellini's 3-bedroom apartment in Rome. Lovely place in an excellent location with easy access to just about all the major sites, including the Vatican, Pantheon, Roman Forum, Colloseum, Spanish Steps, Tivoli Fountain, Plaza Navona, shopping, etc. Very comfortable and reasonably spacious with beautiful wood floors. Nice bedding. Great Jacuzzi shower in immaculate bedroom. Safe neighborhood with police station nearby. Marvelous old-fashioned elevator. A true bargain! Only drawback is no breakfast at Residenza Cellini. Can't wait to visit again. Thanks, Barbara.

Reviews.Title: “I'm so glad I chose this place...”
Reviews.Author: Aussie11
Reviews.Content: Having struggled with the choice between a "proper hotel" and what is really a B and B, I have to stay that I cannot imagine that we would have been any happier and we DEFINITELY wouldn't have been better looked after anywhere else in Rome. When we arrived, the entrance and the lift were a bit worrying, but once we got in and met Barbara de Paolis and then saw our room we were very happy. We stayed in a Junior Suite for seven nights, the room was huge for Europe, and elegantly decorated. Everything was very clean. The absolute wonder of staying there was Pietro. His level of service was incomparable. I got very sick while I was in Rome and he liaised with the medical services, went out at 3 in the morning to the pharmacy to get me what they prescribed, called me again at the 3 the next morning to make sure I didn't miss taking the next dose, all with genuine concern. If you've ever travelled and gotten sick while in a country where you don't speak the language, you can appreciate what this meant. In addition, he made the best cappucino I had in Italy! Thank you Pietro, you were wonderful. When we were choosing where to stay, my husband said he wanted to stay in the place with the best service, price not an issue. I read all the reviews for a huge range of places in Rome and decided not to opt for the grand ritzy places, and go with what the reviewers said about this place's level of service instead. I am now another very happy past guest at the Cellini.

Reviews.Title: “Best B & B in Europe?”
Reviews.Author: timbo1terror
Reviews.Content: Booked at the Cellini after reading reviews by fellow Trip Advisors. We were not disappointed. At first it is a little unusual as the property is actually on the 3rd floor of 5 via Modena. It is accessed via the large door on the street level. The street is a 'back street' which runs parallel with Via National' and the street isn’t the nicest you've ever seen, but it is down town in a 2000 year old city! You ring up to Cellini via an intercom and by virtue of the fact that it is on level 3 there is no one at the front door so to speak. However once you travel up to level 3 via the tiny wee elevator which has been inserted in the stair well, the welcome could not be warmer. In a word 'awesome'. We stayed in room 5 or 6 (I think?) It was a junior suite. Special cash rate was offered and was a very fair price for the room. The room was really large for accommodation in Rome. The standard of cleanliness was excellent. The room was equipped with lovely classic furniture and was very well presented. The bathroom was large and included a Jacuzzi bathtub. Towels were white, fluffy and fresh. TV was great with full cable and a plethora of channels including bbc and cnn as well as sports channels. The room had excellent A/C and a mini bar and a small safe for valuables etc. It was really quiet too. The people who own the business and those who worked there all had great people skills and a real sense of pride about their place, and so they should. From what we have seen in 5 trips to Europe it is one of the best if not the best place we have stayed in terms of value, friendliness, proximity and cleanliness. The staff were so lovely and helpful, they could not have made my wife and I feel more at home and welcome. Peter and George are both really generous souls. They were so accommodating and nothing was too much trouble. We certainly felt that they were totally trustworthy. The family who run the business were fantastic with care and attention to every detail and were more than happy to chat about life in general, travel etc, etc. I really love Rome as a city to visit as it is so vibrant and there is a coolness about Romans and 2000 years of history which you can touch and see. We will be back for sure and Cellini will be where we will stay. It is the perfect home away from home and oasis. A word of warning - get an official taxi if you come via the Termini (train station). The Cellini is only about .75 of a kilometer from the station, but if you have bags you will probably want a cab. The ride should only cost 10 - 12 euro - not the 20 we paid on arrival via a 'private' operator.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: cedarville1
Reviews.Content: We were a little worried when our cab pulled up in front of the building(after charging us $20 for a very short ride from the main train terminal). We had to ring up to the hotel desk on the third floor before we could enter. There is a very old elevator or stairs so we did not know what to expect but once we entered the hotel which only has six rooms we were very pleased. The owners are wonderful and you feel like you are guests in a private home. The room was small but very nice and a good size bathroom with a jacuzzi tub. We had a triple and the beds were firm but comfortable. Breakfast was served in a small dining area and was nice. Great coffee! Our group had three of the six rooms and all of the other guests at that time were all form the U.S. Rome is a big city and it was very hot! Our air conditioning was great! It was a good location but still a long walk to most of the sights. If I go back I would stay in this hotel but I liked Rome the least of all the areas we visited but you need to visit one time! Great staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Nabokov
Reviews.Content: I booked two nights in this hotel for my wife and I for our honeymoon after reading the rave reviews on this site and was not disappointed. The location is superb, the rooms are lovely, and the staff were incredibly helpful. Little touches like free internet for guests, a great breakfast spread, and a complimentary bottle of prosecco when they found out it was our honeymoon were very much appreciated. This is a fantastic oasis to use as a base for exploring Rome, within walking distance to many tourist attractions (Colisseum, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Forum, etc), and I would recommend it to almost anyone - it's was the most expensive hotel we stayed at in Europe, but worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in Rome”
Reviews.Author: John-Simon
Reviews.Content: This place is a wonderful oasis in the chaos that is Rome. It is well positioned near to the main station, underground trains, and major sites. The staff were wonderful - friendly and always keen to assist with advice and reservations. The night porter, Pietro, is a real gem. Our room was comfortable and quiet, althought the airconditioning did struggle a bit in the heatwave. Breakfast was great, and with only six rooms, it is a friendly environment. We will definately stay there again if we ever visit Rome in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Residenza Cellini - Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: morgana22
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel! A quiet haven. Staff went out of their way to help with advice on where to go and where to eat. We had a junior suite which was simply wonderful. Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Rome on two other occasions and was sorry I hadn't heard of the Cellini before this trip. We had wonderful rooms so conveniently located from the main train station. I wouldn't have thought that staying near the station would find us such a lovely hotel. There are only about 6 rooms, and each one is decorated just exquisitely, clean, roomy and cheerful. Our bathroom had a window too. There is a charming little breakfast room with a very nice elderly gentleman who assists you with your coffee and the buffet is quite nice. The staff recommended wonderful places to eat in the neighborhood which I highly recommend, the Giglio across from the Opera. I highly recommend this hotel, only hope it's available when I want to go to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend this Stunning Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Quenzette
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (26/29 yrs old) stayed at Residenza Cellini from Saturday, June 10-Monday, June 12 and again Friday, June 16- Saturday, June 17. We very much enjoyed our stay here! Before we even came to Rome, the hotel responded to all of my e-mails quickly and efficiently. They made dinner reservations for my husband and I to Vineria il Chianti ([--]) which was great!! The hotel arranged a “limo transfer” for us from the airport to the hotel (and vice versa) for 50,00 euro each time. We are very glad we chose to take this car transfer. Upon arrival to the hotel, we were greeted with the sweet smell of fresh cut lilies near the front desk. Absolutely lovely! Peter greeted us and allowed us to store our luggage since it was 8:00 am and our rooms were not ready yet. He made us divine cappucino’s and we enjoyed the breakfast spread which consisted of croissants, sweet rolls (similar to “Hawaiian bread”), slices of ham and swiss cheese, cookies, yogurt, fruit, small toast crackers with flavored cream cheese spreads (my favorite!!) and orange juice and water. Yummy!! After exploring Rome, we came back to find our suitcases placed in our room for us. The #6 room was cool (they had turned the air conditioning down for us) which was a delight!! At night, the room was dark and quiet and we slept very well. Though the bed was hard, and the pillows flatter than we are used to, this seems to be the standard in Europe. Barbara and Francesca were both super sweet and gave us great recommendations of places to eat and visit! The customer service at this hotel is over and above average and made our stay superb! When we left the hotel on the 12th to visit other parts of Italy, the hotel agreed to keep 1 of our large suitcases in their storage room which was very nice. When we came back on the 16th, the suitcase was waiting for us in our new #1 room. We had the Rick Steve’s discount at this hotel, which was 165,00 euro per night. We would highly recommend this 6-room hotel to anyone visiting Rome! Absolutely gorgeous and comfortable and clean and professionally run. Thank you Residenza Cellini for making our stay so wonderful!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and great location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Centrally located in a quiet street two blocks away from Piazza della Republica, near the Metro, train station, major bus lines, and great shopping along Via Nazionale. The hotel is family owned, you will enjoy talking to brothers Donato and Gaetano. Our room had orchids, nice bathroom, and very comfortable bed. The hotel is beautifully decorated with art and flowers. It was a great place to conclude our two week vacation in Italia. We will return here in our future trips to Roma. Strongly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Ladybell
Reviews.Content: It’s taken a while for me to write this up – and I apologize profusely for that to the De Paolis family (who own and run the hotel) because my stay at Residenza Cellini was absolutely marvelous. The Residenza Cellini really is what one imagines it would be like to be staying at a mansion in town. There’s a real sense of the personal and the luxurious. The De Paolis family are all so kind, so helpful, so eager to be sure you are well taken care of and able to enjoy visiting the city. I cannot thank them enough, especially Barbara for all the thoughtfulness and assitance. I was in Rome with my niece to celebrate her 16th birthday. She actually turned 16 while we were there and Babara De Paolis suggested a little surprise. The evening of Allie's birthday, before we left for dinner, Barbara appeared at the door with champagne! (At 16 it’s legal to drink in Italy). It was so kind of Barbara to do that and Allie was thrilled to be treated in such a grown-up way. Our room was one of the smaller ones yet very comfortable, with twin beds, desk, chairs, table, armoire and windows. The bathroom (as everything else) was immaculate, totally modern and beautiful and had a big window (but done in such a way that there was no privacy problem). One more thing, I don’t know if anyone else has mentioned this but Residenze Cellini makes the best capuccino I have ever tasted. It will spoil you forever.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed all expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Residenza Cellini for 10 nights on our first trip to Italy and loved it. The staff was completely focused on making us feel comfortable and very helpful with reservations at museums and restaurant recommendations. Everyone speaks English and they use email well. They have an endless supply of color maps at the front desk and directed us to sights, wine stores, glass shops, you name it. There are only 6 rooms so you meet the other guests (all American during our stay) during breakfast. Breakfast includes prosciutto and other cold cuts, pastries, yogurt, cereal, juice, and a wonderful cappucino made by Peter (tell him very hot, Italians drink their coffee luke warm). He will also make you a pot of American coffee if you like. We borrowed an iron one night and were pleased to use a real Rowenta steam iron instead of the cheap black & decker with tar on the heating plate you usually find at hotels. We bought wine at the local grocery and the hotel provided us with two wine glasses and a corkscrew on a silver platter. The rooms are clean and comfortable. We were thrilled that our room was ready when we arrived at 11 AM after 17 hours of traveling. The hotel we stayed at in Florence made us wait until 2 to check in. I forgot that Friday - Sunday are one banking day and ran out of money until 9 PM on Monday night (2pm at my local bank). I asked the front desk if the local grocery store took credit cards and explained my situation. They said the store did take credit cards and also insisted on loaning me 40 euros until the atm started working again. The hotel is located in a building just off via nazionale and 200 steps from the subway. There are several other hotels in the same building and all use the same quaint elevator in the center of the main stairs. Our room, #6, was very quiet and overlooked a central courtyard. The worst noise we had during our stay was a strange bird that would caw in the mornings. We think it was a seagull. Despite the proximity to nazionale there is no traffic noise. The big plus here is the staff. They are very interested and available as there are only 5 other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Residenza Cellini is top notch”
Reviews.Author: jjapples
Reviews.Content: It's no wonder that Residenza Cellini remains on the top of the list of hotels in Rome. The two owners, brothers Donato and Gaitaino, keep this one floor 6 room hotel in sparkling condition. From the marble floors in the hallway to the beautiful wood floors in the rooms, everything is spotless. The location is on a quiet side street only a block from restaurants, buses, and the metro. They and their staff are more than helpful in anything you might need. I would go back to Rome just to stay in this hotel again....Joe A...Cape Cod

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Service!”
Reviews.Author: atirella23
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Apartment through the hotel. Danny was a great host, he provided maps and suggestions on places to see and how to go about seeing them. It was like having a personal concierge. The apartment was incredibly luxurious and for the price there is no way it could be beat especially for 6 people. When I go back to Rome I will definately stay at the Cellini there is just no comparison!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: cuteone
Reviews.Content: My daughter, niece and I stayed at this hote April 22 -25, 2006. I booked my reservations after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. This hotel was a great value in Rome in a very convenient location. We walked from Termini train station with our luggage. It took us about ten minuites and a taxi wanted to charges us 30,00 Euro. There is a subway station within 5 minuites from the hotel. You can walk to about everything and when it is late at night and you are tired of walking and the subway is closed you can look for any bus with Termini on it and get back to this hotel very quickly. There is plenty of shopping and resturants nearby. We could not have asked for a better location. This hotel is located on a side street and is very quiet. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. They confirmed our flights, gave us great directions and maps, and recommended excellent resturants. Our room was lovely, and large enough to accomodate all three of us. If I ever go back to Rome I will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Staying here is like staying with local friends in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RC for 4 nights during the week of April 17. We found the room to be very comfortable for 3 people. The staff was very helpful with all requests, especially arranging reservations for museums and attractions in advance of our visit. We did not wait in any lines in Rome because of their helpful recommendations and advance preparation. It was as if we were staying in the home of good friends instead of a hotel. My son said it best - "they made me feel special". Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: maddiejane
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to Italy and after staying in 4 different hotels I would probably rate this one 4/5. To be honest I was not completely impressed with the furniture and decor of the room at first. It looked a little dated but was fine. It surprised me how small the place was (one floor in an office type building). It was close to the train which was good, but a good walk to the popular sites. It also is confusing to get around Rome and we got turned around easily (could be just me). The staff was beyond helpful and for whatever was lacking they made up for. The bathroom was clean and modern and the breakfast was also good. Staff was very good at making calls for taxis or giving directions. The staff definitely makes this place. Another plus, at night it is almost silent! We slept with our window open and even though there are things nearby, I didn't hear anything. I learned this is a big plus in Florence when I stayed at the LOUD Globus Hotel. I will say that I heard our neighbors in the morning through the walls quite easily, but no big deal. Also be prepared for a small very old elevator... kind of fun once we were used to it. In summary Plus staff, size of the rooms, quiet!, near Termini, breakfast, internet access, very clean Not so Plus a little far off, somewhat dated type furnishings

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed this graceful,helpful,peaceful place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just enjoyed a three night stay at Hotel Cellini. The hotel has that 'something special' and the rooms are lovely and comfortable,after a day of sightseeing it was a pleasure to come back to the hotel. The staff could not have been more attentive and pleasant. I have dietry problems and can't eat wheat, but every effort was made to make sure I could still enjoy a lovely breakfast, and as it was our anniversary we were given a bottle of champagne! Will be recommending this treasure to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Another vote for Residenza Cellini”
Reviews.Author: pennpal
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I just returned from a six night stay and it was perfect for us. As its name implies, the Residenza Cellini should be thought of as an inn or high end B&B rather than a hotel. It is a great choice if you are looking for a comfortable, soothing place to stay in Rome. The first three days we walked almost everywhere. But when it dawned on us that a Metro stop and several bus lines are right around the corner, we opted for those nearer the end of our stay. I would post pictures, but there really is no need to. The photos on the Cellini’s website accurately represent the accommodations. The junior suite is a well sized room that contains a day bed that can be used by a third person. Bathrooms have marble sinks, Jacuzzis and excellent water pressure. But the best thing is the warm, personal attention you get from the De Paolis family and the staff. They were all delightful and ready to assist in any way we requested. All communications were accomplished via email and went off without a hitch. We used their vendor for airport transfers and had late model Mercedes cars both ways that were very comfortable. In short, our stay confirmed the rave reviews on Trip Advisor which led me to the Cellini.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Alsafa
Reviews.Content: We chose Residenca Cellini because of the reviews here on Tripadvisor. It did not get off to a good start, as the pre booked Limo despite repeated telephone calls to the Hotel was nearly 1hr late. and it was not what I would call a Limo,more of a shabby chic 1982 Merc estate with a rumbling wheel bearing. We took the train back to the airport! Don't be put off by the back street shared entrance to the Hotel building as the reception on the third floor is welcoming. Our Junior suite was very clean and well appointed. The service from the staff was excellant and genuine and this more than made up for the out sourced shabby Limo service. The Hotel make little play of the room service which is very good. They do not charge over the odds for this service which is valuable as there is no bar There help in restaurant recommendations and booking tables was excellant.Try Clemente alla Maddalena for that special dinner A great in exspensive Hotel (up market B&B) to base your visit to Rome from. Would reccomend as a good choice and would stay here again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: gingerholly
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I had the pleasure of staying at the Residenza Cellini for 4 wonderful nights. We arrived by train from Florence and it was a very short stroll from the station. Trains, buses and Metro are all convenient to the hotel. It also proved to be a great location for walking to sights and our late night returns were no problem given its safe location and surroundings. The staff was extremely cordial, helpful and informative. The rooms are gorgeous and breakfast is great. I really can't imagine better accomodations at any price for a visit to Rome. We will definitely return. One note of caution: If you are tall, watch your head on the front door when returning at night. Got me every time!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Apartment!!”
Reviews.Author: WannaBthere
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with our daughter, who was attending school in France, traveled to Rome right after the new year. The Residenza Cellini was completely booked up, so we were offered the apartment. It was great and we would stay there again in a heartbeat. The owners of the hotel take excellent care of you and go out of their way to make you feel at home and also make sure you know where you are going and what your options are for touring the city and eating at great restaurants. There is a fantastic pizza place right across the street that Donato recommended and we ended up grabing a slice of pizza a couple of times for lunch. All the sights to see are close by and most within walking distance. It was wonderful to stay as a family in the 3 bedroom, 1 1/2 bath apartment. It was beautiful with wood floors and large bedrooms. I would highly recommend this hotel/apartment to anyone traveling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “The Cellini is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Four of us spent three nights at the Cellini. Each couple was treated to an immaculately clean room, with an equally clean and well equipped bathroom. The hotel is quiet, intimate and centrally located. Lovely orchards were part of the restful decor. We also enjoyed the classical music which played subtlely in the common areas. The truly outstanding part of our experience was the warm and friendly staff. Unlike any we came across during our entire visit to Italy. Dealing with tourists day in and out is not easy, yet the Cellini's staff was kind, patient and helpful at every opportunity. We felt both comfortable and welcome. We can't speak highly enough about our experience. at the Cellini. Don't miss out on the experience.

Reviews.Title: “A True Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights over Valentines Day and we were certainly not disapointed firstly the staff were so friendly, the room was perfect, authentic and extremly clean, the location brilliant you need not look any further for a hotel in Rome, the only down side is after you have read the reviews you will want to stay there as well and next time we go it will be fully booked, oh well

Reviews.Title: “Angels and Cellini”
Reviews.Author: Cambridge wanderer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just got back from a long weekend in Rome staying at the Residenza Cellini. It is indeed very good; extremely clean with delightful staff. Only two grumbles, our room (no.2) was on the street side of the hotel and noisy at night, and breakfast is dull and disappointing. But everything else could not have been better. The location is so perfect you'll walk miles (we reckon we walked over thirty in three days) because you won't need to get the metro. When you do return, footsore and weary, a pot of tea is only a request away and there is abundant hot water for long soaks in the jacuzzi. We left only one morning for the Vatican and Angel Tours came up trumps. We were in a group of four, our guide Liz was bright, well-informed and excellent at knowing when to talk and when to be silent. The three hours sped by and we could never have used the time so well without her help. So we also highly recommend Angel Tours.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well having read extensive reviews of this hotel on tripadvisor, I was expecting all hype and no substance. Needless to say that this was one of the best hotels that we have stayed at. The decor was marvellous and the customer service was excellent. We went for a long weekend in celebration of my girlfriend's birthday and the hotel even upgraded us to a different suite at no extra charge because of a prior guest cancellation. I cannot recommend this establishment enough! Tony & Sarah

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Apartment and Service!”
Reviews.Author: GenevieveCS
Reviews.Content: They must now have two apartments to rent, which I believe are in the same building near the Piazza Cavour. Our family of five stayed for 6 nights (12/18-24, 2005) before Christmas this year, and EVERYTHING was wonderful. The apartment we stayed in had 2 very large bedrooms and 1 bathroom. Everything was very nicely appointed, but the bathroom was especially gorgeous... marble everywhere with a huge tub with jets and shower. It had a dining room and living room as well as a table in the kitchen. The location was also very good as we were able to get everywhere we needed to go in a very short amount of time by either walking, bus or taxi. The staff especially Gaetano and Donato were extremely helpful especially when we couldn't figure out how to get the spin cycle to start and the washing machine open! Yes, we are stupid Americans... They also arranged a van from the airport for us, which worked out very well. We would stay in this apartment again in a heartbeat. For us, the price was essentially the same as for 2-3 hotel rooms, so it was even better! If you stay in the apartment, there is a wonderful coffee shop/restaurant with the most wonderful coffees and baked goods (croissants, sweets, sandwishes, etc.) as well as a great sit-down buffet type meal. We never saw another American in there. (From the apartment, walk toward the Tiber River then turn right and go two short blocks. It is on the corner across from the entrance to Ponte Cavour bridge.)

Reviews.Title: “Rented the Apartment”
Reviews.Author: UtahNative
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 spent Christmas in Rome and stayed at the Apartment Cellini. This was a great choice. The apartment was very large and a great location, 2 very large bedrooms, 1 small bedroom, dining room and kitchen 1½ baths. The owner did everything for us to make our Christmas break wonderful. When we got to the apartment a small Christmas tree was setup. This is just the beginning of the great way the owners treated us during our stay. Also in the apartment were cookies and breakfast for us; wonderful choice would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but oversold here on TripAdvisor”
Reviews.Author: schooners3
Reviews.Content: We booked the Residenza Cellini based on the overwhelmingly positive feedback on this site, and it wound up being our first disappointment with TripAdvisor reviews. This location has maintained a #2 rating for Rome Hotels for much of the 2nd half of 2005, and we honestly can't see how this can be #2 in all of Rome. The RC is a nice bed and breakfast. Yes, the staff is friendly (Peter especially), the cappucinos are wonderful, the rooms are very clean, and it was certainly of help to have their computer available to check E-mails, etc. There is however little room to move within the room (we had the Jr. Suite), the beds are hard, the bed linens and towels are on par with a Holiday Inn, there is no sign of 24 hour room service availability, and all-in-all these are not inviting attributes when you've come back from a long day of sightseeing. Additionally, while the staff makes every effort to be of assistance to you, they are so shy that you hesitate to ask and when you do, you almost want to apologize for having asked. Our reservation was for a week, and yes I would have moved to another location if I hadn't already allocated our budget to other activities/tours that week - during which we had an excellent time. Do be certain to investigate other recommendations and locations in Rome before reserving here.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here and you'll be happy you did”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We can't recommend this hotel more. 6 beautiful and pristine rooms. Walking distance to all the main sights - Colosseum (10 mins), Spanish Steps (10 mins), Pantheon (10 mins) and all the beautiful little lanes that make Rome so unique. We emailed in advance and told them it was my birthday and not only did they upgrade us to a suite (and by the way, this means you get a jacuzzi bath and a slightly bigger room - but you'll be very happy in the doubles too) but on our second night they brought us in a bottle of beautiful local wine to celebrate with. This hotel made our stay truly special. If you want somewhere special, small, quiet, safe and walking distance to everywhere this is the place. And email them in advance if you want help with restaurant bookings. They'll help with anything to make your stay more comfortable. Rome is beautiful. This hotel is personal and unique. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “a little piece of paradise”
Reviews.Author: netta5
Reviews.Content: this tiny hotel is on the third floor of an apartment building on a tiny narrow street close to several main bus routes and a metro station and some wonderful restaurants. You enter an ancient elevator, the type you see in old movies, and ascend swiftly. There is always a smiling person to greet you and hand you your room key on a huge tassel. You walk down the hallway, newly painted with lovely pictures hanging. Opera is playing and there are orchids and gorgeous pot plants and a huge vase of flowers. Our room was quite small but comfortable and we were warm and cosy and everything worked. Good lighting, modern electricity, hot water, fabulous bathroom, plenty of hangers in the closet...and an orchid in a pot on the table. breakfast was a treat-cappuccino and wonderful hot chocolate made for us and a buffet of cereal, youghurts, rolls, jams, cream cheese and the most divine pastries fresh from the baker. This is a family run hotel and all the family members were gorgeous, helpful and kind. They spoke good english and recommended great restaurants. we would return again and again to this wonderful peaceful place. check it out.

Reviews.Title: “ask about their apartments”
Reviews.Author: thurley
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling in a group of 3 or more, be sure to ask the hotel about their apartments. We stayed in one near Piazza Cavour, and would highly recommend it to anyone. It was very clean, tastefully decorated, spacious, and the beds were very comfortable. Our family was able to "spread out' and not be cramped together in one or two rooms. It was priced very well, considering how many people we had...5 then later 6. The hotel owners were very gracious in helping us with anything we needed, and our kitchen was even stocked with food! We were very impressed with their property.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Clabbyroad
Reviews.Content: This small hotel on the third floor is wonderful. The staff go out of their way to help you,suggesting places to visit and even making telephone calls to obtaim tickets. With out their help we would not have known or seen Galleria Borghese or Ostia Antica.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Residenza Cellini completely exceeded all expectations! This is a beautiful qaint little hotel with staff who could not be more accomodating if they tried! The lovely Francesca is an invaluable member of their staff and I hope the proprietors realise what an asset they have in her! Our room was gorgeous! Spacious, clean, beautifully decorated and extremely quiet. The bathroom was lovely and a good size with a jacuzzi bath that was well used after much walking every day. The breakfasts were delicious with a good variety to choose from. The free access to the internet on their guests laptop was a wonderful resource to have when you are travelling. Thank you Donato and Francesca for a memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Donato is the man !! If you don't stay here....”
Reviews.Author: Leadinoff
Reviews.Content: You must be out of your mind !!!!! Short walk from the train station took us to this three story building on Via Modena. Jumping into a small lift on the first floor we really didn't know what to expect as we inched our way up. Once the lift door opened, Donato was there to meet us and from then on we were on Cloud Nine !! (American Expression for Wonderful Experience.) The Residenza Cellini is an immaculate (and I mean extremely immaculate) 6-room B&B type hotel. We stayed in Room # 1 which is very large with a view over Via Modena. Music and singing can be heard at night from the nearby restaurant on the corner. The shower is particularly cool because it has built in jets that hit you from all angles. The hardwood floor in the bedroom area and the tile floor in the bathrooms are so clean you can eat off of them !! As long as you are able to walk, and don't mind doing so, everything in Rome is within a fairly short distance from the Residenza Cellini. Only time we used a vehicle was to transport us to the Vatican for an early morning tour. From the Vatican we walked to the Coliseum area and then later in the early evening hours took the walk from Campo di Fiori to the Pantheon, by Trevi Fountain and back to the hotel. The great thing about walking Rome is that you can eat all the pasta, pizza and gelato you want and not worry about gaining weight !! Donato is at your service and will help you with any requests you may have. He spoiled us temendously and helped make our stay in Rome a very special wedding anniversary. If you are lucky enough to book a room here, you WILL NOT be dissapointed with your selection. Thank you Donato and happy fatherhood !! Michael and Carol Brazil San Francisco Bay Area

Reviews.Title: “Very different - but great”
Reviews.Author: ejcooper0
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Residenze Cellini for two nights Sept 16& 17/05. I guess we would call it a Bed & Breakfast. The actual building is like an apartment building with several little "hotels" on each floor. They are located about a 10-15 minute walk from the central train station which was very convenient as we took the train from Florence to Rome. There are six rooms, I believe, and there is always someone at the front desk to help with directions, restaurants, etc. They do a very cute little breakfast buffet and provide various coffees and teas. They were also kind enough to have available a laptop computer which we used to email. We were close to all transportation and walked to the Spanish steps, shopping, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Hotspot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this wonderful little family run hotel for 5 nights during our honeymoon in the first half of September. We were even given free fizzy wine and some biscuits on our second night because it was our honeymoon. The staff were always friendly and helpful (even ordering us a pizza to eat in our room one night). The rooms were clean, comfortable and spacious, with no noise worth mentioning (1 room we stayed in backed onto the courtyard and the other onto the small street the hotel is on). The breakfasts are like a small feast to start you on your day. As somebody else has already said, this hotel is an oasis amid the hectic chaos of Rome; its so nice knowing you can go back to this hotel after a day out in the city. It is about a minutes walk from an underground station and there are plenty of places to eat and shop nearby. The only problems we had were finding the place when we arrived at ten o'clock at night (you just have to look carefully at the buzzer labels because even some of the locals don't seem to know it is there) and we only found the minibar in the room on our last morning.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Sarlor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is superb. In the centre of Rome, a few minutes walk from the train station and within easy walking distance of all the main tourist sites. We had a suite which was well worth the extra money with it's Jacuzzi bath. The entire hotel is decorated very elegantly and the place is spotless. The staff are fantastic, friendly and helpful without being intrusive. I can't recommend this hotel enough as a tranquil escape from the busy streets of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: 2trvl
Reviews.Content: Tucked away, this little place one would totally miss because there is only a plaque there on the side of the building. (If one wants to find it, look for “Hotel Astoria” which is a lighted sign and it is in the same building.) We gain access and take a very small lift up to the third floor. It is a beautiful pensione, obviously from days gone past. Our room is quite nice, and for three people, not too cramped. It has a lovely bathroom, with a Jacuzzi tub and a big sink with counter and the ubiquitous European bidet. I wish I had listened concerning details about the room, but we left days later still unable to figure out what all the light switches were for. Nonetheless, jacuzzi was wonderful after a day of walking, location was perfect and not too far from train station and staff was helpful and friendly. If you like small and charming, look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel , superb big-hearted staff”
Reviews.Author: calinurse
Reviews.Content: Agree with all said in previous review. Great place. Lovely room. Looks exactly like web site! More like a B and B, with 6 rooms. Ours faced the front, and we never heard streetnoise AC is thankfully (Hot July) quite effective, windows are heavy enough to keep out noise. Excellent restaurant recommedations from Francesca and Barbara. Try the little pizzeria cati-cornered across the street for a delicous cheap lunch--7 euros for waaaayyy more delicous pizza than two of us could eat. And Coline Emiliano (?) restaurant--amazing tagliatelle bolognese in a city not known for Bologna's style cooking. (BTW, prepare yourself, travelers. There is graffiti everywhere in Rome. It was a bit of a shock, and offputting. Oh well... it is an Italian invention!!) Now, the service at Cellini. Mille grazie Barbara, Francesca, Signor Pietro, and excellent housekeeper (I unfortunately did not get her name). An example: one afternoon, I asked Francesca for a cup of tea to relieve a heat-induced headace, expecting a simple tea bag-hot water in a cup--which would have been fine. No!! In came a proper silver tea service, doilies, two cups, pot of tea, etc. A simple request became an event. That lovely tea, served with such kindness and grace, in a perfectly ac'd room, made for one of those special memories. Such genuine kindness, patience, caring, and courtesy is representative of every one in this hotel . Again, it is even more remarkable, as we did not find this to be the universal case in Rome. Location is excellent for reaching Galleria Borghese (the hotel will call to make your reservations--you'll need them) Via Veneto, the Cappuchin crypts, the famous church with Bellini sculpture of St Teresa. Some great shops (my teenager loved Rome shopping!) on Via Nazionale, and wonderful caffelatte at the Cafeteria Nazionale. I would not recommend a walk to the Vatican, but the hotel folks will tell you the safest bus line to reach it. And here's some great news....Barbara's brother Donato is opening a three room, remodeled, apartment near the Spanish steps!!! We had the Rick Steves' reader rate. Ask Barbara to tell you the story of how Rick found this wonderful little hotel (and how she didn't recognize him because he is so tall and was wearing a hat) and you'll be thankful he discovered it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Residenza Cellini lived up to expectations!”
Reviews.Author: eldercruser
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed three nights at the Residenza Cellini. It is well deserving of the high ratings it receives. We stayed in one of the junior suites. Excellent bed and bathroom. Morning breakfasts were just right. Friendly advice and assistance always available at the front desk. Discount for cash payment as advertised in Rick Steves books.

Reviews.Title: “quite oasis in a sea of chaos”
Reviews.Author: tickettoride
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days and enjoyed it . we had a quiet room overlooking a courtyard.The staff is extremely accomadating.If you want an elegant small place with personal service this is the place.They will keep your luggage ,let you check in early,give you advice or just chat..the breakfast is great and the computer is there for your use. This place's main problem it is so far from the sites you must take public transportation..and that can be hectic..also there was no tub in our room. with the euro the rate it is this place is a bit high but othere than that ..it's great!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful start to italy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Cellini was very good. The room was nice, bigger than I thought it would be and the bathroom was excellent and very updated. The staff(family) were so friendly and helpful and I loved the location. It is 2 blocks from the Republick Square where we found a beautiful fountain and ate at an outside resturant over-looking it. The area was not so crouded and touristy like at the Spanish Steps Etc. So if you like a more genuine feel, this place is perfecty situated. The hotel always came running with hotwater when I asked and even gave us a complimentary bottle of wine and glasses our last night there. The only downfall was that there wasn't any area to sit and relax outside of your room. All the other hotels that we stayed in later either had a terrace or sitting area. We really did miss that. Overall it is a wonderful place to stay. We even ran into Rick Steve's there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: Witchking
Reviews.Content: I booked this accomodation after reviews in various guide books and the internet including here, so I thought I should give my opinion back for once. I spent 5 nights there, returning on 6th May and had a really great time. Being very critical, I would say that rooms 1,2 & 3 suffer from street noise (lots of road sweepers, bin men and quite a lot of traffic sound (one night it sounded like a disco!)) and 1 & 2 can hear the reception clearly and the breakfast room. I'm a light sleeper and if I hadn't had ear plugs and been tired, I would have struggled to sleep. I would ask for rooms 5 or 6 if this bothers you. I also thought it was quite expensive to be honest and the breakfast got repetitive. Also the jacuzzi bath is a standard size and although it CAN fit two, its not the most comfortable thing :). Oh and it had no tea making facilities which might be normal in Italy, but seemed odd. That said, the service was terrific, they even gave us ice buckets and glasses when we brought some chilled wine back from a walk, with some little cakes because we had to wait a couple of minutes. The coffee was probably the best I had in Rome and their restaurant recommendations were great (and like I say, I'm very picky). The place was a little hard to find at first (its by the "hotel" light, but the name of another hotel is far clearer on the door) but its location was very good. We walked everywhere and could be at the vatican in 40 minutes. The jacuzzi was great to restore flagging muscles. So overall, fantastic service, some nice guests staying, very clean etc rooms, a bit pricey, a little (imho) noisey and I got sick of the "samey" breakfast after a while. Next time I'll find a quiet and far cheaper b&b, but it was a nice memory.
