PS dont get the limo or a taxi if you come from Ciampino on Easy Jet, as they have a bus service that is (euro) 13.75 and drops you off at Termini.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious hospitality”
Reviews.Author: MnKP
Reviews.Content: The Residenza Cellini is clean, comfortable, and relaxing. Barbara and Donato, who run the hotel, are exceptionally responsive and kind. They recommended fantastic (but less well-known and more intimate) restaurants and helped us plan our drive up to Siena. The jacuzzi tub in our room was a welcome luxury after walking throughout the Vatican and climbing all 320 steps up to the Cupola. The included breakfast was far better than any we've had at more expensive and "reputable" hotels. The next time I'm in Rome, this will absolutely be my first choice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful experience”
Reviews.Author: Marcay
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Rome and spent 6 nights at the Residenza Cellini...what a wonderful, small charming luxury hotel. The location to the meto and train station was just great. The rooms were lovely and the service was great. Barbara gave us restaurant recommendations and detailed directions on how to get to them...we were never disappointed. I fell on Easter Sunday and dislocated my shoulder, after a visit to the hospital and continuing my experince of Rome, the next morning I slept very late. The wonderful De Paolis family still had up the Breakfast Buffett for me. I can not say enough about how wonderful this hotel, service, and family were to me during my stay. I am already planning a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Super nice and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: lewishogs
Reviews.Content: In early March, 2005, my husband and I spent 4 nights at Residenza Cellini. It was really nice. The first morning we slept past the breakfast ending time, but as soon as we emerged from our room at 11:00 am, Barbara insisted on making us cappucinos (wow - the best you've ever tasted) and quickly set a fancy breakfast table for us and brought out wonderful danishes, bottled water and orange juice. She was just so very nice. They had a computer available to check email and helped with walking directions to all of the sights (got lost anyway, but that's a different story...). The bed was very comfortable and everything was very clean. The location seemed slightly off the beaten path, but that may be because it was cold and rainy most of the time we were there, so walking was no fun. The neighborhood did feel perfectly safe, however, and the metro station was close by. We had the closest room to the reception area and could clearly hear everything said at the front desk, including when guests returned to the hotel late at night, but there was no street noise. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Brill Brill Brill”
Reviews.Author: JoLiverpool
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel last week 1st to the 3rd March - had a suite room with a jacuzzi bath and was amazing was concerned when booking that it was near to termini and not near any of the sites were were totally misguided on arriving there via the transport arranged through the hotel we were blown away... the hotel is imaculate and the service is out of this world. We managed to walk to most of the sites from the hotel and found the staff at the hotel very friendly - defo try their capuccino they are the best in rome - trying to get my boyfriend to make them back home it just isnt working ha ha They really look after you and make your stay in Rome very memorable

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 10 wonderful days in Rome last June and we send many thanks to the Residenza Cellini for helping to make this the trip of a lifetime. From the incredible cappucino and breakfasts every morning to the comfortable and spacious rooms to the impeccable service, this was a top-notch hotel in all respects and, quite honestly, the best lodging in Europe we had ever stayed in. In our opinion, though, the best part about staying in the Residenza was our gracious hosts, Barbara, Gaetano, and Donato, who always were as friendly, accomodating, and helpful as can be. In fact, the last night of our stay, my husband and I spent most of the evening at the hotel, chatting with Donato about his life, his travels, and his family. Whereas most travellers would be out on the town trying to catch last minute sights, we found this to be the perfect ending to our trip. To make it even more special, Donato presented us with a bottle of Italian wine as a thanks for staying at his hotel. We highly recommend the Residenza Cellini to all travellers visiting Rome and, if you do choose to stay there, please make sure to stop and chat with your hosts: you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico!”
Reviews.Author: jrs
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a month in Italy, and we stayed at the Cellini at the beginning and end of our trip. We loved this hotel!! Barbara and Donato were incredibly helpful. We traveled with our two very young children, and were nevertheless made to feel very much at home. Kudos for service that was truly a cut above!

Reviews.Title: “Will Always Be My Home in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: BethAB
Reviews.Content: What can one write to do justice to a place that feels like home (a well appointed one at that) and people who feel like family? Stay here!! Even if it's a splurge to your travel budget, don't deny yourself the privilege. You won't regret it. A friend and I spent six nights at Residenza Cellini in late January. I knew the proprietors were special people from the very first email correspondence with Donato when booking the room. Barbara, Donato and Gaetano are all dear, dear people. On our arrival, Barbara took us on a "map tour" of the city, told us how the transportation works and gave great hints about which buses to avoid, where to buy certain items we were looking for at the prices the Romans pay (rather than upped tourist prices), and great suggestions for restaurants. The location is convenient and quiet (just around the corner from the intersection of Via Nazionali and Via Torino -- close enough for convenience, but far enough for quiet). The Metro and bus lines of interest are also just around the corner. It's walking distance (easy) to Stazioni Termini (train from the airport and to other destinations in Italy). There are only six rooms, but thankfully, they are working on expanding to a connecting set of rooms, and possibly further in the future. That is a good thing, because more people deserve to experience their wonderful hospitality. On future trips to Rome I wouldn't stay anywhere else, as long as there is a room available at Rezidenza Cellini. What would be the point?!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Penona
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Cellini for 3 nights in mid January. We were very pleased with the hotel - the rooms were spotlessly clean and nicely decorated, the bathrooms and showers were great, the hotel was small and the staff were very friendly. The breakfasts were also great - and the staff were relaxed if you had a late night and wanted to sleep in for a late breakfast! The hotel is very well located for all the sights, but we struggled to find it on the street. It is on the third floor of the building and there is a small plaque outside on the wall - you have to search quite hard in the dark as there is no glaring neon sign! Would thoroughly recommend it - we booked directly and got a great deal by paying in cash.

Reviews.Title: “2 more satisfied guests!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Residenza Celllini in May 2002 before heading to the countryside. Our stay there turned out to be one of the highlights of our 3 week trip. The proprietors were exceptionally warm, gracious and helpful. The accomodations were very tasteful and comfortable and far exceeded our expectations. Our main goal was to rest up after our long flight from the west coast. The bed was certainly the most comfortable we've encountered in our European travels. And the bathroom was a dream come true. I am glad to see from these reviews that there have been many more people after us who have had similar experiences with this outstanding establishment. We already know where we will stay on our next trip to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “It is all true!”
Reviews.Author: Kathy
Reviews.Content: All the positive things you read about this hotel on this site are TRUE! Don't be put off when you drive up and realize the hotel is on the third floor. My husband and I stayed there for seven nights at the end of January celebrating our 32nd wedding anniversary. It was wonderful. The rooms are gigantic by European standards and it was fantastic to have a real shower. The staff of Barbara, Donato and Pietro couldn't have been more helpful from my request for additional towels, to directions and restaurant recommendations. By the way, all the restaurant recommendations were winners, especially Restaurante del Giglio. We ate there twice. The hotel is centrally located and we walked everywhere - even to the Vatican. Barbara sent a beautiful bottle of sparkling wine and snacks to our room on our anniversary evening. The extra touches provided by the staff made this a truly memorable stay. Thank you Residenza Cellini! Feel free to ask me any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Residenza Cellini was fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great time at the Residenza Cellini in Rome. The staff was wonderful - so friendly and accomodating. When Barbara found out that we had met there on my husband's leave from Iraq, she sent champagne and chocolates to our room on our last night there! :) The hotel is in a great location as well - super close to a Metro stop, and within walking distance of the Forum, Colloseum, and other great sights. It's very small - only six rooms - and the staff is there 24/7 to help. Breakfast was good too. We'd recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Donato and Barbara are the wonderful hosts of this charming small hotel. They are very polite and friendly and work incredibly hard to ensure that each of their guests has a nice time in Rome. They made excellent suggestions on what to see and where to dine. The rooms are beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean. The bathroom is very spacious and the spa-bath is just what you need to rejuvenate after sightseeing each day! Breakfast is wonderful, there is a nice selection of juices, pastries and fruit, and the best cappucino that we found in all of Italy! It was my daughters birthday during our stay here, Barbara noticed this and arranged for a bottle of champagne and a tray of chocolates. We highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Miss Barbara and Pietro were the best”
Reviews.Author: Devodoll
Reviews.Content: Thank you for all the tripadvisor reviews that recommended the Cellini in Rome. We had the best service in all of Italy. The owner and her assistants went out of their way to make us feel welcome. They gave us directions to sights with times and recomendations on where to eat. The place has only six rooms so it feels cozy (the other guests were friendly too) but the rooms, the decor and the wonderful breakfast were top of the line. You do get five star service at this three star hotel. "Peter" sets up your traditional Italian buffet breakfast with a great sense of pride. He sets out nothing but the best and the most fresh. Peter will not even grind the coffee beans that go into your espresso until he takes your order. We travelled for two weeks trying to find coffee as good as at the Cellini. He ruined our coffee drinking for us by setting the bar so high. If for nothing else stay for the coffee. The convinient location does not hurt either. Everything we wanted to see was local and the most we traveled was to St. Peters which was less than a 30 min. Metro ride. For New Years we just walked a block and around the corner to the Piazza and toasted 2005 with all the rest of the Italians popping spumanti & their fireworks out in the streets. We had a blast in Rome. It is a fun fast city with lots to see and do. Words cannot explain how pleased we were with our stay at the Cellini. Miss Barbara and her staff were the best hosts and I thank them for creating an oasis for us in such a bussy city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A very special place! My fiancee (now my wife) stayed here for a few days just prior to our marriage in Ravello in September and the staff at the hotel could not have been more wonderful. Barbara, who owns the hotel with her brother, and Peter, the nightshift guy were fantastic. When Barbara and her brother found out we were getting married, they gave us a complimentary bottle of champagne and snacks. There was nothing they wouldn't do to help us. We liked it so much we returned for the last night of our honeymoon. The Residenza Cellini is a clean, comfortable, classy hotel, but what makes it really special for us is our memories of the owners and staff. The next time we go to Rome, we will definitely stay there.

Reviews.Title: “An unexpected delightful retreat.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from two weeks in Italy, ending with a delightful stay at Residenza Cellini. The staff was more than accommodating, professional, warm and friendly. The accommodations ranked right up there as one of the best of the 4-star hotels we stayed at: safe, quiet, very clean, with an excellent breakfast to start a busy day. Residenza Cellini's location provided for easy access to both the Metro and Termini, therefore, all areas of Rome, in addition to being surrounded by great restaurants. We will certainly return. Thank you to Rick Steves for recommending Residenza Cellini.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved the Cellini and would recommend it to anyone visiting Rome. While the standard of the accomodation is very high (the hotel was sompletely renovated 2 years ago) and the location is ideal, the best part of the Cellini are the people who work there - we had the warmest friendliest and most helpful service from everyone we have ever had - anywhere! Book well in advance to stay as long as you can - because there are only 6 rooms, it might not be possible to stay in Cellini for all your stay - and our only tiny quibble is that the hotel Cellini booked for our last night when they couldn't accomodate us was the nearby Hotel Paris which was pretty basic and boring. But the Cellini itself is a small and perfect gem :-)

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel of our two week Italy tour!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 15 night tour of Rome-Florence-Venice-Bolzano-Milan. We arrived in Rome on Tuesday 10/26 and were whisked away from the airport by a very snappy young Italian named Francesco to the Residenza Cellini hotel. Located just off of Via Nazionale about a ten minute walk Southwest from Termini train station, this beautifully appointed space was a treasure. The staff were all exceptionally friendly, the rooms are beautiful, the beds were definitely the best of any we slept in during our trip. With a Rick Steve's discount the room (a junior suite - #3) came to 185 euros a night. Breakfast was included and was also the best we had while in Italy. The lovely older gentleman, Pietro, who normally worked the front desk in the morning was always there with a fresh cup of espresso or cappucino and a warm smile. This place was a delight and I would gladly return in a heartbeat. It is also extremely well located. We were able to walk to just about everywhere in the city we wanted to go. The only place we ended up taking the subway to was the Vatican on the west side of town. Beware of pickpockets in the subways!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute gem”
Reviews.Author: wok
Reviews.Content: A wonderful find! Just 6 rooms, great location within comfortable walking distance of many of the historic sites. Area itself is just off a busy shopping and restaurant area and just 2 minutes from Plaza Republica metro station...yet our room (number 5) was absolutely quiet without any traffic or other noise. The room was modern, well furnished...jaccuzzi bath, CNN & BBC World, mini bar, as well as other touches that you might expect (but not always find) in a much more expensive hotel. Breakfast was delightful with good choice and great coffee. Smiling staff were eager to please and happy to make restaurant and travel suggestions. Unless you want a big hotel lounge, hotel bar and restaurant (which they do not have) it is difficult to see how anyone could possibly find fault with such a delightful place. We stayed 3 nights and would heartily recommend Cellini. Great value compared with usual expensive and often disappointing Rome hotels but this is no budget hotel.....way way above with a quality that is obvious from the moment you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Residenza Cellini is a wonderful oasis in the middle of hectic Roma. The rooms are beautiful, comfortable and spacious but most importantly the DePaolis Family is so very helpful and accomodating. The location is also great and safe and within walking distance of most sights. Train and metro stations are close by too. They will arrange for an airport pickup which we highly recommend. (Friends did a taxi on their own and were charged considerably more.) This is truly one of the nicest places we've ever stayed and it added so much to our Roman holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Residenza Cellini was the perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I never complete 'review' or 'comments' forms when travelling, but the Residenza Cellini warrants an exception. I only hope I'm not shooting myself in the foot by telling others about this marvelous place! My husband and I stayed at RC in late August and early September. It was all and more than we had expected. From the three DePaolis to Pietro, the night concierge who made us our morning coffee to order, we could not have felt more welcomed or pampered. The rooms were truly an oasis -the nicest we had on our whole trip. We both loved the ambience, the privacy, and the sense of security with just six rooms - like the private enclave of a very special hotel. Donato and Gaetano went out of their way to help us with other places to stay out of Rome, car and scooter rentals, though in Rome we primarily walked. The location was perfect for us - outside the fray, but close to metro, buses and the train. Each time we ventured out, we looked forward to returning 'home' knowing the comfort that awaited. Our only disappointment was that we could not stay longer - they were booked! We will definitely go back to Residenza Cellini.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a week in Rome. We decided on Residenza Cellini based upon the reviews and we were delighted with our room, the ambiance of the hotel and the bend-over-backwards niceness and helpfulness of the staff. We have traveled quite a bit and stayed in some extraordinary places, but this really did turn out to be the perfect place to stay in Rome. Although we were concerned about the location, it turned out to be ideal. Not only is it easily accessible to bus and metro lines, the area itself was terrific. We would highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: JudyWob
Reviews.Content: When in Rome, I highly recommend Residenza Cellini. From the moment we walked in, we felt welcome and luxuriously secluded from the noise and hectic pace of Rome. The De Paolis family spoiled us rotten with their hospitality and free 'extras' such as wine and delicious coffee in our room. The suite we had was elegantly decorated and spacious, a welcome change after the matchbox rooms we stayed in in other European cities. The jacuzzi bathtub was just what we needed after a long day of walking around Rome. The breakfast, which was included, was the best we had in Europe. No hard rolls, just delicious fresh croissants, yogurt, fruit and much more. We were within walking distance of the Colosseum, Forum, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon and even the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Spot Away from the Tourist Crowds”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wonderful spot just outside the truly touristy part of Rome. This spot is convenintly located near the metro and major bus routes that take you to the all the must see attractions -- St. Peter's, The Spainsh Steps, Colosseum, etc. In additonal, you could not ask for a more gracious and helpful staff. They were a great help for a first time visitor to Rome. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: jbett1234
Reviews.Content: The owners of the Hotel, the De Paolis family, are THE nicest people in Rome! They will bend over backwards to help you and make sure your stay in Rome is great! I recommend it to all!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The only word to describe our stay at the Cellini in late August is "outstanding". This was our first trip to Rome and the owners did a wonderful job with helping us to find our way around the city and always making us feel welcome. The area is safe and very convenient to the train and bus routes. We threw the customary coins in the Trevi Fountain so that we can return to Roma and upon our return, we will definitely look forward to our repeat stay at the Cellini.

Reviews.Title: “Blissful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All the terrific reviews we had read re this hotel prior to the trip were accurate! This hotel is a treasure and you might be lucky enough to enjoy its treats if you stay here. This is a wonderful hotel, a haven in the midst of chaotic Rome. The staff is very courteous and helpful, from excellent restaurant recommendations, directions, tips, safety concerns, private drivers and even a new screw for my broken curling iron! The breakfast was delightful, with delicious choices. The beautiful rooms were larger than I had hoped. The air conditioning worked here so well (unlike other spots in Italy during a very hot July). The children found it so safe, classy and comfortable. We parents found it so peaceful and charming. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Roma”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Simply the best place to stay in Rome. Small, spotlessly clean, quiet and located near the Metro and great shopping. There are not enough superlatives to describe the staff. They are always available and make extraordinary recommendations for dining and entertainment. They even purchased our opera tickets, which were waiting for us when we returned to Rome. We cannot imagine staying anywhere else in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Best small hotel in Rome. No question.”
Reviews.Author: FromBaltimore
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. It is like a rich friend invited you to stay at his house. The staff is more than helpful, they are genuinely kind. My family and I absolutely loved this Hotel. It is one of the best small hotels I have ever stayed in and I could imagine a better one.

Reviews.Title: “A true oasis in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent 5 days in Rome and stayed at Residenza Cellini. It was an excellent choice. The family-run 6 room elegant hotel was beautifully appointed, restful and impeccably maintained. The family and their two staff, Pietro and Rita, go out of their way to make sure your needs are met. They responded instantaneously to our many questions and requests and were always gracious and incredibly helpful. The hotel is very conveniently located near the metro, buses and sites (within walking distance). I highly recommend the Residenza Cellini.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Residenza Cellini is the place to stay in Rome! If you are looking for a quiet, clean, elegantly furnished, comfortable and spacious room (even by American standards) with very well appointed private bathroom, then look no farther. A warm welcome is just the beginning of a stay in this fine roman hotel. The English speaking Owners (family) and staff of this wonderful 6 room hotel are extremely attentive, courteous and informative. Whether asking for directions, restaurants, sightseeing, trains, buses, drivers, scheduled events, or perhaps just a simple cup of coffee; Barbara, Donato, Gaetano (the owners) and Pietro are patient and insistent that you be well taken care of. A European breakfast awaits you each morning. Meats, cheeses, breads, pastries, cereal, yogurt, fruit and juices are delightful and very substantial. The coffee is made to your individual taste. The location is excellent, one block off the Plaza Republic on a quite side street (Via Modena) near the Ministry of Defense. Well within walking distance to public transportation, trains, churches, museums, restaurants and most of the major attractions. This is truly an intimate and relaxing enclave from the busy streets of Rome. A very pleasurable and memorable stay!

Reviews.Title: “What a find”
Reviews.Author: SpankyFL
Reviews.Content: What more needs to be said. I never expected this size and quality of room in Rome for this price. The staff was wonderful and met every need. Great restaurant recommendations from neighborhoods to first class. Our only problem was we drove to the hotel and turned the car in at the Termini Stazione. It looked easy and really might be, but make sure the directions are very clear as the drive with the mopeds and motorbikes and one way streets do no allow for error. A wonderful find!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Little Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Residenza Cellini is the best little hotel in Rome. Quiet, classy, and well located, this family-owned small hotel exceeded our expectations in every regard. You want for nothing...you are pampered, in a safe location, and get terrific tips and extras from the brothers and sister who own and operate this tiny gem. We were actually sad to leave, but we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Short of Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the Hotel Cellini was nothing short of perfect! Every ascpect of the hotel was amazing. The breakfasts, tremendously helpful staff, location, access to an internet-ready laptop, etc were beyond our expectations. The staff helped have our "lost" luggage delivered from the airport. They graciously provided my wife and I with champagne, cookies, and roses for our honeymoon. They consistently made sure we were satisfied with every aspect of our stay. The location allowed us a short 10-20 minute walk to most all of the important sites of Rome, and also a three minute walk to the Metro for all other sites, like the Vatican. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonerful! Wonderful! Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This serene, immaculate, cheerful, central spot is a priviledge to stay at! The Owner family are charming, you could eat off the floor it is so clean and as a woman traveling alone it is more secure than any other venue I know about.

Reviews.Title: “I love it”
Reviews.Author: cal-rdh
Reviews.Content: How can I count the ways? It is beautiful, elegant and sparkling clean with gracious and warm family owners and staff. We had excellent breakfasts every morning where we enjoyed visiting with the other happy guests. Truly an incomparable experience!

Reviews.Title: “Cellini, Elegant Oasis in Rome”
Reviews.Author: jortris
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate enough to be the guests of Barbara, Donato, and Gaetano, the charming owners of Residenza Cellini. The Cellini is truly a beautiful oasis in Rome. No picture can do it justice because its ambiance of grace, charm, and luxury perpetuated by Barbara, Donato, and Gaetano has to be experienced. Pietro, Cellini's night porter, is the epitome of an Italian gentleman who answered questions, helped us in any way he could, and treated guests to an exquisite breakfast each morning. The location is an excellent pivit point to all that Rome and its environs has to offer. We were delighted with the guidance that we were given each day. The Cellini, which has all the modern conveniences, still maintains an antique atmosphere. We have visited hot, crowded Rome several times; however, this time our trip was absolutely wonderful because we could return each afternoon to the welcoming, cool elegance of Residenza Cellini.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: TexasKrysia
Reviews.Content: Could not have been happier staying anywhere else. Barbara and her brothers along with Poetro do absolutely everything to make your stay perfect. Rooms are lovely and decorated very tastefully, the staff really assisted with everything (even helping me progam my cell phone with an Italian calling number!) This will always be my stop in Rome, actually may go out of my way to stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: AndreaOlympia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I ended our month-long delayed honeymoon w/ 4 days in Rome, and loved staying w/ the charming hosts of Residenza Cellini. They were all extremely helpful and friendly, and our room was clean and comfortable. The location is terrific, easy walking or metro to everywhere in downtown Rome. We would definitely stay there again when in Rome...

HotelInfo.Name: Residenza Cellini
HotelInfo.Address: Via Modena 5, 00184 Rome, Italy
